experience which will allow you to go deep inside of a
never told story about this annual ritual subscribed in 2008 to the UNESCO
intangible cultural heritage list. This simple question may be the main idea to peer inside one of the most
world´s widely known cultural celebrations.  I find that most of the time,
people only can see the surface of this amazing event. During the last
6 months I have been working to produce a contemporary
photographic artwork to let the world know why this Mexican celebration is an
important human cultural heritage.CELEBRATING LIFE
TROUGH ART
A very pure and
clear message for those who have lost a friend, brother, sister, child, or
parent to understand the deep vision about a celebration of life and honor to dead ones.
I will be using different
artistic techniques such as: Art Installation, body paint, motion photography, light painting and
the traditional materials used in this ritual to compose and capture a very
unique and contemporary photographic collection, sharing it trough a large
scale outdoor fine art exhibition in San Miguel de Allende in November 2015. 

FEAR, LOVE, SADNESS, JOY, ANGER, PEACE
I believe that life is something awesome, but
sometimes it's hard to face our own path in life.
The Day of The Dead celebration offers something really important for every
human’s life and I want to help to understand and share it in several ways of
art. We are working to make this happen in four
artistic expressions, created with the support of a great team of people
conformed by Mexican and international artists, professional consulters,
designers, activist and networkers.  

EXPRESSION#1
We will set up  a human installation experience, In a local event, in San Miguel de Allende, Mexico. We’ll produce a unique fine art photographic footage and capture “THE DAY OF THE DEAD EMOTIONS” to create the new large scale collection. Using human body models, a professional team of body painters, illumination staff, digital film equipment and artistic installation design.

 EXPRESSION#2


We will film during the human installation event 
to make a short movie of theTHE
DAY OF THE DEAD EMOTIONS including a
“making of” video that we’ll share this amazing human experiencearound the world on our social
networks like vimeo and youtube,
A neverbefore seenscenario of this celebration.


 When?
Expression #1 and #2, will take place in San
Miguel de Allende at the same time in the same place in October 18, 2015. Our first Goal to make it happen: $3,200 USD


 EXPRESSION#3

Set up the ten 4x7 feet large scale photos in a
stunning outdoor exhibition DAY
OF THE DEAD EMOTIONS in a special
venue in San Miguel de Allende, Mexico. And share it with visitors from all
over the world.November 1st, 2015. 
Our second Goal to make it happen: $3,000 USD 





EXPRESSION#4
4.- Printing the first 200 edition book with the
photographic footage to share  ten years of one life in a deep dive into  the artistic and cultural universe around the Day of The Dead in
Michoacán, the state where this celebration remains alive and deeply rooted
with the authentic prehispanic ritual.
 Our third Goal to make it happen: $2,700
USD 


When? 
This artwork piece will be ready to
publishing in December 15, and delivery approximate in February or earlier is
you choose an express delivery company.



VITAL ENERGY TO WORK 
You may agree this is something huge and you are
right.  We are working with different professional and experienced teams
to reach our goals. We believe in the value of the human work and we are
respecting the fees that collaborator teams are asking
to keep all on track and doing well.  We are confident in the results of
this never before done special artwork, and the quality that we will offer to
our supporters and to thousands of people; this is the total price of each
expression:
Expression
#1  $1,500 
Expression #2  $1,700
Expression
#3  $3,000 
Expression
#4  $2,700
PLUS INDIEGOGO, PAYPAL AND MONEY EXCHANGE FEES 10%
TOTAL: $9,790 USD

TAKE A LOOK BEYOND THE FOG WALL AND LET SHINE YOUR IMAGINATION.Where does the money go? This is a complete journey and there is a talented team behind of it. Support us and you will get exclusive details and updates about the production of every different expression; all the each contributors will receive a newsletter every week to keep you in the light.  You also can stay connected to Jesus Alexandre Arts facebook page and be updated about events, photos, special presentations and how we are creating a stunning exhibition with your support and spirit of contribution.
What we need and what you get.
We want to spread an international and eclectic way to see this amazing
cultural event and share with the world a beautiful way to celebrate life. To reach every artistic expression goal we need to pay the production
fees of each event and the support team. Contribute to
this campaign and you will get an original piece of this fine and unique
artwork. Contribute more and receive the coffee table photo book and allow yourself or someone important for you to get a luminiscent view of life.


The Mysterious Photo Index:
This is a pre-sale of the new photographic
artwork collection that will be shot in San Miguel de Allende, Mexico
on October 18 during a Human Installation event directed by Jesus
Alexandre. The Mysterious Photo Index will be the best artistic photographic work selected so far by the artist.  October 24, 2015 our
contributor will  receive  an email titled THE MYSTERIOS PHOTO INDEX  to choose the printed photo they want. Also you can see part of the Day of The Dead Origins Photo Index here.
THE TEAM, A MULTICULTURAL MOVEMENT
We are so proud to work with a great Mexican and
international team and network, and this network is growing up exponentially
because we believe in the talent and spirit of the people who is around us
working, and inspiring to grow together. 
Join us in this Journey, we will be glad to have you
visit our web page www.jesusalexandre.com to take a look about this campaign, team members, information about the
artist, and the spirit of Michoacan foundation. 

AND REMEMBER IF YOU CAN´T CONTRIBUTE MONEY, YOU CAN
HELP US WITH YOUR SPIRIT OF COLLABORATION SHARING THIS CAMPAIGN WITH THE PEOPLE THAT
YOU KNOW COULD BE INTERESTED IN THE DAY OF THE DEAD, SKULL FANS, THANATOLOGISTS,
ANTHROPOLOGISTS,  ART COLLECTORS,PHOTOGRAPHERS OR
SIMPLY SOMEONE WHO NEEDS TO LET GO THE PAST AND ENJOY THE PRESENT.  
THANK YOU!
 JSUS ALXNDRE

story:
"Found" - A Different Direction. 

A surrealist photographic Journey into the Welsh landscape.


My Name is Andrew Simon. for the past 8 years i have been a practicing photographer working in the portraiture and fashion industry. 

What a lot of people don't realize is i am also a passionate landscape photographer. A part of my work i rarely share online and on social networking sites. But a part of me that drives my fashion work and inspires me on a daily basis. 

Which leads me to why i am starting this funding campaign. As well as being a photographer, for the past 2 years i have also been studying for a HND qualification in Graphic design. Part of which for my final major project i am producing a book of my landscape photography work. What was originally going to be just a single published book for the project, early on i saw the potential to make something more, something bigger. Hence the subtitle of the book " A Different Direction" 



What i want to do is move into a different direction with my photography. To continue on with my commercial fashion work, but to do more landscape and fine art work. Some of the photography work has already taken place which you can see as part of this campaign, and over the next 6 weeks i shall be travelling back and forth to North Wales, where all of the photography is being created.



The book itself will be a mix of surrealist abstract landscapes. From the mountains, to the forests, The river and lakes to the desolate beauty of the Welsh countryside. All of the work has meaning, it is meant to be absorbed slowly. All photographs will be taken digitally using a "Lensbaby" Lens which creates beautifully blurry, smeared images with a sharp point of focus in some cases, in others, using custom bokeh filters to create unusual semi formed shapes. This is not a traditional landscape book, it is something different, and something beautiful. 


So why this campaign? 

Firstly and foremost, for me to be able to launch the book, and potentially an exhibition in the summer, i need the funding to do so. In the perks section one of them is a pre-order for the book itself, this will give me a good idea of the amount that need to be produced. Obviously the more pre-orders the cheaper it will cost to get the book itself into print. The current production costs for a 40 page landscape format book will be around £20 hence the pre-order price of £30. I am not looking to make a profit on the book itself, just to cover my overheads and associated costs. 



The funding campaign will also aid me to purchase more photography equipment, especially the lensbaby system i will be using to create this book, as well as to invest in a large format printer, paper and frames for the exhibition i will be planning for the summer of this year. 

There is also a very personal reason behind publishing this book, last summer my father Ken Simon was diagnosed with pancreatic cancer at the age of 61. Sadly it was caught at a late stage and treatment options were limited. He passed away on the 27th October 2014, 1 week after his and my mums wedding anniversay whilst in the care of St Giles Hospice in Walsall. 

My dad has always been a big believer in my photography, even when i have not been, he has always been supportive and always interested to see what work i have been doing, both with my fashion work, but especially with my landscape and fine art work. Whenever we spoke on the phone or i saw him he always wanted to see what work i had been doing and did, i would like to think, appreciate my work. 

As such this book is dedicated to him and will be in his memory. During his last few weeks we spoke at length about me carrying on as a photographer and he said many time how proud he was of me, and to carry on and create amazing work. So this project is to honour him in that way. As well as this, a percentage of the profit of the book, as well as the funding campaign will be donated to St Giles Hospice in Walsall. Their support and care was second to none, they made him and all of his family so comfortable during his stay and when he passed away there, i want to do something to give back to them. So by doing this, it is my thank you to them, and to hopefully raise some much needed money for the Hospice in the process. 



To read more on the project visit my website on www.darkslidephotography.co.uk or on my facebook pages

www.facebook.com/darkslidephoto

www.facebook.com/andrewsimonphotography?fref=ts

story:
WildScene is an exhibition of Falmouth Univeristy students' largest projects of their lives so far. Specialising in Marine and Natural History photography, the work shown will be diverse and driven by the students' passions for everything from conservation to conceptual art. 

The money raised will pay for the exhibiting space at M Shed, Bristol, advertising, catering, and printing. 


         

         

         



Join us on our journey to Bristol by following us on social media!

Specialising in Marine and Natural History photography, the work shown will be diverse and driven by the students' passions for everything from conservation to conceptual art. The money raised will pay for the exhibiting space at M Shed, Bristol, advertising, catering, and printing.                            Join us on our journey to Bristol by following us on social media!

story:
Summary

Hi there! My name is Denise but many know me as Rain.  I've been an aspiring plus-size model for a while but I've never had the confidence to do anything real until I started on social media about a year ago.

My followers and fans have given me such a confidence boost and in turn I've also received several messages from woman I've helped inspire through my amateur modelling and body acceptance. I want to make a calendar for my fans, for body positivity and to also help establish me as a (semi) real model. I've always liked showing off my "assets" but I feel you can be sexual and tasteful.

Your support is greatly appreciated.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I'm looking to raise $1000 to print and ship 50 calendars, I'd love to be able to do more though.
  • Perks available include signed prints from me, drawings by me, digital picture sets, bras/underwear, skype dates, and of course - the calendar itself, once completed.
  • All funds gathered will go towards production and photographer costs. 
  • All digital perks will be sent out within a week of your contribution
  • All perks to be shipped (not including calendars) will be sent out in March
  • All perks with calendars will be sent out in May after they are produced.

The Impact

  • This project is important to me in establishing an idea of if I could possibly be successful in the field of modelling at all.
  • I also love to inspire other plus size women who might feel they're not sexy or beautiful because of their curves, I want to show that big women can feel sexy.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share this campaign, get the word out to other body positive people or fans of plus size girls. :)
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
What We Need & What You Get

I need to get 20 of my photos printed in sizes ranging from 11 x 14 to 16 x 20. I also need to frame each of these pictures.

Once I have gotten the pictures printed and framed, I will be able to put them up for sale in the business where they will stay for 1-2 months or until sold. If enough money is raised I will also be able to make some smaller prints (that will be without frames) to sell at this business or other locations.   
After I have made some sales, I will be able to thank all of my donors with a print of their very own! 

The Impact

Two years ago when I decided that I wanted to become a professional photographer, I began honing in on my skills. Now that I feel prepared to really start in the professional world, I need to get my foot in the door. Unfortunately, my circumstances have not allowed me to set aside money for hard copies of my photographs. With this first chance to have my photography displayed, I hope to really jump into my career as a photographer. I have already done the album artwork for a local band, but hard copies of my photography is a must at this next starting point in my career. 

Website 

Instagram

story:
Photo by Laylah Amatullah Barrayn

 Photo by Laylah Amatullah Barrayn

Photo by Thomas Sayers Ellis

Photo by Thomas Sayers Ellis


Photo by Rachel Eliza Griffiths


Photo by Marcia E. Wilson

 

Photo by Marcia E. Wilson

 


Dear Friends & Family,

I've taken on the wonderful, yet challenging opportunity to curate a group photography exhibition that features Brooklyn-based photographers: Layah Amatullah Barrayn, Thomas Sayers Ellis, Rachel Eliza Griffith and myself, Marcia E. Wilson.  The exhibit, Provocateurs: The Symbiotic Relationship Between Photographers and Writers, will be in conjunction with 2016 National Black Writer Conference.

The National Black Writers Conference (NBWC) is a biennial public program that provides writers, scholars, literary professionals, students, and the general public with a forum for expanding their knowledge and reading of Black literature and for engaging in dynamic and spirited conversations, panel discussions, readings, workshops and performance on conference themes, and on future trends in the literature of Black Writers.

The NBWC is a component of the Center of Black Literature at Medgar Evers College whose mission is to expand, broaden, and enrich the public knowledge and aesthetic appreciation of the value of Black Literature and the literary works produced by people of the African Diaspora. The center is one of only two centers in the country dedicated to doing the work of creating “spaces” in which to document the writing and work of Black writers, to study the craft of writing, and to expose a cross-generation of students and the general public to a range of writers throughout the African Diaspora.  

For those who attended a NBWC or any of the Center for Black Literature’s events have, at the very least, received the invigorating experience of meeting, listening and talking to literary heroes such as Toni Morrison, Alice Walker, Amiri Baraka, Sonia Sanchez, Walter Mosley, Quincy Troop, Ishmael Reed, Jacqueline Woodson, Derek Walcott, Bernice McFadden, Sapphire et al.  Storytellers of the African diaspora who incites, inform and inspire.

In conjunction with the 2016 NWBC a photography group exhibit called Provocateurs: The Symbiotic Relationship Between Photographers and Writers will be presented in the Charles Evans Innis Memorial Library at Medgar Evers College @ CUNY. The use of the word “provocateurs” as the title, serves the belief that both writers and photographers use their art form to evoke a visceral action or reaction in the minds of both readers and viewers. Images can inspire words for a poem, be a spark for a novel, or serve as the visual interpretation for an essay, in a similar manner, words can influence the mood for a painting or a photograph.

To express the exhibit's theme the images captured by our featuring artists: Portrait and documentary photographer Laylah Amatullah Barrayn's breathtaking, vibrant, cultural images of an Islamic community in Senegal, Africa; Poet/educator/photographer Thomas Sayers Ellis's captivating,  storytelling ironies captured in America; Poet/educator/photographer/filmmaker Rachel Eliza Griffiths' riveting, poetic fine art portraits; and myself, free-lance photographer Marcia E. Wilson's portraits of literary heroes et al of African descent - will serve to present the linkage poets and novelists of African descent and their photographer counterparts share in rendering the Black experience and historical narratives. 

The exhibit will be up from March 1 through April 29, 2016 (opening reception March 28.).

In order for the Provocateurs to be a part of 2016 National Black Writers Conference (March 30, through April 3) I will need to raise $5,000.  I have applied for a Brooklyn Arts Council grant and if approved the funding will arrive during or after the scheduled date for the show to open on March 1st.  Thus, I have chosen to reach out to my family, friends and associates for assistance, which I know is bad timing with the approaching holidays, but I'm hoping that with your help I can, at the very least,  print, frame and mat all the images, and market the exhibition to ensure the proper reach throughout the community.

Please help me to meet the goal to have Provocateurs: The Symbiotic Relationship Between Photographers and Writers exhibition to be an integral  part of the 2016 National Black Writers Conference, a conference that is necessary and vital to our communities and our future generations.

Any amount you can contribute will be deeply appreciated.


Appreciating your time, love and support.
Marcia

Any amount you can contribute will be deeply appreciated. 
Appreciating your time, love and support.Marcia

story:
About the Artist


Hello, hello! I'm Johnny, Johnny Tang! I'm an emerging photographer based in Brooklyn, NY. I got into photography because I'm not very good at much else, but I'm pretty good at photography! I'm looking raise funds for a solo exhibition at a Hiphop lifestyle store called Reed Space, in New York's Lower East Side neighborhood.

My work so far has been exhibited in numerous cities domestically and abroad including: Boston, Miami, Atlanta, and Hong Kong. Recent exhibitions include: World of One at Emmanuelle College in Boston, and the 2015 MassArt Auction. This will be my first solo show in New York.


The Project

Since 2011 I have collaborated with some of the country's best street dancers (mostly BBoys and Poppers) on a series of portraits I call "BBoy Monsters".  By taking a base move or stance and combining it with multiple variations, we build an image that further exaggerates each dancer’s signature moves, poses, and/or characteristics. 

These portraits celebrate the creative achievements of these dancers (and the culture of Hiphop as a whole), while also making it more accessible for outsiders to appreciate. Your contributions will help me bring this work to a wider audience, and help spread the positive influence of hiphop.


What I Need

Most of the work for the exhibition is already finished. That is to say I have images to show, but I need funds to get them printed, make promotional materials, and hire a DJ to play the proper music for the dancers at my opening reception. 

The majority of the funding will go towards printing the work, and also to ensure donors will receive their perks. 

Here's how the costs break down:

  • Printing 36.8%
  • Perk Production + Shipping 25.3%
  • DJ - 14.75%
  • Incidentals - 13.33%
  • Indiegogo + Processing fees - 8.26%
  • Promotional Materials - 1.49%

If the entire goal is not reached, I will use what funds are available to fulfill perks for what pledges are made, using what is leftover to help relieve the cost of printing for the show. 

If we surpass the goal, the extra funds will go towards offering more perks and promotional materials for the show.

What you get


Postcards!

Get a limited edition postcard of BBoy Monster El Nino - Facegrab of Death (see image for postcard above), signed and hand numbered by the artist . Each postcard will also include a personalized message thanking you for your support!! Your name will also appear on the list of donors displayed next to the work at the exhibition.
Limited supply of 100, ships anywhere in the world!


Posters!

Get a signed 20" x 16" limited edition wall posters, featuring the image "BBoy Monster: Baldi, Two-Heads" (see image above). Your name will also appear on the list of donors displayed next to the work at the exhibition.

Limited supply of 25, ships anywhere in the world!


See Behind the Scenes

Come hang out with me on a shoot and see the creative process!!! Your name will also appear on the list of donors displayed next to the work at the exhibition,and will be read aloud by myself at the opening reception.


Private Shoot

Have your portrait taken in the style of a BBoy Monster!! Ever dreamed of all the extra things you could do with an extra limb? Now we can make it a photographic reality!! No dancing skills required for this one! 

You will also receive an 8" x 10" fine art print of your final image. and your name will also appear on the list of donors displayed next to the work at the exhibition, and will be read aloud by myself at the opening reception. (NYC only) 


17" x 24" Exhibition Print

Receive a 17" x 24" glycee print of your choice from the works exhibited at the BBoy Monsters show. All 17" x 24" glycee prints are in a limited edition of 10. In other words ONLY 10 of them will ever exist, and the one you get will have been publicly exhibited in NYC!!! Your name will also appear on the list of donors displayed next to the work at the exhibition, and will be read aloud by myself at the opening reception.


The Impact

If successful, we will be able to introduce the BBoy subculture to a new audience of art and photography lovers, and maybe even get some Hiphop enthusiasts interested in some art as well. The majority of the work is already done, I just need a little bit of help for the final push.


Risks & Challenges

Raising the money to print this work, actually is the biggest challenge at this stage of the project. I have already picked out a professional printer to make the prints, with whom I have worked with exclusively for the past 3 years. The showcards, postcards, and posters are 90% finished and almost ready for production. I have also spoken with a number of local DJ's about spinning at the opening, and am confident I will be able to find the right person. To keep costs low, I will also be hanging the work unframed. 

All that's left is to place the orders and put the work into production.


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Post this campaign to your facebook or twitter via the links below. Share this work with a friend! Maybe even have some of them donate on your behalf!!

We are combining the worlds of BBoys with Fine Art and the collision is going to be beautifully surreal.

If you happen to be in New York City on May 14th, please come to the opening of the show:

BBoy Monsters @Reed Space
151 Orchard St
New York, NY 10002

May 14, 2016 
4:00-7:00PM 

If all goes well, we will have art, music and dancing for all to enjoy!
story_txt:
About the Artist


Hello, hello! I'm Johnny, Johnny Tang! I'm an emerging photographer based in Brooklyn, NY. I got into photography because I'm not very good at much else, but I'm pretty good at photography! I'm looking raise funds for a solo exhibition at a Hiphop lifestyle store called Reed Space, in New York's Lower East Side neighborhood.
My work so far has been exhibited in numerous cities domestically and abroad including: Boston, Miami, Atlanta, and Hong Kong. Recent exhibitions include: World of One at Emmanuelle College in Boston, and the 2015 MassArt Auction. This will be my first solo show in New York.


The Project
Since 2011 I have collaborated with some of the country's best street dancers (mostly BBoys and Poppers) on a series of portraits I call "BBoy Monsters".  By taking a base move or stance and combining it with multiple variations, we build an image that further exaggerates each dancer’s signature moves, poses, and/or characteristics. 
These portraits celebrate the creative achievements of these dancers (and the culture of Hiphop as a whole), while also making it more accessible for outsiders to appreciate. Your contributions will help me bring this work to a wider audience, and help spread the positive influence of hiphop.   
What I Need Most of the work for the exhibition is already finished. That is to say I have images to show, but I need funds to get them printed, make promotional materials, and hire a DJ to play the proper music for the dancers at my opening reception. 
The majority of the funding will go towards printing the work, and also to ensure donors will receive their perks. 
Here's how the costs break down:

Printing 36.8%

Perk Production + Shipping 25.3%
DJ - 14.75%
Incidentals - 13.33%
Indiegogo + Processing fees - 8.26%
Promotional Materials - 1.49%


If the entire goal is not reached, I will use what funds are available to fulfill perks for what pledges are made, using what is leftover to help relieve the cost of printing for the show. 
If we surpass the goal, the extra funds will go towards offering more perks and promotional materials for the show.



What you get
   
Postcards!





Get a limited edition postcard of BBoy Monster El Nino - Facegrab of Death (see image for postcard above), signed and hand numbered by the artist . Each postcard will also include a personalized message thanking you for your support!! Your name will also appear on the list of donors displayed next to the work at the exhibition.

story:
Allgemeine Beschreibung

*** PayPal Benutzer folgen bitte diesem Link: PayPal via cuerography.com***
***Information for Supporters outside Germany, Switzerland and Austria below***

Hi mein Name ist Cyrill und in der Cosplay Foto- & Videoszene nennt man mich cuerography.

Ich habe schon seit einiger Zeit den Drang gute Cosplayer zu besuchen und an guten Orten, auch im Ausland, zu shooten. Ich bin Fotostudent und daher fehlt mir meistens das Geld für einen Flug oder Autokosten und deshalb kann ich grössere Projekte nicht realisieren.

Ich wünsche mir und fände es super spannend, wenn ich mit Sponsorenhilfe die Möglichkeit erhalten würde Themenbasierte Shootings durchzuführen.

Die gespendeten Gelder werden für die Deckung der Spesenkosten, Material- und Produzierkosten der Perks sowie Versand aufgewendet.
 

Was bedeutet themenbasierte Shootings?
Themenbasierte Shootings bedeutet, dass ich mein Shooting einem bestimmten Thema widme. Das Thema kann die möglichst detailgetreue Darstellung eines Charakters sein, aber in Zukunft auch ethische Probleme oder gesellschaftliche Themen anstossen. Dies wird von Projekt zu Projekt unterschiedlich sein. Jeder soll für sich selbst entscheiden, ob das Projekt einem zusagt und wie sehr man es unterstützen möchte

Ein Shooting wird immer aus Fotos und Video(s) bestehen, sofern nicht anders deklariert.
 

Xayah & Rakan: The Project

Im Fall von Xayah und Rakan geht es mir um die möglichst genaue stimmungsvolle Darstellung. Ich möchte ein Bildband schaffen, bei dem man die Charaktere wiedererkennt. Ich bediene mich da am offiziellen Xayah & Rakan Cinematic von Riot Games.

Xayah:
Xayah wird von Calisto gecosplayed. Ihre Cosplays sind bestimmt schon Einigen bekannt und ich bin die Zusammenarbeit mit ihr gewohnt und vertraut. Besucht ihr Facebook um euch von ihrer Arbeit zu überzeugen.
Hier ein Beispiel meiner Zusammenarbeit mit ihr:

Rakan:
Rakan wird von QueenTitania gecosplayed. Sie ist mir neu jedoch bin ich begeistert von ihren Arbeiten und freue mich auf eine erfolgreiche Zusammenarbeit. Besucht ihr Twitter um euch von ihrer Arbeit zu überzeugen.

 

Beispiele

Lua Cosplay
Bisher habe ich das zwei Mal unternehmen können. Einmal mit Lua Cosplay und ihrer Sejuani. Wir sind zusammen auf den eiskalten Berg hochgefahren und haben fotografiert und gefilmt was das Zeug hält.


MiuMoonlight
Ein anderes Mal habe ich das mit MiuMoonlight Cosplay machen können. Sie ist mit ihrem Freund ein Wochenende nach Zürich gefahren und wir haben so viele Cosplays wie möglich innerhalb von 2 Tagen geshootet.


Dies war beide Male auf Kosten des Cosplayers und ich bin auch weiterhin offen für solche Anfragen, allerdings hätte ich selber auch gerne die Möglichkeit solche Initiativen zu starten.

Beim ersten Projekt dieser Art komme ich nun für die Kosten auf, doch ich erhoffe mir währenddessen und im Nachhinein auf Support. Ich möchte auch klar andeuten, dass das Geld für die Shootings und Produktion der Rewards eingesetzt werden. Ich habe nicht vor damit meinen Lebensunterhalt oder neues Material oder sonst was zu finanzieren.
 

Supporter from another country?

***Information for Supporters outside Germany, Switzerland and Austria***
What if you live outside of Germany, Switzerland or Austria?
I can't really ship worldwide, because the Value of the perks are calculated.

What if you still want to support me?
Make sure to pass me a message here, on facebook, or via Mail: contact@cuerography.com

story:
Presenting

A Black Actress - An Exhibition

 

 

 

A BFI study researching the representation of Black Actors in UK film showed that from 2006 to 2016 only 5 women out of the total of 15 Black actors had played two or more lead roles and with demand for seeing representation in front and behind the camera, the push for diversity is at an all-time high,

This exhibition aims to fulfil that need. As a showcase for the diversity of Black women on screen and on stage it is a chance for us to celebrate the Black women.  

Black women who are working to better the representation we see and highlighting the beauty of Black womanhood.

 

 

With each actress bringing their own personality and style to help create these stunning images, the result is a reflection of the wealth of beauty within Black womanhood. One that we don't often see.

Lolly Adefope, Joan Iyiola, Jade Anouka, Jennifer Saayeng, Amara Okereke, Vanessa Vanderpuye, Susan Wokoma, Gemma Knight Jones, Tamara Lawrance, Ashley Bannerman, Faith Alabi, Adele Oni

 

 

 

 

"It’s a new archive of our presence. And it is gorgeous."

   Tamara Lawrance - Award winning actress

 

Having started the project through self funding, and working to secure grant funding, I am asking for contributions towards showcasing the work already created.

In supporting the A Black Actress exhibition you will be part of the conversation in changing the perceptions of how we see and celebrate Black women. A successful exhibit such as this  will be a springboard to create further works around Black female representation in other UK sectors not just the arts.

Help showcase A Black Actress to the worl .

With a goal of £7,500 your contribution goes towards:

  • The printing and framing of the art work.
  • Securing a gallery space befitting of the portraits and it’s sitters 
  • The installation and deinstalling of the prints work.
  • Creating a memorable opening night that is open to the public. 
  • Ensuring the exhibition will be open for one week in a central London location

 

Don’t worry if you are unable to make a financial contribution to help reach this goal. Here are a few other ways you can support:

You can share the #ABlackActress hashtag on your social media platforms; including  Twitter, Facebook and Instagram. Amplify to your friends and family and help get the word out.

Follow on Instagram: @a_black_actress   /  Twitter: @a_black_actress

Subscribe at www.ablackactress,com to keep up to date with what's happening.

 

 

In appreciation for supporting and contributing you can receive the following perks.

10x8 Art Print

11 x14 Signed Art Print

A Limited Edition Coffee Table Book

A Studio Portrait shoot 

 

 

 

And last but not least without the initial creative team - who passionately and humbly shared their time and expertise this project would have not come as far.

So I want to say a big thank you to them and to you for helping bring "A Black Actress" to life

 

The Creative Team Behind The Looks:

Lauraine Bailey has worked in the creative industry as a Fashion Stylist & Hair Stylist for several years. Her skills have been developed through Advertising, TV & Film, Music, E-commerce and Editorial print. Experienced in both women's & menswear, still-life and interior styling, Lauraine works to a high standard paying much attention to detail.

Jane Sinclair is a professional make up artist and bespoke beauty specialist, whose work appears regularly in Tatler and Hello! Her prestigious list of celebrity and society clients is testimony to her skill of bringing out the absolute best in everyone, without them ever looking ‘made up’.

Claire Degraft a 15 year veteran with work that often appears in top fashion publications including Tatler, Harpers Bazaar, Elle, Vogue to name a few. She has worked with an extensive list of celebrities, public personalities, international designers, as well as heading various LFW fashion shows as head makeup artist. 

Sam Lascelle displays a strong intuitive passion as a Makeup Artist and with over 10 years of experience in the industry. She is self taught and continually developing creatively; Sam has worked for a world renowned cosmetics brand, where she became a part of their Pro Team and Artist Relations department, representing and showcasing her skills.

Edyta Betka a professional nail artist she has worked on major fashion shows during London Fashion Week for the likes of  Alice Temperly and Emilia Wickstead as well as having work published in magazines such as Marie Claire and Wonderland to name a few.

 

 

 

A Little About Me...

“A Black Actress” was shot and curated by myself, Shonay Shote. I’m a London based fashion and beauty photographer, with over 10 years’ experience in the industry working in online and print media. As a Black woman, I have been privileged to have my work featured in Pride magazine, and shoot with film and fashion personalities including Leomie Anderson, and Melanie Liburd. I am working to help create better representations of Black women in the visual arts. I went into photography to create a sense of beauty in the world through my own lens and hope this project reflects that.

Film Credits: Blue Sera Productions / Genuine Outrageous Design

Music by Quincas Moreira Genre

story:
About the Camino de Santiago

Camino de Santiago is a religious pilgrimage that people have been taking for over 1400 years. It is a spiritual trek that begins at your doorstep, winds through several trails in France, Spain, and Portugal, ultimately ending in the City of Santiago de Compostela. Legend has it that the bones of St. James the Martyr were spirited away from Jerusalem after his beheading and brought to Finis Terre, in Roman Spain  and eventually buried in the Basilica of Santiago de Compostela. These remains are what have drawn millions of people from all over the world to seek religious and spiritual enlightenment through prayer and hardship.

A Little Bit About Me

I originally titled my book, “An Old Fat Man on the Camino…” because that is how I see myself. These are not self-deprecating thoughts they are just who I am. I am 57 years old, 5’10” tall, and weigh 245 lbs. (178cm and 110 kilos). I have had 7 knee surgeries, one joint replacement, inner ear surgery, and surgery on one elbow. I also suffer from chronic bronchitis, which sucks because I have never smoked. Why am I telling you this? Because, despite all of my physical problems, I have still been able to hike the entire length of the Camino Frances 500 miles (800km) across Northern Spain.

My book is an invitation for every person that dreams of walking the Camino de Santiago but are afraid that they do not have the physical abilities to complete such a task -- to get off their backsides and just go. Trust me, even if you are not able to finish, even if you can only walk a few days or weeks, you will neither regret nor forget the Camino. I have since changed the title of the book to “Stories of A Wayward Pilgrim….” Because, well, it sounds less self-deprecating, but it is just another way that I see myself. I have always been a “wayward” soul, never lost but just kind of moving in my own direction at my own pace.

“Stories of A Wayward Pilgrim, St Jean Pied de Port to Santiago Compostela” is not a guidebook. It has no great spiritual insights. It is the daily stories of one man’s simple, and quite ordinary, adventures of an extraordinary journey on the Camino de Santiago. These stories are accompanied by 200 photographs of the people I met, the places I visited, and the things I saw. Maybe we can call it a photo-journal. Regardless, I hope you enjoy reading it as much as I have enjoyed producing it.

Short Summary of Funding

I have a two-prong plan for “The Stories of a Wayward Pilgrim….”: First is to gather funds for a high-quality and affordable printing of the book. Your pre-orders will make this possible. I have put in over two years of my life into the production of this book. Forty days and 500 miles of hiking and taking photographs of the Camino de Santiago, in Spain. Two separate trips, one in the spring and another in the fall to gather all of my photographs and stories. I spent countless weeks writing my stories and editing my photographs. Then, I took on the daunting task of learning how to design a book and the programs that would allow this design. ‘If there was a mistake, I made it’, is not an understatement. I designed the book three times, once as an eBook and twice as printed books. Countless edits in all the process ensued. But, now it is complete, and I think this project deserves a high-quality printing.

My second part of the plan is a sequel, or maybe a prequel, to the first book. My second journey will be the 500 miles of trails that proceed the Camino de Santiago. The Via Podiensis, in France, is one of a number of routes that the French would take to get to Spain and on to Santiago de Compostela. The primary difference of the hike, other than the country, is that I will be better prepared to both photograph and write this book. “Stories of A Wayward Pilgrim, France, Le Puy-en-Valez to St Jean Pied de Port”.

Your pre-orders will guarantee you copies of the books and the included portfolio images. The remaining funds will allow me to start the prequel. Your pre-orders for “St Jean…to …Santiago”, will be delivered in 4 to 6 weeks after the conclusion of the initial campaign and on a regular basis thereafter. I am projecting that “Le Puy-en-Valez” will be ready for print by the spring/summer of 2019.

My future plans involve other roads and other books, but let’s just focus on these two for now.

These remains are what have drawn millions of people from all over the world to seek religious and spiritual enlightenment through prayer and hardship.A Little Bit About MeI originally titled my book, “An Old Fat Man on the Camino…” because that is how I see myself. These are not self-deprecating thoughts they are just who I am. I am 57 years old, 5’10” tall, and weigh 245 lbs. (178cm and 110 kilos). I have had 7 knee surgeries, one joint replacement, inner ear surgery, and surgery on one elbow. I also suffer from chronic bronchitis, which sucks because I have never smoked. Why am I telling you this? Because, despite all of my physical problems, I have still been able to hike the entire length of the Camino Frances 500 miles (800km) across Northern Spain.My book is an invitation for every person that dreams of walking the Camino de Santiago but are afraid that they do not have the physical abilities to complete such a task -- to get off their backsides and just go. Trust me, even if you are not able to finish, even if you can only walk a few days or weeks, you will neither regret nor forget the Camino. I have since changed the title of the book to “Stories of A Wayward Pilgrim….” Because, well, it sounds less self-deprecating, but it is just another way that I see myself. I have always been a “wayward” soul, never lost but just kind of moving in my own direction at my own pace.“Stories of A Wayward Pilgrim, St Jean Pied de Port to Santiago Compostela” is not a guidebook. It has no great spiritual insights. It is the daily stories of one man’s simple, and quite ordinary, adventures of an extraordinary journey on the Camino de Santiago. These stories are accompanied by 200 photographs of the people I met, the places I visited, and the things I saw. Maybe we can call it a photo-journal. Regardless, I hope you enjoy reading it as much as I have enjoyed producing it.Short Summary of FundingI have a two-prong plan for “The Stories of a Wayward Pilgrim….”: First is to gather funds for a high-quality and affordable printing of the book. Your pre-orders will make this possible. I have put in over two years of my life into the production of this book. Forty days and 500 miles of hiking and taking photographs of the Camino de Santiago, in Spain. Two separate trips, one in the spring and another in the fall to gather all of my photographs and stories. I spent countless weeks writing my stories and editing my photographs. Then, I took on the daunting task of learning how to design a book and the programs that would allow this design. ‘If there was a mistake, I made it’, is not an understatement. I designed the book three times, once as an eBook and twice as printed books. Countless edits in all the process ensued. But, now it is complete, and I think this project deserves a high-quality printing.My second part of the plan is a sequel, or maybe a prequel, to the first book. My second journey will be the 500 miles of trails that proceed the Camino de Santiago. The Via Podiensis, in France, is one of a number of routes that the French would take to get to Spain and on to Santiago de Compostela. The primary difference of the hike, other than the country, is that I will be better prepared to both photograph and write this book. “Stories of A Wayward Pilgrim, France, Le Puy-en-Valez to St Jean Pied de Port”.Your pre-orders will guarantee you copies of the books and the included portfolio images. The remaining funds will allow me to start the prequel. Your pre-orders for “St Jean…to …Santiago”, will be delivered in 4 to 6 weeks after the conclusion of the initial campaign and on a regular basis thereafter. I am projecting that “Le Puy-en-Valez” will be ready for print by the spring/summer of 2019.My future plans involve other roads and other books, but let’s just focus on these two for now.

story:
I am Luka Mjeda, a photographer from Zagreb, Croatia and I developed a strong interest in photography after working with American photographers Mary Ellen Mark, Michael O´Neil and Jerry Uelsmann at a workshop in Zagreb. My first years in photography were earmarked by the collaboration with Jozo Ćetković, a Croatian Master of Photography and after that, it was a wonderful journey of learning and practicing photography while working with a string of great designers, photographers, writers and artists. A decade ago I published a book with 80 portraits of Croatian artists and it came natural to me to publish this book about the photographers and photography scene in Croatia from the 1980´s up to now.

This hardcover book (23x30 cm, 232 pages) presents 52 remarkable CROATIAN PHOTOGRAPHERS of which 50 are still working today. This publication is meant to be a “who is who” record of some of and the best photography and the best photographers in Croatia. As they did not have the advantage of having their early photos shown and distributed worldwide through the internet this book is intended for new generations.

This is a self-financed Publication (and also an Exhibition of the photographer´s portraits at the promotion of the book) with some financial support from a private Foundation and no help from The Ministry of Culture of Croatia, so any help from admirers and supporters of photography will help materialize this project and present Croatian photography to the world.

Funding of the book 

  • $ 8.660 - needed funding for the printing and promotion of this Book   
  • The promotion of the Book will be at the Exhibition of Luka Mjeda´s 52 portraits of the photographers (in the book) at Mimara Museum in Zagreb, Croatia

​

story:
The Initiative Production Group is part of the leading edge of a new form of fan art. We are part of a small group of digital artists who are taking concept photography to a whole new level. By combining techniques refined by the movie industry, subject matter proven over decades, and artistic talent honed by decades of training and experience, we create compelling images we call story driven conceptual photography.

To date we have relied on the volunteer efforts of some very talented cosplayers. These people spend hundreds of dollars, and even more hours of time to create amazing costumes, props and even hollywood quality prosthetic makeup effects.

We want to give back to the community that has given so much to us and we need your help to make that happen...

this is the project  you're looking for.
you can give us your money now...

Our vision for this project is to create three masterworks combining two of our greatest influences; Star Wars, long renowned for its fan art contributions because of its rich mythology and Frank Frazetta, godfather of modern fantasy art. The working title is Star Wars Frazetta Style. 

The Star Wars universe is rich with diverse life forms, and uses a wide variety of specialized costuming. Frank Frazetta is known for his rich colors and fantastic settings. In order pay homage to these paragons of art, to properly execute this project we will need to raise a budget of $1,500.00.
All of the money collected during this campaign will go to: 
  • Cosplayer modeling fees, including travel and lodging as required
  • Purchasing the services of a professional makeup artist
  • Additional costume details, rental and prosthetics
  • 3d models and animation fees
  • Location fees
  • Props, catering and miscellaneous supplies
As a gift to those who contribute to this project we will be creating a limited run of prints of the images. These prints will not be offered for sale and are only available as a part of contributing to this effort.
The Initiative

For almost three years the Initiative Production Group has been creating compelling, story driven images with the help of some very talented cosplayers. The Initiative is driven by Gordon Lamb and William Logan, two professionals in digital arts with a combined fifty years experience. Together as the Initiative they have produced over a dozen projects.


Sample Image - "Cylon Attack" featuring the cosplay of the Iron Brothers of Topeka

We know that these craftspersons spend countless hours and their own money to create fantastic costumes. They create living works of art based in part, or in whole, on fictional characters who's stories have touched us all. We also know that they do this because the love the characters, and the worlds these characters inhabit.

Typically cosplay photography is done on the cheap, or for free. The goal of the Initiative is to take cosplay to the next level. This time we want to take the production to the next level. In order to do that we need your help. We have never charged for our photography. The Initiative has relied upon its own funds and the time donated by cosplayers in its efforts so far. 

We believe it's a natural progression to begin funding our sessions just as a film is funded; with the help of entrepreneurs, private investors and a dedicated fan base. By putting money into the cosplay community we are funding an ever increasing level of quality and a greater freedom to create.

Risks & Challenges

Our experience as professionals creating television commercials, short films and documentaries informs our process of producing photo shoots. These processes are time-tested in removing any risks and overcoming most challenges presented. Adding to that is our years of experience in ideating, planning and executing projects. Together these give us a greater opportunity for success.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to support our efforts to create great art and pay those people who contribute to that art, then spread the word. Don't just like this project, share it. Help us give back to the cosplay community.

story:
Hi My name is Yamini and I'm raising money to  self publish  my book "The Natural Goddess - Portraits of True Beauty in Women Over 40". This book has taken me nearly 9 years to complete and  will be my most important accomplishment, I am an artist and a photographer and have had a successful portrait business in Laguna Beach for nearly 19 years. But now, at 76, I'm retired and loving my life in Northern California.

This book represents the culmination of my soul's purpose which is to help raise self awareness for women in mid life who need a fresh new empowering perception of themselves. I'm  passionate about women finding their authentic, natural beauty without spending tons of money to reconstruct their face and bodies into younger versions of themselves. This is a social disease I am determined to do my part in healing.

I'm thrilled to report that many of the women featured in the book who were single  moms or just single at the time, are now happily married or in long term relationships, finding true love from ages 45 to 60. There's Talia who struggled for years to find work and to attract a full time daddy for her beautiful daughter, finally found her soulmate in Germany along with a thriving career in bodywork. And Rajyo, disfigured with a mastectomy at the age of 50 is now joyously united with her handsome and loving soulmate husband....and the list goes on. Every union (8 that I know of)  occurred sometime after their photoshoots. I like to think their experience as a daylong Natural Goddess had a little something to do with it.

This soft covered 8-1/2"x 11" book will be 120 pages long, half of which are color photographs and the other half personal transformational stories and quotes, poems and writings by well known authors. I would like to purchase the Reveal Package from Balboa Press which costs $2799. Here is some of what I'll get with the Reveal Package:

Author Volume Discounts,·  ISBN Assignment,·  Color Cover Design,·  Personalized Back Cover,·  Full Color Interior Book Design and Page Layout,·  E-book Formatting and Distribution,  Sold on Amazon.com, Barnes&Noble.com.,·  Included in Balboa Press Catalog,·  U.S. Copyright Registration,·  Press Release · Promotional Materials - 100,·  Booksellers Return Program and much more.

I would also like to add 60 extra books for $1546 (40% author discount) along with the book signing kit for $350. I will need another $90 to pay for my 18 extra color pages over the 50 allowed @ $5/ea. and my video for Indiegogo cost me $800 which all comes to $5,495 or $5,500 rounded out.

I feel the time has come to shine a light on the Goddess in all aging women. We need to recognize and honor them as role models who can bring feminine wisdom into our political and social discussions and to set a new standard of beauty. We've been slaves to the media and its distorted perception of beauty for too long. I'm hoping this book will serve as an inspiration to reconnect with our natural beauty and power as women. Marianne Williamson gave this book a wonderful endorsement. She said:"This book is a lovely exaltation of feminine beauty and power."

 A little about me: I've been an artist all my life, from singing and acting on stage, to drawing and painting portraits, to being a uniform designer and then  costume designer for TV and movies and head of wardrobe for CBS , to being a family portrait photographer and goddess photographer to creating 3 Festival of Goddesses in Laguna Beach  to finally, producing this book.

I'm hoping to create the means to publish my book and get it out to those who might be greatly impacted by it. You could play an important role in that, either with a donation or with getting the word out to your friends.

THANK YOU GIFTS FOR YOUR SUPPORT:

"I am a Natural Goddess" T-Shirts in black, grey, white, red, blue or pink and in all sizes.


Genuine jade and silver Buddha bracelet by Rollie

"It's All in Your Dreams" set of 8 meditations on Mp3 by Kelly Sullivan Walden.

Dream Oracle Cards by Kelly Sullivan Walden

      A signed 120 page soft cover  color photographic art book by Yamini



     Signed 5"x 7" frame-able goddess portrait  greeting card(s) of your choice


  Signed 5"x 7" frame-able original Northern California landscape greeting      card(s)  of your choice.

 I want to thank you for taking the time to read this and if you  do decide to offer some form of support for this book, I will be forever grateful!  Then I will know that all my creative efforts for the empowerment of women over 40 were not in vain!

story:
( #bwkhawaiisports)

Campaign Fundraiser Summary

Campaign Founder: Hi, My Name is Aaron Tui. I am currently a student at the University of Hawai'i at Manoa seeking a Bachelor degree in Tropical Plants and Soil Sciences. Although, agriculture and the protection of our natural environment is my field of study, The hobbies throughout my life and my passion has always been in photography and videography, whether it be for business or for fun.
  • Recently, I founded Blue Wing Ki'i, a start up photography and videography business, to help capture the beauty of Hawai'i and it's inhabitants.  I wanted to shift  my focus to an area of need here in the islands.  That need is to professionally provide photography and videography to young up and coming athletes who deserve media coverage for recruitment purposes to collegiate and professional sports organizations.    

  • Why Sports Coverage? The collegiate and pro level opportunities in Hawai'i are scarce compared to the Lower 48 or other places in the world. Hawai'i possesses the most dedicated and talented young up and coming athletes in the world, however most don't get a chance to continue their passion on a higher level. There is not much for these deserving athletes here in Hawai'i when it comes to the next level and it's too far and expensive to travel out of state to look for opportunities. The same can be said for sport recruiters who typically skip Hawai'i, because it is too expensive, too far, and too time consuming to scout in Hawai'i.  
  • As you might of heard, the winner of this years Heisman Award, the most prestigious award in all of college football, was claimed by Hawaii Born Marcus Mariota. However, while making it to the top on his own Marcus was one of the lucky ones to barely be recruited by a state side College. According to a Wall Street Journalist Ben Cohen, Marcus was not looked at by any college in the states due to the main facts of distance, it being expensive  and too time consuming to travel to Hawai'i for any sport recruiter (http://www.wsj.com/articles/why-no-one-wanted-marcus-mariota-1418327384).

  • With your contribution, we will be able to provide that needed coverage of Hawai'i's deserving star athletes for the purposes of pro exposure for higher sport level recruitment and sport profile building. There are tons of top athletes like Marcus here in Hawai'i that get overlooked, solely because recruiters don't come out to Hawai'i. If I can bring Hawai'i to the recruiters by way of fair media exposure the deserving athletes here would have a greater chance in achieving their dreams as collegiate and professional level athletes. 

           


What We Need

The Break Down: 

  • In order to get close to where we need to be to fullfill our goal, we need to raise at the very least $20,000 USD. After Credit Service processing fees, indiegogo.com's Fundraiser fees and our own product costs to fullfill award perks to contributors, we will end up with approximately half of our $20,000 goal at $10,533 in which the funds will be used to upgrade our photography and filming equipment.

  • The Ultimate Goal: Acquire a new Sports Camera System! 
  1. Sport Camera body: D4S - $5,999.95. 
  2. Sport Telephoto Lens: AF-S Nikkor 400mm f/2.8E FL ED VR - $11,999.95. 
  3. Pro Carbon Fiber Monopod and Pro Memory Card - $530.00. 
         *Altogether: $18,529.90 USD

  • The Minimum Raised Goal: Acquire older model and Less effective Sport Camera System :-(  
  1. Camera Body: Nikon D750 - $1,999.95. 
  2. Telephoto Lens: AF-S Nikkor 400mm f2.8G ED VR - $9,549.95. 
          *Altogether: $11,549.90 USD.

             


What You Get

The available award Perks for contributors range from digital images with Personal use licenses, Commercial use Licenses  and Video clips with Commercial Use Licenses to Solid Aluminum Prints that range from a small desktop 4x6 Print to a large exclusive 20x60 wall mounted print. 

The Break Down:
  • Depending on your contribution perk that you choose, you will receive at least one of the following:
  • "Your Name" will be posted on our Home Website as a campaign sponsor.
  • Receive (1)one High Definition, Hawaiian Island themed Photo, via-Digital Download - w/Royalty Free, Perpetual Personal Use License.
  • Receive  a High Definition Digital Download of a Hawaiian Island themed (5)five photo Gallery. - w/Royalty Free, Perpetual Personal Use License.
  • Commercial Use - High Definition Digital Download of a Hawaiian island themed (4)four photo, Gallery - w/Royalty Free, Perpetual Commercial Use License.

  • Commercial Use - (3)Three, 30 second video clips in 1080p HD  digital download (clips will cover a waterfall, ocean shore breaks, and a view of the sunset). 

  • (1)one 4x6 inch, metal print w/easel back stand. (Image is printed on aluminium for weather proof durability, vibrant colors and unique modern styling and will be print marked with my signature. (Prints are subject to fading from direct sunlight)

  • (1)one 8x10 inch, metal print w/metal wall mount. (Image is printed on aluminium for weather proof durability, vibrant colors and unique modern styling and will be print marked with my signature. Prints are subject to fading from direct sunlight)

  • (1)one Large 20x60 inch, CEO Exclusive Panoramic metal print w/a thin 1/2 inch depth float wall mount. (Image is printed on aluminium for weather proof durability, vibrant colors and unique modern styling and will be print marked with my signature. Prints are subject to fading from direct sunlight)

      *(20x60, Solid Metal Print Wall art options.) To view Larger Images click here*

       


  • With the CEO Complete Package only, the contributor will receive recognition as a prime campaign sponsor on all of our private and social websites by means to the custom of the host website for a duration by our own determination, but no less than one year. 

  • *If we do not meet are funding goal, contributor awards will still be fulfilled and the net funds will be saved or invested into the companies sport photography gear allocation project, which will cover costs that have already been made through gear purchased on credit and saved until the project is complete. (Another funding attempt will be made as well)

             


The Impact

  • With the success of this campaign we will be able to upgrade our photography and videography equipment to tackle sports photography. Sports Media coverage requires fast high quality cameras and super wide aperture long zoom telephoto lenses. These upgrades, on the minimum, costs as much as a small car, unfortunatley. 
  • We will be able to create high quality photos  and videos for the benefit and use of the athletes being covered. They can use that media to build their own portfolios to help them be seen by out of state collegiate and professional recruiters. 

Risks & Challenges

Most images to be used to full fill contributor awards or perks have been captured and processed. The challenge lies in capturing a few more high quality images that are totally dependent on the time of day and the weather conditions, which will be completed before the end of the campaign.

The Manufacture of the metal prints in our contributor perk levels will be done by a high quality professional print lab.  Depending on the amount of contributions with the metal print perk, delivery could experience delay. However, perks will be fulfilled as soon as funds are received, so you can receive your award earlier than the expected delivery date in July.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Spread the word on this campaign effort by sharing the URL or using the Sharing tools on the top left of this campaign page. You can share this campaign through the top social media sites like facebook, and twitter, etc. or even by email.

With your contribution, we will be able to provide that needed coverage of Hawai'i's deserving star athletes for the purposes of pro exposure for higher sport level recruitment and sport profile building. There are tons of top athletes like Marcus here in Hawai'i that get overlooked, solely because recruiters don't come out to Hawai'i. If I can bring Hawai'i to the recruiters by way of fair media exposure the deserving athletes here would have a greater chance in achieving their dreams as collegiate and professional level athletes. 


            

   What We Need The Break Down:   In order to get close to where we need to be to fullfill our goal, we need to raise at the very least $20,000 USD. After Credit Service processing fees, indiegogo.com's Fundraiser fees and our own product costs to fullfill award perks to contributors, we will end up with approximately half of our $20,000 goal at $10,533 in which the funds will be used to upgrade our photography and filming equipment.




The Ultimate Goal: Acquire a new Sports Camera System! 


Sport Camera body: D4S - $5,999.95. 
Sport Telephoto Lens: AF-S Nikkor 400mm f/2.8E FL ED VR - $11,999.95. 
Pro Carbon Fiber Monopod and Pro Memory Card - $530.00. 
         *Altogether: $18,529.90 USD


The Minimum Raised Goal: Acquire older model and Less effective Sport Camera System :-(  

Camera Body: Nikon D750 - $1,999.95. 
Telephoto Lens: AF-S Nikkor 400mm f2.8G ED VR - $9,549.95. 
          *Altogether: $11,549.90 USD.




             



What You Get
The available award Perks for contributors range from digital images with Personal use licenses, Commercial use Licenses  and Video clips with Commercial Use Licenses to Solid Aluminum Prints that range from a small desktop 4x6 Print to a large exclusive 20x60 wall mounted print. 
The Break Down:
 Depending on your contribution perk that you choose, you will receive at least one of the following:
"Your Name" will be posted on our Home Website as a campaign sponsor.


Receive (1)one High Definition, Hawaiian Island themed Photo, via-Digital Download - w/Royalty Free, Perpetual Personal Use License.


Receive  a High Definition Digital
Download of a Hawaiian Island themed (5)five photo Gallery. - w/Royalty Free, Perpetual Personal Use License.


Commercial Use - High
Definition Digital Download of a Hawaiian island themed (4)four photo, Gallery - w/Royalty Free, Perpetual Commercial Use License.


Commercial Use - (3)Three, 30 second video clips in 1080p HD  digital download (clips will cover a waterfall, ocean shore breaks, and a view of the sunset). 
(1)one 4x6 inch, metal print w/easel back stand. (Image is
printed on aluminium for weather proof durability, vibrant colors and unique
modern styling and will be print marked with my signature. (Prints are subject to fading from direct sunlight)
(1)one 8x10 inch, metal print w/metal wall mount. (Image is printed on
aluminium for weather proof durability, vibrant colors and unique modern
styling and will be print marked with my signature. Prints are subject to fading from direct sunlight)
(1)one Large 20x60 inch, CEO Exclusive Panoramic metal print w/a thin 1/2 inch depth float wall mount. (Image is printed on
aluminium for weather proof durability, vibrant colors and unique modern
styling and will be print marked with my signature. Prints are subject to fading from direct sunlight)

      *(20x60, Solid Metal Print Wall art options.) To view Larger Images click here*


       



With the CEO Complete Package only, the contributor will receive recognition as a prime campaign sponsor on all of our private and social websites by means to the custom of the host website for a duration by our own determination, but no less than one year. 
*If we do not meet are funding goal, contributor awards will still be fulfilled and the net funds will be saved or invested into the companies sport photography gear allocation project, which will cover costs that have already been made through gear purchased on credit and saved until the project is complete. (Another funding attempt will be made as well)
 

             

   The Impact

With the success of this campaign we will be able to upgrade our photography and videography equipment to tackle sports photography. Sports Media coverage requires fast high quality cameras and super wide aperture long zoom telephoto lenses. These upgrades, on the minimum, costs as much as a small car, unfortunatley. 
We will be able to create high quality photos  and videos for the benefit and use of the athletes being covered. They can use that media to build their own portfolios to help them be seen by out of state collegiate and professional recruiters. 

Risks & Challenges
Most images to be used to full fill contributor awards or perks have been captured and processed. The challenge lies in capturing a few more high quality images that are totally dependent on the time of day and the weather conditions, which will be completed before the end of the campaign.
The Manufacture of the metal prints in our contributor perk levels will be done by a high quality professional print lab.  Depending on the amount of contributions with the metal print perk, delivery could experience delay. However, perks will be fulfilled as soon as funds are received, so you can receive your award earlier than the expected delivery date in July.
Other Ways You Can Help
 Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Spread the word on this campaign effort by sharing the URL or using the Sharing tools on the top left of this campaign page. You can share this campaign through the top social media sites like facebook, and twitter, etc. or even by email.

story:
St. Pius X Catholic Church, Edmonton, Alberta, 1954.

Short Summary

Documenting the work of architect Joseph K. English is about recognizing a prolific, though relatively unknown practitioner who designed numerous modern buildings in Canada during the mid-century era.  It is also about capturing a small part of architectural history before it is too late.

After serving as a Lancaster bomber pilot during the Second World War, English attended the University of Manitoba's School of Architecture and went on to establish his architectural practice in the province of Alberta in the mid-1950s.  With a distinct modernist sensibility, he designed elementary schools, churches, community centres, civic buildings and residences that appear across the urban landscapes of Edmonton and Calgary, as well as many rural towns in western Canada.

The idea for the J.K. English Architecture Project was sparked in the summer of 2009 when I invited my "Grandpa Joe" to revisit some of the buildings he had designed and to reminisce about his 25-year career as an architect. Besides learning more about my grandfather’s architectural practice directly from the source, I was able to travel with him to see a number of his buildings and photograph them before he passed away in January 2010.

Although a few of English’s buildings have been listed as historic resources for preservation in the cities of Edmonton and Calgary, others have long since been torn down. Two more have been demolished since the start of this project and there are certainly others that have yet to be identified.

In the past seven years I have been able to photograph more than 30 buildings and track down many archival photos and original blueprints in museums and provincial archives, but there are still many more to be researched and documented and time is running out.  With the success of this campaign, I will be able to finish documenting his remaining buildings before any more disappear.

 

Above:  Holy Name Catholic Church, Calgary, Alberta, 1959. 
Below: St. Pius X Catholic Church, Edmonton, Alberta, 1954.

The Goal

My hope is that the resulting research and documentation from this project will contribute to the records and archives of modern architecture in Canada and be available to historians, archivists, curators, students and anyone interested in Canadian architectural history.  Ideally, it will also increase awareness in the wider community about the history of modern architecture in Western Canada and bring about a greater understanding of the importance of preserving architecture of this era.

The vast majority of the research and documentation will be completed within the next year and the photographs and archival materials will be presented as a website.

 

What You Get

Cool things are in store if you back this project!  We have beautifully printed postcards, posters and canvas bags. We're also offering limited-edition photographs of English’s architecture and the opportunity to join me on a photo shoot.

We will be adding more perks throughout the 30-day campaign, so stay tuned.

Postcards featuring architectural renderings by J.K. English:
 

Set of four postcards:

Poster (22" x 28") featuring the original architectural rendering for the Snowridge Lodge Complex project :

 

 

Limited-Edition Photograph (11"x 14") by Kiely Ramos - Choice of eight different prints:

1. Didsbury County Office, 1960

 

2. Our Lady of Peace Catholic Church, Innisfail, Alberta, 1958

 

3. Scandinavian Centre (formerly St. Joseph's Parish Hall), Calgary, Alberta, 1960

 

4. Mount Lion Lutheran Church, Edmonton, Alberta 1955

5-8. From top left, clockwise:  Mount Zion Lutheran Church (Edmonton), Holy Name Church (Calgary), St. Pius X Church (Edmonton) and St. Ambrose Church (Coaldale).


Canvas Tote Bag featuring a detail from the original plans for the Snowridge Lodge Complex project:

 

Limited-Edition Watercolor Print (8"x 10") by J.K. English:

The Budget

The majority of the funding will go towards travel to and within Alberta to get to approximately 40 building locations.  It will also cover the costs of documentation (high-resolution scans and copies of blueprints, building permits and archival photographs), photography equipment rentals, the creation and shipping of campaign perks, the Indiegogo platform fees and the expenses related to the website design.

 

The Basic Plan

  • To conduct research at city and provincial archives, libraries, museums and at building locations to find documentation related to Joseph K. English's architecture projects. 
  • To create a comprehensive list and timeline of English's architecture projects.
  • To find and photograph existing buildings that have not yet been documented and create a record of their location, appearance and overall condition.
  • To create an online resource of English’s work, featuring both historical and contemporary photographs, original architectural drawings, plans and other archival materials.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

All contributions big or small are a great help in moving this project forward.  Please spread the word by sharing, tweeting, emailing or linking to this campaign using the share tools at the top of the page.  Good 'ol word-of-mouth works too.

 

Community Support for the project:

“As a shaper of the built landscape of Alberta, Joseph K. English is an architect who deserves recognition.  His work and its proper documentation is important and the funding of this project will result in valuable information that will be used by future generations of Albertans to study their past.”

–Linda Fraser, Archivist and Chief Curator, Canadian Architectural Archives

“Documenting J. K. English’s work will offer insights into architectural culture, in its social context, at a decisive period in Alberta and in Canada. [It] will offer the opportunity for a deeper appreciation of this period of architecture and will be of immense value to subsequent historians, curators and students and a wider interested public.”

“As current pressures of growth and development continue to threaten modernist buildings, extending appreciation of this legacy becomes urgent.  This makes Ms. Ramos’ current project especially timely.”

– Victoria V. Baster, Professor, University of Lethbridge, Faculty of Fine Art

“The project objectives will be a valuable contribution to the historical record of Mr. English’s work and architectural practices, as well as to the built heritage of the Edmonton region and that of the wider province.  We applaud her initiative in this work.”

– Allison Argy-Burgess, Former Executive Director, Edmonton Heritage Council

“[English’s] work certainly merits the photographic study you propose, and your talent and experience as a professional photographer promise an outstanding visual record.”

– Dr. Michael McMordie, Professor Emeritus, University of Calgary, architectural historian, former president of the Calgary Civic Trust Society and The Society for the Study of Architecture in Canada
