story:
Our Mission

We are a small Prague-based group of visual artists and photographers formed around the simple ambition. To capture vanishing relics of mankind history. Our first quest leads to amazing Balkan post-WWII monuments known as "spomeniks"

Didn't heard about the Balkan "spomeniks" yet? Then check them out on Pinterest or on our Facebook Page. Sure, you'll love them. We are going to shoot these amazing monuments, but also process information on the construction of these sculptures, to look for the stories of their creators, to do interviews with witnesses and their family members. And we - our group and you, the supporters on Indiegogo, will self-publish the beautiful book.


Petrova Gora concept by Vojin Bakić (1974, completed 1981)

30 days, 21 monuments, 3 photographers

During our 30 days Balkan trip, we will visit 21 monuments in Slovenia, Croatia, Bosnia & Herzegovina, Montenegro and Serbia. 

The monuments we will visit in alphabetical order: Čačak, Grmeč, Ilirska Bistrica, Jasenovac, Kadinjača, Kolašin, Kosmaj, Kozara, Kragujevac, Makljen, Nikšić, Ostra, Petrova Gora, Podgarić, Sanski Most, Sisak, Slabinja, Slobodiště, Tjentište, Vukovar and Zenica.

Kosmaj monument

With the generous support by you, the supporters on Indiegogo, we can self-publish the book full of photographs taken during our Balkan trip, accompanied by information about the monuments and their creators. 

Analog style

Our aim is to achieve a technically and aesthetically perfect photographs that can serve as a record of current state of the monuments (some of them were abandoned and more or less devastated).  We will shoot the monuments on medium format film on Sinar camera, which brings indisputable advantages for architectural photography. 

Just for you

We will also create a smaller batch of collector's prints, enlargements and posters shot on black and white negatives, exclusively for you, the supporters on Indiegogo (see featured perks bellow). Also, as a backer you will receive a PDF version of the book, regardless the chosen perk. Every backer will get PDF version of the book.

 Jasenovac monument, artwork by Šimon Levitner


Support the free culture

We believe in free culture. That's why we will publish all* photographs taken during our balkan trip in the extended free library on our website under creative commons license, that anybody can freely use the photographs in their works.

*except 6 photographs reserved for collector's prints (see Perks)


Sharing is caring

Please, help us to spread the word about this campaign. Share it on Facebook, tweet it, email it, tell the friends.

The more people will find this project meaningful, the more likely it will be successful.

Please, help us to make it happen

With your support, we can make it happen. The real book, the beautiful one. Please, pre-order the book here on Indiegogo or grab some other perks. Together, we can make it happen. 
Thanks! 

-David, Šimon, Petr and Pavel 


--- Featured perks ---


Collector's poscards

Postcards from our collector’s edition, featuring original Spomeniky artworks by Šimon Levitner. Get one, set of six, or whole 21 pcs set.


Kosmaj monument, artwork by Šimon Levitner

Follow us on Instagram or check the updates here on Indiegogo out regularly to see more artworks

Bizarre souvenir

They sell souvenirs like this at Kozara monument. Featuring dictator Tito. Get one - see the Postcard + bizarre souvenir perk.



SHAPES limited photoset

100 pcs limited edition of 6 photographs taken by Šimon Levitner in a postcard format, packed in original Spomeniky envelope.



KLEMENT GOTTWALD limited photoset

100 pcs limited edition of 6 signed photographs taken by David and Šimon during the shooting of “Klement Gottwald-Communist Terrorist” music video (see the music video bellow) for Michael Kocáb - musician, who's band was banned by Czechoslovak communist regime and who after the Velvet revolution became the leader of a Parliament commission which negotiated the repatriation of Soviet soldiers from then-Czechoslovakia.




UNDERWATER limited photoset

100 pcs limited edition of 6 photographs taken by David Rubek and Šimon Levitner when they were shooting the “Underwater” music video (see the music video bellow) feat. Nick McCabe (The Verve, Black Submarine) in London. 




MASCHINEN limited print

Unique set of three prints featuring artworks for the 'Intercontinental cyber-band' Die alten Maschinen. Frames not-included. See the music video bellow.





YELLOW BOX limited print

10 pcs limited lambda print. Photo by Šimon Levitner. Frame not-included.


PUZZLE print - just one copy

Lambda print of Šimon Levitner's artwork. Frame not-included. ONLY 1 COPY


Let's connect!

Get in touch by email, on Facebook, Instagram or Twitter.

story:
Short Summary

Hi everyone, my name is Julie Tang , I'm a photographer, composer, singer songwriter. I'm creating this beautiful 100 page photography book called "Sweetest Smiles".

I will travel across the United States, in search for the 99 sweetest smiles. I will interview them about their life stories, what makes them happy, what makes them the way they are, strong and beautiful.

The purpase of this book is to inspire and encourage us, to stay positive and always keep up with our dreams and never lose hope, even through the darkest times. I promise you, this will be a heart melting photography book filled with sweetness.

There will be an E-book version of this photography book.I will write an original song just for this photography book, and this song will be used in the E-book as background music.

I will also make an music video for this project, using videos I will be shooting for these 99 sweetet smiling faces (different from the pictures in the photo book), and some stunning scenery footage I will be shooting during my travel.

To show you my sincere appreciation, I will send this music video to everyone who supported me in this project, regardless of the amount supported.

Thank you so much for taking your time to look into my project, and whether you support me or not, I wish you all the best from the bottom of my heart.;)

Here's a sample of my photography work:
To check out my original music, please visit 
https://www.reverbnation.com/julietang                                                                                

What I Need For This Project

I need to update my camera and lens to deliver the best quality of pictures, travel expenses for my trips, including transportation, lodging and meals.I also need the fund to professionally record and produce the new original song I compose for this book, with professional pianist, violinist, and other musicians.                                     The expense breakdown is as follows:                                                                               Canonn EOS-1DX Digital SLR Camera:  $5299                                                               Canon EF 28-300mm f/3.5-5.6L Lens: $2689                                                               Traveling expenses: $8000                                                                                                 Original Song recording and production and music video production: $6000               Photo Book Printing Cost: $8000                                                                                             Total Cost: $29,988     

The Impact                                          

Sometimes we all feel lost, and couldn't find the joy in life, and sometimes we just need to know someone actually cares for us. This heart melting photography book with 99 most beautiful smiles from across the country, will be a good companion of yours through toughest times, and be something sweet to cherish when you are having the time of your life.

Risks & Challenges      

If I can't reach my goal this time, the production might be delayed, or the quality might not be as good as planned due to the low budget. But this is something I truly want to do, and I will try my best to make this book happen even if I couldn't make the goals and deliver to whoever supported me in this.                   

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute money to this project, you can still help me out by sharing my project with your friends and families. I will appreciate it big times! Thank you again for all of your support!                                                                                                             Sincerely

Julie
story_txt:
Short SummaryHi everyone, my name is Julie Tang , I'm a photographer, composer, singer songwriter. I'm creating this beautiful 100 page photography book called "Sweetest Smiles". 
I will travel across the United States, in search for the 99 sweetest smiles. I will interview them about their life stories, what makes them happy, what makes them the way they are, strong and beautiful. 
The purpase of this book is to inspire and encourage us, to stay positive and always keep up with our dreams and never lose hope, even through the darkest times. I promise you, this will be a heart melting photography book filled with sweetness.
There will be an E-book version of this photography book.I will write an original song just for this photography book, and this song will be used in the E-book as background music. 
I
 will also make an music video for this project, using videos I will be shooting for these 99 sweetet smiling faces (different from the pictures in the photo book), and some stunning scenery footage I will be shooting during my 
travel. 
To
 show you my sincere appreciation, I will send this music video to 
everyone who supported me in this project, regardless of the amount 
supported.
Thank you so much for taking your time to look into my project, and whether you support me or not, I wish you all the best from the bottom of my heart.;)
Here's a sample of my photography work:



To check out my original music, please visit  
https://www.reverbnation.com/julietang                                                                                


What I Need For This Project
I need to update my camera and lens to deliver the best quality of pictures, travel expenses for my trips, including transportation, lodging and meals.I also need the fund to professionally record and produce the new original song I compose for this book, with professional pianist, violinist, and other musicians.                                     The expense breakdown is as follows:                                                                               Canonn EOS-1DX Digital SLR Camera:  $5299                                                               Canon EF 28-300mm f/3.5-5.6L Lens: $2689                                                               Traveling expenses: $8000                                                                                                 Original Song recording and production and music video production: $6000               Photo Book Printing Cost: $8000                                                                                             Total Cost: $29,988     
The Impact                                          
Sometimes we all feel lost, and couldn't find the joy in life, and sometimes we just need to know someone actually cares for us. This heart melting photography book with 99 most beautiful smiles from across the country, will be a good companion of yours through toughest times, and be something sweet to cherish when you are having the time of your life.
Risks & Challenges      
If I can't reach my goal this time, the production might be delayed, or the quality might not be as good as planned due to the low budget. But this is something I truly want to do, and I will try my best to make this book happen even if I couldn't make the goals and deliver to whoever supported me in this.                   
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute money to this project, you can still help me out by sharing my project with your friends and families. I will appreciate it big times! Thank you again for all of your support!                                                                                                             Sincerely
Julie

story:
МК: Од десната страна имате 18 пакети кои може да ги одберете и финасирате овој проект. Со 17 од нив добивате ексклузивни фотографии од воздух за вашиот дом, пријатели и слично со фотографии по ваш избор од градови во Македонија или поважни локалитети. Исто така имате можност да добиете Фотографија и 360 виртуелна панорама од вашето село по ваш избор. Доколку овој проект биде целосно финасиран ќе биде направена најголемата 360 виртуелна панорама од воздух која ќе ги опфати сите градови а и селата кои ќе побарате да бидат сликани.
Доколку сте порачале некој од пакетите ве молиме испратете инфорамции за кој пакет се работи и кој градови или село сакате да биде на фотографите на следниот емаил: contact@feelmymacedonia.com

Одбери град или поважен локалитет од нашата листа и добиј разгледница со ексклузивна фотографија од воздух

Одбери 13 градови или 13 поважни локалитети од нашата листа. Добиј каледнар со фотографии од воздух по твој избор.

Фотогорафија од воздух од Град или поважен локалитет по ваш избор на фотохартија со димензии 60х40 или 100х75 см

Ексклузивно ќе ја имате таа чест вашето родно село да добие 360 панорама од воздух која ќе биде дел од најголемата 360 виртуелна тура од воздух, а со тоа вие добивате Фотографија од воздух од вашето село со димензии од 60х40 или 100х75 см.

Фотогорафија од воздух од Град или поважен локалитет по ваш избор на канвас .

Ексклузивно ќе ја имате таа чест вашето родно село да добие 360 панорама од воздух која ќе биде дел од најголемата 360 виртуелна тура од воздух, а со тоа вие добивате Канвас од воздух од вашето село.

Ексклузивна а4 формат фотокнига од 72 страници со 36 панорами од воздух од сите градови во Македонија. Количината е ограничена.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

On the bottom of this page you have all informations about this project and author.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

You have 18 (Packages/Perks) on right side you may checkout and help this project come true:

For All packages please follow this instructions:

*Put your correct shipping address after check out.

*For PoI/POI (Point of Interest) in Macedonia you may choose from  our list bellow with 20 places. 

*For "Home Villages" choose your village in Macedonia on Google Maps and send Village Name to our email address.

*After choosing your package and check out please send your informations (Home village or PoI/Cities, Personal Contact information's) on contact@feelmymacedonia.com or via contact button above near Project informations.

*If you didn't sent your information with any POI or Cities for Post Cars and Calendars we will send you items with Author best Pick-up photos.

* All Photos will be premium and not seen before. (bellow you have some examples of photos from Stojan Stojanovski 2S Photography portfolio)

For Post Cards and Calendars choose Point of Interest (POI) Places: 

-  Samuel Fortess (Ohrid)    
-  St. Jovan Kaneo (Lake Ohrid)   
-  Plaošnik (Ohrid)   
-  Bay of Bones (Lake Ohrid)    
-  Skopje Fortress (Skopje)     
-  Heraclea  (Bitola)  
-  Millennium Cross (Skopje)   
-  St. Naum Complex (Lake Ohrid)   
-  Stobi Comples (Central Macedonia) 
-  Makedonium/Ilinden (Krusevo)   
-  Markovi Kuli (Prilep)  
-  Kokino (Kumanovo)  
-  Osogovski  Manastir (Kriva Palanka)    
-  Lesnovo Monastery (Probistip)  
-  St. John the Forerunner Bigorski Monastery  (Debar)   
-  St Nicholas (Lake Mavrovo)  
-  Golem Grad/Snake Island (Lake Prespa)
-  St. Bogorodica (Novaci - Bitola)
- St. Jovan (Slepce - Demir Hisar)
- St. Sofija (Ohrid)

For Post Cards and Calendars choose one city: 

Veles, Demir Kapija, Kavadarci, Negotino, Sv. Nikole, Berovo, Vinica, Delcevo, Kochani, Makedonska Kamenica, Pehcevo, Probistip, Shtip, Debar, Kicevo, Makedonski Brod, Ohrid, Struga, Bogdanci, Valandovo, Gevgelija, Radovish, Strumica, Bitola, Demir Hisar, Krushevo, Prilep, Resen, Gostivar, Tetovo, Kratovo, Kriva Palanka, Kumanovo, Skopje.
*After choosing your package and check out please send your informations (Home village or PoI/Cities, Personal Contact information's) on contact@feelmymacedonia.com or via contact button above near Project informations.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
About Me:

Hi guys! My name is Stojan Stojanovski. I live in the beautiful city called Ohrid, which is located in Macedonia.
My parents always told me to follow my passion - so i did and turned my passion for photography into a business with which i am successfull for more than 10 years now.
Though Macedonia is a small country, it is definitely a masterpiece of nature.
To show this beauty to the whole world, i created 360° aerial panoramas and videos for the first time in Macedonia in 2014. I also created ohrid360.com, where you can join stunning virtual 360° tours around from Ohrid Region. 
The feedback from people all over the world has been amazing and brought different ideas for new projects to my mind... the result is...... FEEL MY MACEDONIA

 "Feel My Macedonia" Project:
My idea is to create a website where i will publish 34 - 360° aerial virtual panoramas and connect them to one big and stunning 360° tour with a interesting menu. This will promote our country worldwide and will give people the chance to feel the beauty and warmth of our beautiful homeland. (Example of Ohrid)

Following 360° aerial panoramas and aerial photos are planned: Veles, Demir Kapija, Kavadarci, Negotino, Sv. Nikole, Berovo, Vinica, Delcevo, Kochani, Makedonska Kamenica, Pehcevo, Probistip, Shtip, Debar, Kicevo, Makedonski Brod, Ohrid, Struga, Bogdanci, Valandovo, Gevgelija, Radovish, Strumica, Bitola, Demir Hisar, Krushevo, Prilep, Resen, Gostivar, Tetovo, Kratovo, Kriva Palanka, Kumanovo and last but not least - our capital city Skopje.

Taking this panoramas will be the first stage of our project. When the goal is completed, we will have from January 2016 till March 2016 more than 50% of the villages online - therefore half of Macedonia can be visited online via 360 aerial panorama. Also all listed PoI will have 360 aerial panoramas.

I will complete my project with the help of a drone and a little assistant team. We will travel to all 34 cities and take the panoramas, do the color correction and put them online on our website. We will need minimum 10 TB space for all panoramas. Also we need to buy the domain www.feelmymacedonia.com, pay for hosting the website and make a plan for the travel costs. We will travel in average 1500 to 2000 km for the whole project. 
"Feel My Macedonia" Project what you get if you support us:
90% of my pictures of different events and locations i took the past years were free for all available in web and social media platforms. Sometimes if there were bigger projects i finished them for small rewards.
In this project i want to give you the chance to fund me, to promote our country and to have something special in your home which was not available in Macedonia till now.

There are 18 different packages and every funder can choose between different offers.

Help me to promote our country, the beautiful heritage, the nature, the villages and all the goodhearted people who live there.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

How we work - Portfolio:

You may find photos and follow us on our Social Pages:
https://www.facebook.com/2Sstudio
https://www.facebook.com/air360.mk
https://www.facebook.com/ohrid360
https://www.facebook.com/ohrid.city.macedonia
https://www.facebook.com/lakeohridlake

story:
Welcome to the Tarot Series Funding Round 2! I didn't hit my full goal on the first campaign and I have launched a 2nd round to raise the remaining funds for the last third of the costumes and set building. Remember there are 22 cards in the Major Arcana, so 22 set ups. Emerging photographer ambition! So far, all the models selected, my stylist Courtney Lynne Garvin, and fellow local artists are all helping and we are making progress. I am so excited about this series!

The Tarot Series Story

The Tarot has always fascinated me. Some view the cards as a fortune telling device, fun playing cards, or to seek divination and inspiration. I believe the Tarot is in essence an intuitive guide that opens doors to one's unconsciousness and guides you on your journey in life.

Many artists have done in the Tarot in various mediums. I haven't seen photos done in my style and I want to make my contribution, create gorgeous and ethereal images that honor the symbolism to stimulate the psyche, and definitely put my stamp of interpretation on the time honored Tarot tradition.

I've gravitated toward the Alejandro Jodorowsky school of thought that the Tarot cards, in particular the 22 major arcana cards, tell the story of self-actualization. Jodorowsky is adamant about just looking at the image on the cards that are selected. I also resonate with Carl Jung's thoughts that the Tarot Major Arcana cards represent archetypes that surface in our dreams and are part of the great collective unconscious.

I am drawing inspiration from the Tarot de Marseilles, the Lover's Tarot, the Rider-Waite deck, and a set based on Mythology. But I keep finding so many interesting decks. Universities and libraries all over the world have Tarot decks dating back to the 14th century. This is a whole new journey for me and I do hope to be able to give Tarot readings by the end of completing the series.

I sincerely appreciate your belief in me if you decide to help fund my project. I want the Tarot series to be beautiful, timeless, ethereal, and make an artistic impact. Love!

story:
I am a single mum of 4.  I live under the threat of eviction in South London.  I rent a property that could be sold at any time.  To say I have been through tough times is an understatement.  There is nothing more ferocious than a lioness protecting her cubs.

We are in a housing Crisis and it needs to be dealt with NOW.

I need to raise the £10,000 to stand as an Independent candidate for Mayor of London.

It is projected that in the next decade 488,000 homes will be needed in the nation’s capital in the next ten years.

More than half a million Britons are facing eviction from the homes they own or rent.  This crisis is happening now and we need an urgent safety net. 

Every eviction is a crisis. 

Would it not make sound economic sense to prevent this?  Short term loss for long term gains?

Prioritise Housing above everything. 

How?

Cap the value of properties in London and freeze overseas property investments.

Zero interest homeowner loans directly from the government that will apply to anyone: regardless of credit history.

Housing payments calculated on income.

Government purchase of private rental properties for vulnerable tenants.

Triple Building of New Homes by 2020 and explore creative regeneration.

London to have independent Leadership.

Decisions affecting London’s residents to be a democratic process.

Offshore Tax evasion banned by large companies and all tax backdated to April 2014.

My Background 

I am one of the half a million Britons living under the threat of eviction.

I am a survivor of sustained and severe domestic control, abuse, rape and oppression 

We still bear the scars emotionally and mine physically.

We came back to where they were raised but we are in the middle of a crisis.

Every homeless person is a tragedy and every eviction a failure.

We need to stop this.  Now.

Right now I am not interested in electric cars, pollution or banning vehicles from London.  I actually think the collapse of the black cab industry would be devastating for our capital. We need to prioritise housing first and foremost.

Old Etonions, Corbyn puppets and career politicians are not what is needed to end this cycle.

Put a single mother in the ring whose back is against the wall with her children and watch her fight for equality. This is about making sure tenants have rights and the government does more for people who are in danger of losing their homes: now.

In January 2014 I was thrust into the political ring when I received a section 21 letter.

Having never been a second late with my rent I was shocked to receive a letter stating I had to move out.

Why? Because I did not have a guarantor.  Being a single mum with no parents or grandparents I had no one to step up and support us. 

Even my children’s fathers would not put their name on a piece of paper.

On the 20th January 2015 I stood outside my home and held a demonstration. 

No one was listening.  A lone voice crying out for her children. 

I stood there in the cold with my art installation outside representing loss of childhood.

After our incredible and sad journey, to move would have been a tragedy and it could have been anywhere in the country.

I even created a huge banner trying to get “Rusty Rockets” attention.  Clearly my voice was not loud enough even for Russell Brand.

Thankfully I won the right to stay. The homeowner was sympathetic and I will always be thankful that she let me stay.  But why, in 2015, should a mother of four children have to stand outside her house and demonstrate?

We still live daily under the worry the house will be sold and we will once again be asked to leave.

I’m not interested in careers or promises or political experience: I am interested in results.  I am interested in providing a home for my children.

Things have to change and if it means me rolling up my sleeves to make that happen: then so be it.

I care about the lone voice.  The single parent.  The working class families.  The homeless and those struggling in London to make ends meet while the economic divide ever increases.

Above all: I play fair.  I know how to balance a budget on tight purse strings and I know how to divide resources equally.

I do this every day.

Deb4London

“ A Fresh Start”

My Professional Background

Professional Biography

 

I have an eclectic employment background which has run parallel to a personal  journey.  I have developed very strong leadership skills.

 

 My main career has been in teaching where I had over 11 years experience working in many different types of educational institution.

 I am qualified to teach Art, but have also taught Photography, Music and English to A Level and during senior leadership roles. I also taught Maths, PSHE, Citizenship, Drama and Religious Education.  Prior to my teaching career, I was very successful in sales, leading and managing teams within the publishing industry and then the entertainments industry. 

 During my teaching career I progressed quickly through the ranks through hard work, determination and ambition.  I taught in a huge variety of institutions from a top performing Grammar School to an independent boys boarding school for boys with complex and challenging social and emotional difficulties.

 My main subject is Art and I passed my PGCE with a distinction and am now a practising artist.

 I am a gregarious, organised and confident individual who has consistently risen to any challenge. 

 One of my most challenging yet rewarding roles was as secondary behaviour manager (Deputy Headteacher) month troubleshooting contract to oversee the amalgamation of two short term schools into one new provision for students with behavioural difficulties.  The role included

working with all the headteachers in Bromley on strategies to deal with challenging students.  I oversaw the amalgamation of two short term schools into one new provision for students with behavioural difficulties. 

Prior to teaching I was in publishing, a Licensee Sales Manager and my first job was as bar manager when I left University in 1995.

I am a very driven individual.

On a personal level I have four children who I raise as a single mother but moved back to London to be close to fathers and grandparents.  I have strong family values.

 

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

 Impact


As an ex teacher I know well all skills are transferable.

I am not a typical candidate.

I am a working class mother raised by her Grandparents in Bolton.

University saved me from eviction and I value education.

I have a rich and varied past that is both wonderful and sordid but one I do not run from.

What hasn’t killed me made me strong enough to stand tall and face the problems head on.

Equality is at the heart of everything I do.  We are all the same regardless of sexuality, race, creed, colour or class.

We should all be afforded the same resources and benefits.

I care about our planet.

I care about World Peace.

I believe that if all voices are heard equally then we can start to make real and present changes.

Existing systems have not worked and London lives under threat from terrorism and we need to go back to the source and stamp it out.

Not by mindless killing however, but by lifting up the voices of the unheard masses.

We are all the same.  We are all equal.

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:
  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

 I have nothing to lose and everything to gain.

London needs change.



Other Ways You Can Help

Please share my message.  Write about me, tweet, speak but above all.... spread the word.  THANK YOU
story_txt:
I am a single mum of 4.  I live under the threat of eviction in South London.  I rent a property that could be sold at any time.  To say I have been through tough times is an understatement.  There is nothing more ferocious than a lioness protecting her cubs.
We are in a housing Crisis and it needs to be dealt with NOW.
I need to raise the £10,000 to stand as an Independent candidate for Mayor of London.
It is projected that in the next decade 488,000 homes
will be needed in the nation’s capital in the next ten years.
More than half a million Britons are facing eviction from
the homes they own or rent.  This crisis
is happening now and we need an urgent safety net.  
Every eviction is a crisis.  
Would it not make sound economic sense to prevent
this?  Short term loss for long term
gains?
Prioritise Housing above everything.  
How?
Cap the
value of properties in London and freeze overseas property investments.
Zero interest homeowner loans directly from the
government that will apply to anyone: regardless of credit history.
Housing payments calculated on income. 
Government purchase of private rental properties for
vulnerable tenants.
Triple Building of New Homes by 2020 and explore creative
regeneration.
London to have independent Leadership.
Decisions affecting London’s residents to be a democratic
process.
Offshore Tax evasion banned by large companies and all
tax backdated to April 2014.


My Background 

I am one of the half a million Britons living under the
threat of eviction. 
I am a survivor of sustained and severe domestic control,
abuse, rape and oppression  
We still bear the scars emotionally and mine physically.
We came back to where they were raised but we are in the
middle of a crisis.
Every homeless person is a tragedy and every eviction a
failure.
We need to stop this. 
Now.
Right now I am not interested in electric cars, pollution
or banning vehicles from London.  I
actually think the collapse of the black cab industry would be devastating for
our capital. We need to prioritise housing first and foremost.
Old Etonions, Corbyn puppets and career politicians are
not what is needed to end this cycle.
Put a single mother in the ring whose back is against the
wall with her children and watch her fight for equality. This is about making
sure tenants have rights and the government does more for people who are in
danger of losing their homes: now.
In January 2014 I was thrust into the political ring when
I received a section 21 letter.
Having never been a second late with my rent I was
shocked to receive a letter stating I had to move out. 
Why? Because I did not have a guarantor.  Being a single mum with no parents or
grandparents I had no one to step up and support us.  
Even my children’s fathers would not put their name on a
piece of paper.
On the 20th January 2015 I stood outside my
home and held a demonstration.  
No one was listening. 
A lone voice crying out for her children.  
I stood there in the cold with my art installation
outside representing loss of childhood.
After our incredible and sad journey, to move would have
been a tragedy and it could have been anywhere in the country.
I even created a huge banner trying to get “Rusty
Rockets” attention.  Clearly my voice was
not loud enough even for Russell Brand.
Thankfully I won the right to stay. The homeowner was sympathetic
and I will always be thankful that she let me stay.  But why, in 2015, should a mother of four
children have to stand outside her house and demonstrate?
We still live daily under the worry the house will be
sold and we will once again be asked to leave.
I’m not interested in careers or promises or political
experience: I am interested in results.  I
am interested in providing a home for my children.
Things have to change and if it means me rolling up my
sleeves to make that happen: then so be it. 
I care about the lone voice.  The single parent.  The working class families.  The homeless and those struggling in London
to make ends meet while the economic divide ever increases.
Above all: I play fair. 
I know how to balance a budget on tight purse strings and I know how to
divide resources equally.
I do this every day.
Deb4London

A Fresh Start”
  My Professional Background


Professional
Biography

  
I have an eclectic employment background which has run

 My main career has been in teaching

story:
Short Summary


Hello 

My name is Davion and I've loved photography for as long as I can remember.  I made the decision earlier this year to take my photography seriously and work towards my dreams.  Bringing my 1st photo book to life is the 1st step for me in that journey 

What I'm making


Being born and raised in Las Vegas I've spent my entire life hearing people talk negatively about my home.  This book is to show the beauty of my home the place I love the place I'm proud to be from. 

What We Need & What You Get


I'm looking for the funding to cover the production cost along.  I have a few different perk setups at multiple price points in hopes of making it affordable for anyone who chooses to support me 

The Impact


Your Donation will help me make this come to life. It will allow me to print my books with a high-quality printer. I decided if I wasn't able to do it right I wasn't going to do it and that's what I need your help for. 

Other Ways You Can Help


If your unable to donate a simple share of this campaign on your social network of choice will help more than I could ever explain.  You also have the option to donate a smaller amount than what's on the perks list.

story:
Resumen

 

Suspiros de España

 

SINOPSIS

           Esta obra abarca, con bastantes pocos pelos en la lengua, varios aspectos de la sociedad española actual. Se trata de una crítica de valores y normas ya obsoletos que llevamos arrastrando mucho tiempo y que en mi parecer deberían cambiar y se debería hablar de ellos, por eso los saco a la palestra y así procuro fomentar la autocrítica desde un punto de máxima humildad.

 

Conceptualismo crítico.

           Se trata de un lenguaje que sirve de conducto para apelar a los sentimientos y a las emociones a través de un arte conceptual, simbólico, con objetos cotidianos y cercanos perfectamente identificables por todos pero con un significado distinto al habitual; se trata de objetos que pierden parte de su identidad para formar parte de un concepto mayor, son objetos que crecen en significado. Todo esto lo realizo desde un punto de vista crítico, no pasivo, en el que la gente tiene que hacer un pequeño esfuerzo para captar la esencia de la obra y así llegar a un debate interno sobre las ideas preestablecidas y lo que es moral y socialmente justo.

 

Significado y obra.

            La forma de percibir el arte es un proceso muy personal e íntimo, en el que cada individuo es capaz de captar las formas, los colores, la luz, los objetos,… de manera única, por ello creo que el artista no debe obligar al espectador a sentir algo determinado. Creo que la finalidad del arte es hacer sentir, incluso cosas que no querías sentir, con esto un artista puede estar satisfecho y por lo tanto, para mí, la obra puede tener tantos significados como espectadores, ya que si para una persona significa una cosa y para otra persona otra, los dos tienen razón, pues lo que están experimentando en ambos casos es real.

Los colaboradores financian ideas que los apasionan y a la gente en la que confían. Estas son algunas cosas que puedes hacer en esta sección:

 

Lo que necesito y lo que obtienes

 

El dinero mínimo que necesito para llevar a cabo este proyecto es el indicado (3.500€), a partir de ahí, si la recaudación es mayor esto influirá en el tamaño, calidad y materiales de impresión de las obras y en la fiesta de inauguración del evento.

El sistema de recompensas es el siguiente:

APORTACIONES Y RECOMPENSAS

10€ -- Colaboración con el proyecto y con el arte que te proporcionará el derecho a asistir a la fiesta de inauguración de la exposición en Madrid el próximo mes de Diciembre, en la que tendrás derecho a barra libre tanto en comida como en bebida.

50€ -- Además de lo anterior citado también tendrás un espacio reservado para tu negocio, marca, organización, asociación, empresa u Ong, donde podrás dejar flyers o cualquier otro tipo de escrito informativo; además de la impresión de tu logotipo junto con el del resto de colaboradores en un gran banner.

100€ -- Además de los beneficios del aporte de 10€ obtendrás una copia de una de mis obras en cartón-pluma en tamaño grande, dependiendo de cada fotografía, con una dedicatoria especial. La entrega de ésta unos días pasados tras la inauguración, en la que podréis elegir la que más os ha gustado.

Para el control de los asistentes y sobretodo su derecho a consumiciones y degustaciones gratuitas se repartirán unas pulseras a los mecenas.

Ruego que si no se puede colaborar económicamente, se difunda para que otras personas puedan colaborar.

 

Muchas gracias a tod@s. De verdad.

story:
Who are we?

We are the creative team of local New Smyrna Beach residents Cathy Rose Rader and Jason Obenauer.

Cathy has been in the design, marketing and printing profession most of her career.
Jason is an excellent and well-known surf photographer [www.SurfsupWolf.com]. Our passion for this unique coastal town has grown even more as we have created this book and met so many incredible people who call New Smyrna Beach home.

So you think you have seen everything in New Smyrna Beach?  You may be surprised. We thought we did too! Through photography, you’ll meet talented musicians, artists, surfing legends, our First Responders and see the beauty in our wildlife, our beach, popular Canal Street and Flagler Avenue to name just a few.

Living the Dream, New Smyrna Beach, FL will be printed by Haman Midwest in the USA. We're extremely lucky to be working with this talented and deeply experienced team, and we can't wait to see the finished Book!

The details matter;

  • Hardcover 12" x 11" format with "Living the Dream" printed on clear dust jacket
  • 180 pages, offset printed on heavy weight paper in full color
  • Spot varnished to protect from UV damage
  • FSC certified, sustainably sourced paper from the USA [FSC certification ensures that products come from well managed forests that provide environmental, social and economic benefits] 

Be one of the first to order your book through our Indiegogo campaign and receive a few exclusive bonus’s  just to thank you. The book will be released early 2018, and ready for the 250 Birthday Celebration of New Smyrna Beach!

Can't contribute? Please SHARE with your friends - we appreciate it!

We appreciate every bit of your support and want to thank you for taking the time to learn more about this significant project. We look forward to sharing this book and the stories of Living the Dream with you!

- Cathy and Jason 

We'd also like to take a moment and give a BIG HUG and THANKS to those people who have now become friends that we feature in the book for their time, talents and passion for this project.

story:
'Photography does not separate us

from our world but rather draws us more

profoundly into the very heart of it'

- Charlie Waite -

 

Surrey Landscapes: unique photographs in an elegant coffee-table book

Once this campaign ends, please visit my website www.nickoakleyphotography.co.uk for these pre-publication offers (until mid-February 2021), for more information or to buy my book. 

Thank you for visiting my crowdfunding page which I’m running to help with the printing costs of this self-published book. To pre-order your copy of the Surrey Landscapes book, click on any of the options below "Select a perk" over on the right to see what is included (the price does not change depending on how many backers I get). If you pre-order you will also have your name printed in the acknowledgements at the end of the book as a thank you for you support.  If you do not want a book but would like to donate to my campaign (a BIG thank you), click on the pink "Back It" button. Donators giving £10 or more will also get their name in book.

 

My name is Nick Oakley. I am a professional landscape photographer and over the last two years I have been working on a photography book entitled Surrey Landscapes. The book celebrates the stunning countryside of Surrey in England through photographs and captions. It is also a great honour to have the foreword written by one of the worlds leading landscape photographers, Charlie Waite. This book will appeal to anyone who enjoys the county’s open spaces or loves landscape photography.

  

Shafts, Witley Common

Book Details

Surrey Landscapes contains images from across the county and through the seasons in one elegant coffee-table book, encompassing both the familiar beauty spots as well as less frequented areas.  The book preview shown in the introductory video at the top of this campaign page gives a good idea of the design layout.  The hard backed book will comprise 96 pages (24 x 24 cm) with 43 images and captions.


Autumn Calm, Frensham Common

Goals of this campaign

I have been responsible for funding the majority of this Surrey Landscapes project whilst researching locations, visiting and making the photographs that have gone into the book.  The purpose of my Surrey Landscapes Indiegogo campaign is to raise money to help with publishing costs so that my work can be seen by a wider audience.  

You can help me achieve my goals by:

  • buying from the list of products (perks) shown on the right hand side of this page
  • or clicking on the pink "BACK IT" button (at the top right hand side of the page) to donate
  • or a combination of the two.

Purple Wave, Newlands Corner - framed for champions

Benefits to my campaign supporters

As a thank you for your support, I am offering some campaign-limited benefits:

  • Everyone supporting the campaign will have their name printed in the acknowledgements at the back of the book as a thank-you for their help.
  • Book Backers will pay less than the shop retail price of £20, and the more books you buy, the bigger your discount.
  • Everyone will be receiving their copy of the book in spring 2021, months before it reaches the shops.
  • One copy of the book from each order will be signed by me.
  • If you would like more copies signed, or would like to have a dedication to someone in the book as well, see how to get this benefit in the FAQs (below the video introduction).
  • Limited edition prints and framed limited edition prints are also being offered at a reduced price.
  • Supporters will also be raising money for charity as I will be donating 5% of profits from the book to the Woodland Trust who do much to safeguard our wooded habitats and wildlife across the county.

 

Birthday Promise Details

If you choose the Birthday Promise, a greetings card will be sent by first class post to whoever you nominate, indicating that they will be receiving a copy of the Surrey Landscapes book, by post, in spring 2021. Note that your nominated receiver's details go in the shipping address part on the checkout page (but with your phone number). 

Birthday Promise greetings card  - front image

 

Risks and Challenges

The risks associated with this Indiegogo project are mostly my own. Your help will ease the burden of printing costs and give you the chance to acquire this beautiful photography book and other products at a reduced price.

If you buy a book through this Indiegogo campaign, it will be dispatched along with any other products in spring 2021.  Christmas gift vouchers under the Festive Promise will be sent out in December 2020. Vouchers bought after 14th December will be dispatched as soon as possible.

Dawn, Newlands Corner

Spreading the word

Well done for making it all the way to the bottom of this page. Reaching people and connecting with them is the hard bit of any campaign, so: 

  • If you know others to whom this may appeal, please tell or share this page with them by email or on social media.  Your connections could really help make this successful.

 

Thank you so much for your time and support, it is greatly appreciated.

 

On location at Frensham Common
story_txt:
'Photography does not separate usfrom our world but rather draws us moreprofoundly into the very heart of it'- Charlie Waite - Surrey Landscapes: unique photographs in an elegant coffee-table bookOnce this campaign ends, please visit my website www.nickoakleyphotography.co.uk for these pre-publication offers (until mid-February 2021), for more information or to buy my book. Thank you for visiting my crowdfunding page which I’m running to help with the printing costs of this self-published book. To pre-order your copy of the Surrey Landscapes book, click on any of the options below "Select a perk" over on the right to see what is included (the price does not change depending on how many backers I get). If you pre-order you will also have your name printed in the acknowledgements at the end of the book as a thank you for you support.  If you do not want a book but would like to donate to my campaign (a BIG thank you), click on the pink "Back It" button. Donators giving £10 or more will also get their name in book. My name is Nick Oakley. I am a professional landscape photographer and over the last two years I have been working on a photography book entitled Surrey Landscapes. The book celebrates the stunning countryside of Surrey in England through photographs and captions. It is also a great honour to have the foreword written by one of the worlds leading landscape photographers, Charlie Waite. This book will appeal to anyone who enjoys the county’s open spaces or loves landscape photography.  Shafts, Witley CommonBook DetailsSurrey Landscapes contains images from across the county and through the seasons in one elegant coffee-table book, encompassing both the familiar beauty spots as well as less frequented areas.  The book preview shown in the introductory video at the top of this campaign page gives a good idea of the design layout.  The hard backed book will comprise 96 pages (24 x 24 cm) with 43 images and captions.Autumn Calm, Frensham CommonGoals of this campaignI have been responsible for funding the majority of this Surrey Landscapes project whilst researching locations, visiting and making the photographs that have gone into the book.  The purpose of my Surrey Landscapes Indiegogo campaign is to raise money to help with publishing costs so that my work can be seen by a wider audience.  You can help me achieve my goals by:
buying from the list of products (perks) shown on the right hand side of this page
or clicking on the pink "BACK IT" button (at the top right hand side of the page) to donate
or a combination of the two.
Purple Wave, Newlands Corner - framed for championsBenefits to my campaign supportersAs a thank you for your support, I am offering some campaign-limited benefits:
Everyone supporting the campaign will have their name printed in the acknowledgements at the back of the book as a thank-you for their help.
Book Backers will pay less than the shop retail price of £20, and the more books you buy, the bigger your discount.
Everyone will be receiving their copy of the book in spring 2021, months before it reaches the shops.
One copy of the book from each order will be signed by me.
If you would like more copies signed, or would like to have a dedication to someone in the book as well, see how to get this benefit in the FAQs (below the video introduction).
Limited edition prints and framed limited edition prints are also being offered at a reduced price.
Supporters will also be raising money for charity as I will be donating 5% of profits from the book to the Woodland Trust who do much to safeguard our wooded habitats and wildlife across the county.
 Birthday Promise DetailsIf you choose the Birthday Promise, a greetings card will be sent by first class post to whoever you nominate, indicating that they will be receiving a copy of the Surrey Landscapes book, by post, in spring 2021. Note that your nominated receiver's details go in the shipping address part on the checkout page (but with your phone number). Birthday Promise greetings card  - front image Risks and ChallengesThe risks associated with this Indiegogo project are mostly my own. Your help will ease the burden of printing costs and give you the chance to acquire this beautiful photography book and other products at a reduced price.If you buy a book through this Indiegogo campaign, it will be dispatched along with any other products in spring 2021.  Christmas gift vouchers under the Festive Promise will be sent out in December 2020. Vouchers bought after 14th December will be dispatched as soon as possible.Dawn, Newlands CornerSpreading the wordWell done for making it all the way to the bottom of this page. Reaching people and connecting with them is the hard bit of any campaign, so: If you know others to whom this may appeal, please tell or share this page with them by email or on social media.  Your connections could really help make this successful. Thank you so much for your time and support, it is greatly appreciated. On location at Frensham Common

story:
Concept:

Take Care is a collection of photographs representing the reclamation of autonomy for sexual trauma survivors while challenging one's understanding of objects and color through a created visual language.  The photographs are ambiguous, playful, and bring visibility to the topic of sexual trauma. The title of the project is ambiguous in its own nature – it references the notion that we as humans must take care of ourselves after a traumatic event, whatever that may mean to the individual; however, it is also used to reference the phrase "Take Care", used to say our goodbyes to someone. The second meaning is particularly impactful to the artist in ridding herself of the negativity that has weighed her down for the past decade. Take Care creates a space for survivors of sexual trauma to say their goodbyes, literal or metaphorical, to the beings and situations that have so deeply changed their lives.

 

Here's Where the Funding is Going:

In order to have the most effective impact, these photographs need to be printed large (40"x60", with the exception of a few that will be smaller). Funding will primarily help cover costs of the frames, renting and preparing the gallery exhibit, and obtaining white shelves for 12-18 sculptural banana figures that will be displayed on the wall. 

Any extra money funded will go toward the creation of a fine art magazine for artists who are recovering from sexual trauma specifically. This magazine will provide even more visibility to the topic of sexual trauma and show how artists are overcoming their experiences through creative processes.

The Impact

This project gives visibility to the effects of sexual trauma and allows a safe space for healing. With your donation, you will be supporting an artist with a desire to use her voice to help those struggling with the effects of trauma.

Risk-Taker

The biggest risk I've taken with this project has been allowing myself to be vulnerable with my emotions. I have also gone outside of my realm of comfortability with making sculptural objects. After a period of trial and error, and many failures, I finally succeeded. That in itself means so much to myself as an artist. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially, it would be greatly appreciated if you share this project with your friends! :) 

 

*With your donation of any amount, your name (if provided) will be included on a Contributors List in the printed exhibition catalog for my show to express my full gratitude. If you choose a donation with a perk, you will also receive that perk no later than June of 2017. 

 

IG: @AlainaAbplanalp

story:
The Campaign Has Ended
...but you can still book us for services! 
consult@commonsstudio.com


Shot for Shot® Portraits

Commons Studio intends to be the leading provider of Professional Portraits in Central Ohio. 


Professional Portraits by Commons Studio © 2016

How it Works and What We're All About

Our goal is to book 100 Professional Portraits with paying clients in order to give 100 Professional Portraits to the beneficiaries of our nonprofit partners. 

Shot for Shot® is the starting point for what drives us as a social enterprise. It’s a familiar BuyOne-GiveOne model you may already know — TOMS, Warby Parker, our friends at Aunt Flow, and many more. Every time you get a shot with us, we are able to give someone in need a shot at improving their personal brand.

In today's digital world of social networks, image is more important than ever. There was a recent study posted on LifeHacker.com discovering that job recruiters spend more time looking at profile photos on LinkedIn rather than vital career information. Without a good photo to represent who you are online, that's a lot like acing the test in real life but forgetting to sign your name. We partner with career development nonprofits to provide the men and women they serve with complimentary Professional Portraits to help them along on their path of employment.  

All of our images are high-quality and beautifully retouched. Every client receives the same respect and warm experience. Commons Studio is the world's only Shot for Shot® photography studio and the first to be career and community focused on both sides of the lens™. 


Cause Impact team photo by Commons Studio © 2016

"Commons Studio delivered great group and individual photos for us. They did a fantastic job capturing our people's personalities and company culture, and made the whole experience a pleasure. We look forward to working with them again." 


Sean McGee
Cause Impact, Managing Principal

 


Dress for Success Women2Women Mentoring photos by Commons Studio © 2016

“Dress for Success Columbus prides itself in treating every woman who enters our doors with kindness, respect and the dignity they deserve. When Commons Studio offered to take professional headshots of six of our amazing clients, we jumped at the chance. Matt and his team created a “private party” for six women where they were made to feel beautiful. The pictures that Matt took that night, still hang in my office. They are reminders of the inner and outward beauty that exists when women feel valued. Thank you Commons Studio for helping us to make this experience available to our deserving clients.”


Tracy Harrison
Dress for Success Columbus, Vice President



 


 

Paid Apprenticeship

Commons Studio believes in sharing the best practices that make professional photography a livable career. We offer highly competitive, paid apprenticeship opportunities to individuals who demonstrate exceptional talent, industrious character, and a passion for community impact. It is our goal that the immersive, on-the-job training experience will prepare them with the necessary tools to succeed as creative entrepreneurs and future leaders of the industry.  


"I attribute my personal discoveries about my own work and the future of my career to Matt and my associates at Commons Studio."


Samantha Urell
Graduate Student NYU, Intern (2015) and Assistant Project Manager 

 

"Commons Studio brings photographers together. I’ve had experience with equipment I never worked with before. I met people I would have otherwise never met."


Curtis Cole
Intern (2015), Photo Assistant and Second Shooter 


"I am able to come in every single week and hone craft through photo and video elements. This internship has really launched me into the career world."


Burke Mayne
CCAD Grad, Intern (2016) and Video Editor 
 


AAF Luncheon: Barry Chandler photo by Commons Studio © 2016
 

Business With A Purpose 

As a social enterprise, our mission is to produce compelling photo and video content for socially responsible brands, organizations, and individuals; serve our community in partnership with career-development nonprofits; and apprentice the next generation of professional photographers. Business proceeds directly fuel our Shot for Shot® philosophy of giving back which benefits our nonprofit partners and provides funding for paid apprenticeships at the studio. Think of it this way, every time you get a shot with us you’re giving someone on both sides of the lens a shot at building their professional career. That’s really cool  — and doesn’t cost you any extra as a client to receive our high quality of  professional work.

Between 2015 and 2016 we have successfully on-boarded many of our founder’s local clients and donated services to the Commons Studio brand. We are up to seven team members with growing interest from many more. This bootstrapped initiative has so far donated over $50,000 worth of services to nonprofit organizations, helped raise more than $10,000 for social causes, and paid out over $42,000 to our team of aspiring young creatives who work with us as contractors. 


Homeport Voice & Vision Annual Celebration photo by Commons Studio © 2015


The Perks

Choose the perk that is right for you. While many of our perks are retainers for services, there are a number of options available for supporters who may want to contribute but either don't need our services or aren't located in Central Ohio. Take a look and let us know if you have any questions. We greatly appreciate the support you provide to our mission! 


The Supporter
$15

We appreciate every contribution! This option is perfect if you support our mission but don't need our services at this time. You will receive a personal shoutout on Instagram from one of our team members and a 2.5" x 3" Commons Studio sticker as a perk.



Commons Studio T-Shirt
$35

Wear the brand with pride! This option allows you to support our mission and get some cool swag out of it too. T-Shirts are available in both Black and White. If you don't see your size listed just let us know and we'll do a special run just for you. Printed by Traxler Custom Printing on 60% Cotton/ 40% Polyester. 




Professional Portraits by Commons Studio © 2015

Personal Brand Package
$500

Need to create several photo assets to complement your personal brand? This package includes a 90 minute portrait session in-studio/ nearby downtown and 7 Retouched Images. Special pre-launch price ($650 value after April 30th). This option is a retainer for services. Only available for Central Ohio supporters.

 

CYP Club Date 2 Remember video by Commons Studio © 2016

Event Coverage
$550-1000

Everything from charity fundraisers and galas, conferences, community festivals, 5k races, and more! We love documenting events and sharing the story through our images. Our studio can offer both photo and video coverage. Check out the highlight reel we shot and produced for last year's Date 2 Remember fundraiser: 

 

Behind the Scenes (6:30am) video by Commons Studio © 2016

Commercial Productions 
$3500-7500

It takes a lot more than just a nice camera to create the images you see in advertising and marketing collateral. If you're a creative agency, the Half-Day Booking or Full-Day Booking perks are the perfect options for you. Contribute now as a retainer on services and save money for your clients. 
 

Career Fair Corporate Sponsor
$10,000

This is essentially our premier perk level for community impact. Your company will receive branding rights to our portrait stations during a full-day (up to 10 hours) as our team provides complimentary Professional Headshots for the attendees of a career fair in the Ohio Valley region. This service will provide high quality, retouched images for up to 100 attendees. We are also happy to meet you half-way for partial sponsorship ($5k), and will consider opportunities outside of the region if an appropriate travel budget permits. 


 

Risks & Challenges 

March 2017 is going to be HUGE. This is when we finally flip on the 'open sign' and start letting the public know exactly who we are as a company and the services we offer. We’ve lined up press, put together a marketing strategy, and will be unveiling our shiny new website with a sleek booking platform. 

With that being said, we do need YOUR HELP in order to keep Commons Studio cash-flow positive through our start-up stage. Your contributions to this campaign will ensure a successful launch of the business and keep steady work coming through the door. It is our goal to begin offering employment opportunities with benefits to the team. 

Through the mentorship we received from the SEA Change business accelerator, we understand our bottom line for financial stability, our double bottom line in order to accomplish measurable social impact, and the dollars and hours it will take to fulfill our commitment to our stakeholders. 


SEA Change Pitch Day photo by Commons Studio © 2016

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways to contribute to our campaign, any of the following options would greatly benefit our chances of achieving or even surpassing our goal of $10,000 dollars. 

  • Spreading this message to your social media pages to inspire others to contribute 
  • Telling your Friends and Colleagues 
  • Book Us for an immediate project before the campaign ends

​

“Career & Community focused on both sides of the lens.” 

199 South High St. 
Columbus, Ohio 43215
Location & Parking Guide

Email: consult@commonsstudio.com

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/commonsstudio

Instagram: @CommonsStudio

Website: ColumbusPhotographer.com

 

About the Founder

Matt Reese is a commercial photographer with a mind for entrepreneurship and social impact. Proudly based in Columbus, Ohio, Matt has quickly built a career for himself in the Midwest. His award-winning work has been featured in several gallery exhibitions, local and national publications, and thousands of Facebook profile photos through social marketing campaigns. With a background in both Fine Art and Marketing, his approach to photography attempts to blur the lines between art and commerce. In addition to his personal career and developing the  Commons Studio model, he co-founded and produces motive., a networking event/ filmed program dedicated to the creative community (a 501c3 nonprofit organization), and serves as the Programs Chair for the Ohio Valley Chapter of American Society of Media Photographers (ASMP).

story:
NPP is a network of photographers and activists which aims to tell the story of Palestine in pictures. In the four years of our existence we have produced exhibitions of Palestinian photography in Gaza, Edinburgh, London, Mexico and the USA. Our work has been shown in the Scottish Parliament, and the world-famous Edinburgh International Fringe Festival.

 

Many people worldwide do not know that millions of Palestinians still live as refugees in their own country as well as overseas. 

 

Our next project "Displaced" will show the lives of refugees in  Gaza, the West Bank and overseas.

We are in the process of inviting photographers to submit photographs illustrating our theme. From these we will select 24 images which we will then combine for our final exhibition. On this occasion we have agreed to pay a small financial reward to the photographers selected.

This is the first time we will show our work in Ramallah. We are always eager to extend our Network widely, and if you would like to join us just get in touch. You don't have to be an expert photographer. We need help with web maintenance, fund-raising and media contact. Our photographers gain a great deal of encouragement from being exhibited on an international stage, and your contributions will be enormously helpful in keeping alive the spirit of creative resistance for the Palestinian people as a whole. Your support will help us to cover printing, framing, venue and promotional costs as well as  fees for the selected images.

We now have a successful record of producing seven different exhibitions in the four years of our existence, and so we are confident that we can carry of this latest project without major difficulties.

We aim to display the exhibition in three locations - Gaza City, Ramallah and Edinburgh (the Fringe Festival again) and have secured venues in all our target cities. We  are ready to go once more with your generous assistance. 

Here's how the funding will work:

£1,500 (1,867 USD) will allow us to show the exhibition to the many thousand international visitors that visit the Edinburgh Festival Fringe every year.

For a further £700 ( 870 USD) we can show it in Ramallah.

Another £700 (870 USD) will help us mount the exhibition in Gaza.

So, for a total of £2,900 (3610 USD) we can tell the story in three locations. 

On top of this we need something like £300 (375 USD) to cover this crowd-funding appeal, leaving us with a sum £3,200 (3985USD) to cover all our charges.

Here's how it breaks down:

Fees:24x£30 = £720 (896 USD)

Printing/Framing: 24x3centres £1440 (1793 USD)

Publicity: £200 (250 USD)

Venue hire +Hospitality: £400 (500 USD)

Misc. Expenses(travel, fee transfer charges etc.) £140 ( 175 USD)

 

Please note: Unfortunately, Indiegogo only accepts donations in US Dollars. If you would like to donate an equivalent in other currencies, these exchange rates as determined on 27th April 2017 may be of help:    1 USDollar = £0.78, or 3.6 ILS or 0.7 JOD

 

So a contribution of £10 would be 12.9 USD,    47 ILS, or 9.15 JOD.

                                     £20 would be 25.8 USD,   94 ILS  or 18.3 JOD 

                               &   £50 would be 64.5 USD,230 ILS or 45.75 JOD and so on.

Further advice on exchange rates may be found at: http://www.xe.com/currencyconverter/

 

 

You can find out more about NPP at our website - www.nppalestine.org

or on our Facebook page - https://www.facebook.com/nppalestine/

 

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT
story_txt:
NPP is a network of photographers and activists which aims to tell the story of Palestine in pictures. In the four years of our existence we have produced exhibitions of Palestinian photography in Gaza, Edinburgh, London, Mexico and the USA. Our work has been shown in the Scottish Parliament, and the world-famous Edinburgh International Fringe Festival.

 
Many people worldwide do not know that millions of Palestinians still live as refugees in their own country as well as overseas. 

 
Our next project "Displaced" will show the lives of refugees in  Gaza, the West Bank and overseas.
We are in the process of inviting photographers to submit photographs illustrating our theme. From these we will select 24 images which we will then combine for our final exhibition. On this occasion we have agreed to pay a small financial reward to the photographers selected.
This is the first time we will show our work in Ramallah. We are always eager to extend our Network widely, and if you would like to join us just get in touch. You don't have to be an expert photographer. We need help with web maintenance, fund-raising and media contact. Our photographers gain a great deal of encouragement from being exhibited on an international stage, and your contributions will be enormously helpful in keeping alive the spirit of creative resistance for the Palestinian people as a whole. Your support will help us to cover printing, framing, venue and promotional costs as well as  fees for the selected images.
We now have a successful record of producing seven different exhibitions in the four years of our existence, and so we are confident that we can carry of this latest project without major difficulties.

We aim to display the exhibition in three locations - Gaza City, Ramallah and Edinburgh (the Fringe Festival again) and have secured venues in all our target cities. We  are ready to go once more with your generous assistance. 
Here's how the funding will work:
£1,500 (1,867 USD) will allow us to show the exhibition to the many thousand international visitors that visit the Edinburgh Festival Fringe every year.
For a further £700 ( 870 USD) we can show it in Ramallah.
Another £700 (870 USD) will help us mount the exhibition in Gaza.
So, for a total of £2,900 (3610 USD) we can tell the story in three locations. 
On top of this we need something like £300 (375 USD) to cover this crowd-funding appeal, leaving us with a sum £3,200 (3985USD) to cover all our charges.
Here's how it breaks down:
Fees:24x£30 = £720 (896 USD)
Printing/Framing: 24x3centres £1440 (1793 USD)
Publicity: £200 (250 USD)
Venue hire +Hospitality: £400 (500 USD)
Misc. Expenses(travel, fee transfer charges etc.) £140 ( 175 USD)
 
Please note: Unfortunately, Indiegogo only accepts donations in US Dollars. If you would like to donate an equivalent in other currencies, these exchange rates as determined on 27th April 2017 may be of help:    1 USDollar = £0.78, or 3.6 ILS or 0.7 JOD
 
So a contribution of £10 would be 12.9 USD,    47 ILS, or 9.15 JOD.
                                     £20 would be 25.8 USD,   94 ILS  or 18.3 JOD 
                               &   £50 would be 64.5 USD,230 ILS or 45.75 JOD and so on.
Further advice on exchange rates may be found at: http://www.xe.com/currencyconverter/
 
 
You can find out more about NPP at our website - www.nppalestine.org
or on our Facebook page - https://www.facebook.com/nppalestine/
 
THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT

story:
Let’s Sing an Old Song

A self-published photo box on retired practitioners of a traditional Indian theatre form in decline, Jatra

My name is Soumya Sankar Bose. I’m a young independent photographer and was born and brought up in Midnapore. After completing my engineering degree, I started photographing my surroundings, family and friends. My work was published in Better Photography, Mint Lounge, The Caravan, Wired, Aint-Bad Magazine, Platform, Gallery Carte Blanche, F-Stop Magazine, on Scroll.in and bbc.com, in The Huffington Post, Fltr, The Telegraph, Indian Express, and Medium, to just name a few. It was shown at the Delhi Photo Festival, at Goa Photo, the Goethe Institut Kolkata and in lots of other places.

 

 

I knew I had to work on this project when my uncle retired from playing traditional Jatra theatre and joined a railway factory, hoping to finally earn a living. This is how I began documenting unemployed actors who were once major Jatra figures. The project is now in its forth year. The photography part being almost finished, I have started thinking about how to unite the photographs, scripts and interviews in a photo book. With your help, I will be able to produce a limited edition of more or less 200 copies.

 

I was born into an extended family of Jatra actors and have closely witnessed the private lives of the artists at a time when the industry underwent major changes. My work thus has a deep connection with my own family history and its connection to the art of Jatra, both past and present. In this book I want to present a unique selection of staged photographs which reflect the spirit of performance and pay tribute to the theatre and its people. The photographs will be accompanied by interviews, artists’ diary entries, scripts, and old family and stage photographs.

 

"In one photograph, a newly-wed couple stand on a boat mid-river. The young groom uncovers the veil of the bride with a pallid and emaciated face. He is actually an old man and his wasted, chalk-white face could have been that of Death itself. Bose gives these stories a twist of his own."
-The Telegraph(https://goo.gl/c0NC1w)
 

My work addresses the dwindling practice of Jatra while shedding light on the fate of the artists and their inability to sustain themselves in their profession. As far as photography and documentation are concerned, my project is pushing various boundaries, blurring the real and the staged.

Here are a few links related to my Jatra project:

BBC:http://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-india-36339522

The Indian Express:http://indianexpress.com/article/lifestyle/art-and-culture/an-hour-upon-the-stage-2834617/

 The Caravan:http://www.caravanmagazine.in/vantage/photo-essay-former-heroes-jatra

Medium:https://medium.com/vantage/the-last-celebrities-of-jatra-a-dying-bengali-folk-opera-e249a5ca4ac7#.bcf37a1u8

     

    I’m planning to produce a limited edition photo box.

     

    Specs:

    Portfolio box : 5 X 6 inches.
    15 postcards

    Publisher: self-published(2015)
    Edition: 100 copies with foiled plastic cover.



    If you encounter difficulties donating through this IndieGogo account or don't have Credit Card, please feel free to contact me directly at bosesoumyasankar@gmail.com. 

    If your means are limited but you still want to support the project, please consider sharing this campaign on Facebook, on Twitter, or in an email. 

     

    THANKS A LOT!

story:
Hello, we are Roger Ramones and Francois Dallain.  We are the main content producers for our cultural project: MULTIPLICITY.  We are both Portland transplants and started working together a little over 4 years ago when we were connected by the similarities in our views on people, relationships, and life.  We started MULTIPLICITY in 2013 in a simple, yet ambitious goal to connect with the  interesting communities that define the city of Portland and to bring out the subtle  textures they add to the collective personality of our beloved city.  Your support will help us reboot our project by allowing us to get access to more communities and provide us with better tools to achieve what we set out to do.


What We Need & What You Get

For the months we were running multiplicity in 2013 and 2014, we funded everything on our own.  And we were more than fine with it.  After all, we experienced new things, we met amazing people, and we were pursuing our dream-no one can put a price tag on that.  However, we do want to improve the way we interact with people and capture our experiences-from weather proof photo and video tools, to better audio recording devices, to general equipment so that we can part-take in the activities our subjects enjoy.

By helping us finance some of these things, we would be able to provide higher quality content during the most interesting moments of our interactions.  All of our experiences we share in our social channels-Facebook, Instagram, and Tumblr-free for everyone to enjoy.  For those contributors who want to give a little more, we're providing a couple tokens of our appreciation.

The goal we set is very realistic and we would like to think our supporters can help us reach that.  If we don't meet it, we'll still be very appreciative of the amount our supporters have contributed and we'll find other ways to complement those funds.


The Impact

The impact we believe is immeasurable.  It's very difficult to quantify the ROI on motivation, inspiration and passion; yet these are the factors that make us who we are.  Titles, number of followers and money do not define who we are as individuals.  Even if we are able to subtly inspire others so that they can find confidence in staying true to themselves and following their dreams, that would benefit not only them but the rest of the world as well. In a world where the word "relationship" has been diluted, our project looks to go back to true interaction and appreciation for a person's passion and skill in their chosen craft.  We strive for authenticity and real connection. 


Risks & Challenges

Time is one of the biggest challenges for us and the people we profile.  We need to make sure we project these people and communities in the light they deserve.  Despite people's best intentions to let us into their lives, they have commitments and obligations so showing value is a huge objective of ours. With more resources we will be able to eliminate some of the inefficiencies we have experienced so far.   


Other Ways You Can Help

Support comes in many different forms and we know that in a very saturated crowdfunding world, not all can contribute financially.  Hype men/women needed!  Any hype that can be created around our project is much appreciated.  Sharing our project with your family and friends who may offer any kind of support would mean so much to us and our humble project!
