story:
Give 35mm Inc.

Our goal is to provide impoverished and underprivileged people a creative outlet through the use of photography, allowing communities to grow economically, achieve a better life, and tell their own story through creative expression. 

The Impact

It's 3 part:

1 - Allows people to tell their own story rather then someone tell it for them.  Why not let them be the narrator of their own story.

2 - Stimulates economic growth in their community

3 - Brings art and a creative outlet.  Art and creativity is such an important, healthy and positive influence in every persons life.  Lets bring something fun and positive to people that might not ever have that luxury.

-Our first project in Tanzania already had a big handing getting 40 homeless orphans off the street and back in school. 

What We Need & What You Get

100% of the donations will go to Give 35mm Inc.  A registered non-profit corporation.

Most perk packages include a gift that will immediately help the local economy of the community we are headed to next.  So it's like helping twice : )

The first 5.5k raised will go directly towards our next project at a remote tribal village in Kenya.  We want to bring some livestock on arrival and we need solar power (that will be left for the village), cameras, full time translator, etc etc.

After that the rest will go towards:

*Buying cameras, memory cards and other supplies needed for the projects.

*Putting together the art shows (printing, matting, framing, venues, etc, etc... Of course we will try to get as much of this as possible donated)

*buying all the "perk" items for you fine people : )

*Legal fees to help Give 35 Inc acheive 501 (c) 3 status so that our future fundraising efforts can be directed at large companies that are looking for charities to donate to, instead of friends and family for funding.

*Organizing future projects.

*Marketing and future fundraising costs.  (It takes money to raise money unfortunately)

*Indiegogo fees

*taxes - until we get that 501 (c) 3 thing.

If we surpass our goal it will only help us get more projects underway so we can do this for more people.  

Other Ways You Can Help

You can't help monetarily but, you want to contribute?

Sharing this campaign would be awesome!  A repost on any social media, email forwarding or word of mouth.  It would all be amazing.

If you have any old cameras collecting dust, I’d be happy to put them to use.  The old point and shoots are fun for the little kids.  When they see the big kids taking pictures they want to take pictures too and its risky to let them run around with the DSLRs. 

CF and SD cards are needed if you have extra.

Lenses would be amazing!   

External hard drives

An old laptop that I can use for dumping cards and reviewing photos with the students. 

Basically any old camera gear that you don’t want anymore we will put to use.  Whether we actually use it in our classes or just donate it to a child that will enjoy it, it will be used.  If it works ;)

Check out our website www.givethirtyfivemm.org

Follow us on Instagram  @give35mm

To donate equipment please email me at info@givethirtyfivemm.org for a mailing address.  


Special thanks to:
Mario and Fran Productions for helping me put this video and campaign together www.marioandfranproductions.com

story:
*** THANK YOU FOR THE SUPPORT*** We are so excited to bring you this project that we hold so close to our hearts. To pre-order our book once the campaign has closed, and for more photography, daily updates and information about your travels, visit www.astral-dust.com 

A True Sense Of Freedom

Carly is a professional film photographer and David is a writer, musician and photographer from Vancouver, BC.

In Winter 2015, we caught the last ferry to a farm on Vancouver Island to buy an old white school bus that looked like it hadn't been started in years. It was covered under a blue tarp and a blanket of snow, and the owner had to find jumper cables with his flashlight to start the bus up. Without  a clue what we were getting ourselves into, we took a chance, bought it, and slept on the floor of the bus that night on the side of the road. We fell asleep with an overwhelming sense of excitement and possibility. With a (very) small budget, borrowed tools, no prior knowledge, and 100 trips to the hardware store, we've created our dream home on wheels that we now live in all year round. 

Until last year, we both had demanding jobs, too many bills, and apartments filled with stuff we didn't need... Now we believe in a different way of life; one where you're free to live out your wildest dreams and able to create and explore without restraint. Moving into our school bus and leaving our jobs have given us the freedom to dedicate our lives to our passions - film photography, writing, music, leatherwork, art, culture. Our hope is that through our story, you see that you are truly free to live any life you can imagine. It doesn't matter what your life currently looks like now, or how far away your dreams seem. 

Photography + Poetry Book

Astral Dust

"A capsule of film photos and words from the Spring we travelled across America in our school bus"

*Cover image and design subject to change on final copy*

Astral Dust will be a high quality photo book featuring honest film photography, poetry written as we are in the moments, and a window into our lifestyle on the open road. Creating the book will take us off the beaten path to experience the American Southwest, uninhibited, through painted corners of the desert at sunset, roadside diners with red-lipped waitresses, disheveled bedrooms of fashion models, abandoned mansions, truck stops, run down motels, strangers' living rooms, cosmic music festivals...

Why Film?

Film photography captures the soul of individuals and spirit of the landscape in a way that modern processes can't. The light leaks, lens flares, dust and grain are all carried through the process of film photography and show the mood, energy and temperature of the environment in the image. 

We aim to capture youth culture through the eyes of two people living on the road with nowhere to be and everything ahead. 

Your Support

Whether it be financial or moral, your support means the world to us. If you aren't able to contribute by pre-ordering our book, sharing our story with friends and family would go along away. If you do find yourself curious about our project and would like to support, here is how the funds will be spent to bring Astral Dust to life:

75% Publishing + Printing + Shipping: It's important for us to remain in creative control of this project so we've decided to self-publish our book. At least half of the funds will go towards publishing, printing and shipping the final products to those of you who have pre-ordered. 

20% Film + Developing: There are significant costs involved when shooting film, so a portion of the funds will be allocated to purchasing and processing the film while we're on the road. 

5% Miscellaneous: We've done our best to consider all costs, but like any new endeavour, there are always guaranteed to be additional things to pay for. A small portion will go towards the unexpected. 

If we don't reach our entire funding goal, the project will still continue and all prints, books, keychains etc. will still be delivered.

The Goods 

Astral Dust Photography Book

Our book will be printed in soft cover, hard cover and Ebook format. The book will be a minimum of 100 pages blending film photos, poetry and stories from our journey and the people we meet. 

Leather Cactus Keychain

David runs a handmade leather business, Railroad Slave Leather, from our school bus. Every book order will include a leather keychain handmade by him... and they're pretty sweet. 

Our Route

Here's a general look at the route we will be taking. In reality, it will be a lot more zigzag as we hit up all the small towns and parks along the way, but this will give you an idea. If you live somewhere along this route, hit us up and let's grab a beer and explore. 

Key Stops:

Portland, OR
Las Vegas, NV
Death Valley, CA
Los Angeles, CA
Joshua Tree, CA
Sedona, AZ
Monument Valley, AZ/UT
Grand Canyon, UT
White Sands, NM
Austin, TX
New Orleans, LA
Nashville, TN

...and so many more small towns and cities as we go. 
 

Risks & Challenges

Mechanical Issues - We are traveling in an older school bus so we can't guarantee there will be no break-downs, however the bus has been well maintained and inspected. Since it's our home, any mechanical issues will be dealt with and the trip will continue.

The hurdles are part of the experience, and we're confident we can tackle anything thrown our way. 

Connect With Us

If you have a question about our project and would like to get in touch, feel free to leave us a comment on IndieGoGo or contact us directly:

Carly Dame
carlydame@gmail.com
Instagram: @carlydame
 

David Novotny
davidnov77@gmail.com
Instagram: @railroad_slave
 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

You are the hourglass
I was just here
As your wings left me and flew
With an infinite flower
Your hand has to touch mine beautiful child 

- David Novotny

*Cover image and design subject to change on final copy*
Astral Dust will be a high quality photo book featuring honest film photography, poetry written as we are in the moments, and a window into our lifestyle on the open road. Creating the book will take us off the beaten path to experience the American Southwest, uninhibited, through painted corners of the desert at sunset, roadside diners with red-lipped waitresses, disheveled bedrooms of fashion models, abandoned mansions, truck stops, run down motels, strangers' living rooms, cosmic music festivals...
Why Film?
Film photography captures the soul of individuals and spirit of the landscape in a way that modern processes can't. The light leaks, lens flares, dust and grain are all carried through the process of film photography and show the mood, energy and temperature of the environment in the image. 


We aim to capture youth culture through the eyes of two people living on the road with nowhere to be and everything ahead. 
Your Support
Whether it be financial or moral, your support means the world to us. If you aren't able to contribute by pre-ordering our book, sharing our story with friends and family would go along away. If you do find yourself curious about our project and would like to support, here is how the funds will be spent to bring Astral Dust to life:
75% Publishing + Printing + Shipping: It's important for us to remain in creative control of this project so we've decided to self-publish our book. At least half of the funds will go towards publishing, printing and shipping the final products to those of you who have pre-ordered. 20% Film + Developing: There are significant costs involved when shooting film, so a portion of the funds will be allocated to purchasing and processing the film while we're on the road. 
5% Miscellaneous: We've done our best to consider all costs, but like any new endeavour, there are always guaranteed to be additional things to pay for. A small portion will go towards the unexpected. 
If we don't reach our entire funding goal, the project will still continue and all prints, books, keychains etc. will still be delivered.
The Goods 
Astral Dust Photography Book
Our book will be printed in soft cover, hard cover and Ebook format. The book will be a minimum of 100 pages blending film photos, poetry and stories from our journey and the people we meet. 

Leather Cactus Keychain
David runs a handmade leather business, Railroad Slave Leather, from our school bus. Every book order will include a leather keychain handmade by him... and they're pretty sweet. 


Our Route
Here's a general look at the route we will be taking. In reality, it will be a lot more zigzag as we hit up all the small towns and parks along the way, but this will give you an idea. If you live somewhere along this route, hit us up and let's grab a beer and explore. 

Key Stops:
Portland, ORLas Vegas, NVDeath Valley, CALos Angeles, CAJoshua Tree, CASedona, AZMonument Valley, AZ/UTGrand Canyon, UTWhite Sands, NMAustin, TXNew Orleans, LANashville, TN
...and so many more small towns and cities as we go.  

Risks & Challenges
Mechanical Issues - We are traveling in an older school bus so we can't guarantee there will be no break-downs, however the bus has been well maintained and inspected. Since it's our home, any mechanical issues will be dealt with and the trip will continue.
The hurdles are part of the experience, and we're confident we can tackle anything thrown our way. 
Connect With Us
If you have a question about our project and would like to get in touch, feel free to leave us a comment on IndieGoGo or contact us directly:
Carly Damecarlydame@gmail.comInstagram: @carlydame 
David Novotnydavidnov77@gmail.comInstagram: @railroad_slave 
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
You are the hourglassI was just hereAs your wings left me and flewWith an infinite flowerYour hand has to touch mine beautiful child 
- David Novotny

story:
Visible Girls - The Story

Beyond the fascinating stories of the Visible Girls’ lives in those intervening 36 years, this show aims to encourage and celebrate self-expression in all women regardless of age.

Women’s subcultural history is largely untold. As a 22-year old photographer in the early 1980s, Anita Corbin felt the irresistible drive to document those girl-punks, mods, skins, rockers, Rastas and young lesbians, ensuring that their individuality and power were fiercely represented.  All around her, a grassroots energy in 1980’s Britain was being expressed through shaved head and scooter, Mohican and musical taste, style and sexual orientation; girls being themselves, wearing what they wanted to wear, rebelling, living life. All of it back-dropped and fuelled by Thatcher’s Britain, the Brixton Riots and the Miners’ Strike. She called the resulting collection: Visible Girls.

The Visible Girls: Revisited touring exhibition sets those original images next to brand new photographs of the women those girls became. This time, however, they are back-dropped by Brexit, Britain’s 2nd female Prime Minister and terrorist attacks as daily news.

The contrasts and similarities between the two sets of images evoke a deep sense of female tribal allegiance across generation and gender. This show promotes the spirit of female friendship, courage, and non-conformism, as well as the effects of living as a woman in a changing Britain.

 

 

 

The Exhibition

The exhibition showcases the vibrant style and music-driven tribal allegiances of the 1980s as well as the deeper issues of belonging and womanhood.

The original images are hugely evocative; the vibe of the 1980’s writ large in hairstyles, clothes, makeup, cigarettes, pub toilets and graffiti. The new images make a brilliant, thought-provoking contrast. The touring exhibition uses 1980s set design, memorabilia and original tape-recordings of the girls talking about what it was like to be in a subculture. There are also new interviews with the ‘women’ as they are now reflecting on how it feels to have once been a partying skinhead or a scooter club mod…and to now be a mother of four or a high-flying lawyer.

As far as possible, the girls are in their original pairs photographed in (often) the same locations.

This exhibition has the power to inspire. We want it to be accessible, showing in community spaces in as many locations as possible UK-wide so that through these Visible Girls, women everywhere can celebrate their individuality - despite what society tells them they ‘should’ be. In this modern age where most ‘tribes’ are online, this show will also encourage women to think about the nature of friendships and what it is to have a tribe.

This is a growing exhibition – as more girls from the original shots are tracked down their photographs and interviews will be added to the next phase of the show.

Each stop on the tour will offer interactive workshops to empower young women. There will also be pop-up street-side photo sessions to capture the Visible Girls and Boys of every place we visit for our Instagram feed!

 

What we need & what you get!

We need your support to help us fund the on-going, 3-year UK touring exhibition.

In return for your support, you can choose to receive a reward (scroll down for the complete list on the right-hand side of this page and view our image gallery at the top of the page.)

Style, tribe and self-expression have influenced our collection of unique, limited edition rewards. These include t-shirts, tote bags, limited edition signed exhibition catalogues and prints.

 

How we use the funds

We want this show to reach the Visible Girls (and Boys) of as many places countrywide as possible and for exhibition entry to stay free to all.

We need money for:

 - Physically travelling the show around the UK.

 - Growing the exhibition as we discover new Visible Girls.

 - Printing and framing.

-  Public empowerment workshops.

 - Development of an education package for school groups.

 - Production of the ‘London’ edition of the catalogue in 2018.

- Production of the Visible Girls Documentary film series.

HELP US SPREAD THE WORD

 

Big Canvas Bags

100% Organic T shirts, hand pulled by Dan in Exeter

Visible GirlsTank made from 100% Modal, soft and sustainable!

 

Signed limited edition catalogues

 

Limited Edition Prints

Our backers have an opportunity to invest in Signed Limited Edition (50) prints 12"X 10"

 

 

Limited Edition Posters

collectable Hull City of Culture exclusive exhibition posters.

 

 

PLEASE NOTE: Donations may also be made anonymously and rewards can be gifted for a unique present for a friend or relative.

 

 

Please share this campaign with others and help us to reach our target. We will be posting exclusive updates and news across our social media channels - keep up to date with the exhibition and tour by following us on twitter and instagram. 

www.visiblegirls.com

 

The Team

 

Photographer: Anita Corbin

Anita has been a photographer for 36 years and has travelled worldwide generating iconic images for business and the media including The Sunday Times and The Observer magazines.

"When I took the original images I was determined that these vibrant, strong young women should claim their place in photographic history. I want the new images to say that who we once were isn’t lost, but necessarily informs who we become."

 

 

 

Curator: Tory Turk

Tory is creative lead at the world famous Hyman Archive and curated the well-publicised exhibitions, ‘The Jam: About the Young Idea’ and ‘A Street Style Journey’.

"This exhibition showcases a hugely moving and powerful part of social history. Women’s voices and their history – especially their subcultures - have rarely been shown or explored in this way. It enables young women to come into a positive relationship with age and older women to reconnect to their adolescent selves who formed the bedrock of their wisdom."

 

 


Writer: Deborah Willimott

Deborah is a freelance editorial director and magazine writer and has contributed to GLAMOUR, Cosmopolitan, The Huffington Post, Stylist, The Guardian Weekend Magazine, more! and Men’s Health.


"Music and fashion can sometimes appear superficial, but really they are a universal language of self-expression, making them powerful conduits for unity and relationship across ages and generations – this exhibition isn’t just about great story telling but a gateway to self-understanding"

 

Designer: Lucy May

A freelance art director and graphic designer who has overseen and worked on campaigns for the Barbican, Whitechapel Gallery, Royal Court Theatre and Manchester Art Gallery

"The photographs are not only aesthetically beautiful but intriguing. They make us want to know more about these people's stories. The project is like a time capsule its far-reaching themes will still be relevant in another 36 years"

How we use the funds

We want this show to reach the Visible Girls (and Boys) of as many places countrywide as possible and for exhibition entry to stay free to all.

We need money for:

 - Physically travelling the show around the UK.

 - Growing the exhibition as we discover new Visible Girls.

 - Printing and framing.

-  Public empowerment workshops.

 - Development of an education package for school groups.

 - Production of the ‘London’ edition of the catalogue in 2018.

- Production of the Visible Girls Documentary film series.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Ashley Stone and I am a current student at Edinboro University. Not only am I president of the photography club, through which this campaign is being created for, I am the designer and a published artist within Silvervision itself. For the past two years of my presidency, I have successfully relaunched the production of this book after a few years hiatus. Now, at it's 22nd edition, Silvervision is redefining the strengths of Edinboro University's Photography Department.  

Silvervision is a student-run publication published at Edinboro University and was founded by renowned photographer Kathe Kowalski in the 90's. Since then, hundreds of photographers have graduated from Edinboro and emerged as artists through this publication. The work displayed within showcase the dedication, drive, and beautiful artwork of aspiring photographers. The vision, the mindset, the very epitome of what the creative eye longs to see. 

This campaign is asking for funding to professionally publish the book at a local printer. Through professionally publishing, it solidifies the importance and reliabilty of the department and the publication.

By donating, you are encouraging these beloved and talented artists to succeed.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • $2500 is needed to cover the costs of printing
  • By pledging $10, you will receive a 2017 Silvervision logo sticker
  • By pledging $30, you will recieve a 2017 Silvervision logo sticker and reserve and receive your own copy of Silvervision mailed directly to you.
  • By pledging $50, you will receive a sticker and a signed copy of the 2017 edition of Silvervision.
  • By pledging $100, you will receive, a sticker, a signed copy of Silvervision, and a 8x10 photograph from the photographer of your choice mailed directly to you.
  • If not enough money is raised, then production of the book will be cut and a lower amount of books will be published.
 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are not asking for everyone to give up their last penny to us. We are asking you to help spread the word to those who can and are willing. So, please donate if you can, and spread the word!

story:
Photo by: Andreas Oetker-Kast, from the book: Tamar, Where Are You?

 

Link zu Informationen auf deutsch.

 

The Project

My first trip to Georgia was in 2011 – and ever since, I’ve been working on this project. First out of a fascination for this unknown country, it was like they say, if you come to Georgia once, you will come back. Year over year this fascination grew into curiosity and the wish to know and understand more.

When I was thinking about making a book of this long-term project, I soon realized that my point of view alone would not suffice - I wanted to go deeper. Which led to the idea to invite Georgian artists, photographers and writers, to collaborate on the book – and my question to them was: If I asked you about Georgia, which story would you tell me?

These stories are collected in the book „Tamar, where are you?“ – and are put in dialogue with my photographs. Through this juxtaposition of inside versus outside view, we get a deeper insight into this truly fascinating country.

With contributions by:
Ana Kordzaia-Samadashvili, Dato Turashvili, Dina Oganova, Giorgi Shengelia, Giorgi Tabliashvili, Guram Tsibakhashvili, Natela Grigalashvili, Tinatin Kiguradze, Vakho Khetaguri, Yuri Mechitov

 

Double-page spread from "Tamar, Where Are You?", photos by: Yuri Mechitov

 

Why the collaboration

When you want to approach a country photographically, what is the best way to do it? As a photographer, your perception is always influenced by your origin, your perspective is directed by your cultural background. So the question is, whether or not it is possible to photographically grasp a country and a culture that is not your own.

When you're traveling to Georgia it is easy to be overwhelmed by the country's beauty and the hospitality of the Georgians, the legend says that any guest was sent from god and this is how travelers are greeted. But what if you take a deeper look, a look at what life is really like in Georgia, in the cities or on the country side? How do Georgians perceive their lives, what are the developments, where are the challenges posed by the reality in Georgia?

With this project I'm looking for answers to questions like these - but with my perspective put in dialogue with the stories of the Georgian artists, we create an exchange of positions and that always leads to a better understanding.

 

Double-page spread spread from "Tamar, Where Are You?", photo by Dina Oganova

 

Double-page spread spread from "Tamar, Where Are You?", photos by Vakho Khetaguri

 

Double-page spread spread from "Tamar, Where Are You?", photos by Andreas Oetker-Kast

 

What you'll find in the book

The photography is mostly documentary style, but there's not only a mix of colour and b&w photography, but also of journalistic and more conceptual images. When we were working on the design of the book, our apporach was to give each story its individual layout - and we were guided by the content and the atmosphere of each story.

And then there's the essays, written by Georgian authors, which provide another layer to the understanding of Georgia - there's a short personal overview over the history of Georgia by Dato Turashvili, a free essay by Ana Kordzaia-Samadashvili and a very personal description of what life feels like in Georgia, written by the artist Giorgi Tabliashvili.

All texts are in German and English.

Double-page spread spread from "Tamar, Where Are You?", photos by Natela Grigalashvili

Double-page spread from "Tamar, Where Are You?", essay of Ana Kordzaia-Samadashvili (German version), accompanied by an author portrait by Tinatin Kiguradze, from her project "I Will Always Be"

 

About the Initiator of the project

Andreas Oetker-Kast is a freelance photographer based in Kiel, Germany. Following his studies in sociology and a successful carreer in public relations both in Germany and in the U.S.A. he turned to professional photography in 2004, specializing in music and documentary style photography. Since 2006 his work has been exhibited in solo and group exhibitions in Germany and internationally and was published in books and catalogs. In 2012 he and his wife started their own self-publishing endeavor bt:st verlag to give their works a new home.

www.andreasok.com

Photo by: Andreas Oetker-Kast, from the book: Tamar, Where Are You?

Double-page spread spread from "Tamar, Where Are You?", photos by Giorgi Shengelia

 

What we would like to achieve

We have already succeeded in gathering some amazing supporters for the project, like the Georgian National Book Center, which helps us with a part of the production costs. But there's still so much left to do, so here's what we would use the money for, that we will raise with this campaign:

Design & layout, concept, execution & pre-print: 2.500 €

Translation, editing & fees: 1.990 €

Additional production costs: 1.500 €

Indiegogo fees: 275 €

You can help us to make this book happen - by signing up for one of the perks mentioned on this site. We very much appreciate any financial support, or else any help in spreading the word and this campaign by sending it out to all your friends.

Together, we'll create a very special insight into an amazing country.

We will mention all financial backers of this project on our dedicated web site www.tamarwhereareyou.com

The book will be produced and published by our bt:st verlag (www.bt-st.de) in summer of 2018 - before we will present it at the Frankfurt Bookfair in October 2018, on the main stand of the Guest of Honor Georgia.

Didi madloba - thank you very much - herzlichen Dank!

 

Remark: all perks are produced and signed by Andreas Oetker-Kast

 

Double-page spread from "Tamar, Where Are You?", photo by Guram Tsibakhashvili

Translation, editing & fees: 1.990 €
Additional production costs: 1.500 €
Indiegogo fees: 275 €
You can help us to make this book happen - by signing up for one of the perks mentioned on this site. We very much appreciate any financial support, or else any help in spreading the word and this campaign by sending it out to all your friends.
Together, we'll create a very special insight into an amazing country.
We will mention all financial backers of this project on our dedicated web site www.tamarwhereareyou.com
The book will be produced and published by our bt:st verlag (www.bt-st.de) in summer of 2018 - before we will present it at the Frankfurt Bookfair in October 2018, on the main stand of the Guest of Honor Georgia.
Didi madloba - thank you very much - herzlichen Dank!
 
Remark: all perks are produced and signed by Andreas Oetker-Kast
 

Double-page spread from "Tamar, Where Are You?", photo by Guram Tsibakhashvili

story:
Hey! I’m Karolina and that’s my story 

For over a decade I’ve been organizing my life around travel and photography. It all began when I was 13 and out of thin air came the idea of becoming a photographer. I got my first camera from my parents who have ever since been encouraging my arts interests. I read countless books and attended many lectures to learn how a good photograph is done. Finally, I was very lucky enough, right after finishing high school and having passed all the exams I was enlisted into the most important and respected film school in Poland - Polish National Film School in Łódź. And this is where my actual photographic adventure started.

During my university years, most of my output has been about people and some sort of documentary road projects. So was my life. Split into two - photographing and traveling.

How did I collect money for that?

Along with my studies, I have been doing a lot of commercial work - shooting stills for the movies, sets or some lookbook fashion pictures for small enterprises. Some of my photographs have even won cash prices so I could pay for my next travel costs. I’m used to a tight budget life as a rule, usually do a secondhand shopping and avoid eating out in fancy restaurants. When traveling, I quite often choose a hitch-hike or couch surfing. Once I even hired myself out for a 6-month contract as a ship photographer for Carnival Cruise lines. All of the money I have been making so far, helped me finance my travels and passion for photography in general. This year is the biggest challege I have ever faced, therefore it needs careful preparations. I want everything to be perfectly organized. This is going to be an advanture of a lifetime, so I count on your support !

This year is special for me, because it’s the last semester and I have to prepare my own photographic Master’s Degree creative project. I have always had this dream about „Into the Wild” road project. And this is what my diploma topic is about. I want to go across Canada, towards Alaska and than back to the USA; following masters of American road photography, Alec Soth or Ryan McGinley. I want to construct my own vision of the places I’m about to see and people I will meet. I'm also very inspired by Jack Kerouac stories, all that simplicity and levity of being on the road. I wish I could join him just for a while, Im sure it would be the story of my life. The dreaming is for the dreamers.

 I am really thrilled by the prospects of meeting new folks, listening to their stories, exploring new places, and finally, being able to put it all into visual documentary. Beside experiencing the trip as itself, having an exhibition and passing my MD exams.

I’m definitely too curious about the world and its people to sit quietly at home, in Warsaw. Because of my final exams and written Master’s Degree thesis schedule, I decided to do something much bigger than i did before, that’s why I need YOU! I hope I’m gonna make my dream come true with your help!!!!

 

 

My Portfolio

www.karolinagrabowska.com

instagram - @karolinagrabowska

 

Other ways you can help

Some of you undoubtedly are not able to contribute financially. That's fine! If you like what I'm doing here, perhaps you can help in other ways?

Email people you think would find this project interesting!

Share this campaign on social media using the Indiegogo share buttons!

Maybe you are living somewhere near my route so you can offer me a place to sleep

Perhaps some of your friends live near my American trail. If so, ask them if they could be of any help. If needed. Just in case.

story:
Synopsis

 

About myself : 

I am a wildlife enthusiast and a photographer residing in Bangalore, India. My love for nature and wildlife started in the year 2013 and ever since then I have been traveling to different wildlife reserves and sanctuaries. What started as a curiosity endeavour has now turned into a life-long purpose. During the past seven years I have spent most of my time in the wild, photographing birds and mammals. My limited edition fine-art prints have been showcased and featured on books and Art galleries of India.

Some of the highlights of my work have been documenting in depth, the life of the most enigmatic and elusive wildlife in India; be it  the Royal Bengal Tiger, the majestic Tuskers or a plethora of Avifauna. Some of these images are featured in this book.

 

About the book : 

Forest Archives is my first attempt towards publishing a coffee table book. With your support through this Indiegogo campaign, Forest Archives will be a 160-page fine-art wildlife photography book, containing about 200 of the most evocative and beautiful images from wildlife sanctuaries and tiger reserves of India. 

Forest Archives will feature color images. Through this book the reader will be exposed to natural diversity, pristine wildlife reserves, vast landscapes, and get an insight into the lives of the Fauna that thrives amidst the Indian jungles. 

This book features images primarily from India, the fauna that thrives across the pristine wildlife reserves & its vast landscapes. The beautiful topography, consisting of foothills of the Himalayan Range, the valleys in the Western Ghats, the Grasslands of Central India and the arid regions of the Gulf of Kutch, are the core elements of the book. The book is not based on any particular animal or species but focuses exclusively on the emotional and metaphorical power of the images and how they contribute to tell the story. 

This book puts forth a message of art, beauty, and conservation through its characters and their stories. With every turning page, the reader unfolds the journey of an individual character, making them ask some questions about nature, learn a little bit about animal traits and have an understanding that, from the branches of a tree to the neurons in our brain, we are all connected – and that is the conservation aspect of this book.

 

 

The Vision

 

The core idea is to be able to share some of the natural history moments with you from some of the remote corners of the country. In recent years, thanks to the Conservation activities in places such as Africa and the Polar regions, things are now changing for good.

The appalling austerities, however, which the Indian wildlife has been subjected to by humans, has reached a tipping point, where after it could very easily become a record of things that we stand to lose. We are losing forests and animal habitats - Like soil in a garden, which is home to the critically endangered species such as Tigers and Elephants.

One of the prime reasons for choosing a coffee table book format with engaging pictures and stories was with the intention of capturing the reader's attention and informing them about the alarming issues related to Wildlife in India.

 

The Design

 

  • Forest Archives is in Hard Cover Format and enveloped in a spot UV embossed Dust Jacket to prolong the Life span of the Book, all together giving it a Premium feel.

 

  • We used Landscape layout to create the shape we envisioned for images, and used the best quality Fine art paper for print.

 

  • As it goes with the Symmetry in Nature, it was of utmost importance to maintain the same throughout the Book. The spacing around images and in between lines of Text is consistent throughout. The two page spread design of the book is created to use both large and small images, balancing each spread carefully and overall giving the reader a Larger than Life perspective.

 

 

How Can You Contribute & What Are The Perks

 

At the moment we are fine-tuning the layout, image selection and design of the book. We are really happy & excited with how the book is shaping out.

A great production and design team is working with us on this project.

We booked our printing slot in India at one of the best fine-art book printers of Asia. The only thing missing is the funding to make this dream into a reality. The funds we are seeking to raise with this campaign will cover printing costs of the book.

In order to bring this book to life, we will be needing $ 3000 USD, which will entirely be used towards the printing cost. You can contribute and help us to get any or all of the following rewards:

 

  • Shout outs and book mentions

 

 

  • Fine art Prints

 

 

  • Regular Edition Coffee Table book

 

 

  • Limited Edition Coffee Table book with a UV embossed Slip case, signed by the Author

 

The Impact

 

In recent years, thanks to the Conservation activities in places such as Africa and the Polar regions, things are now changing for good. A couple of endangered species are breathing a sigh of relief. Needless to say, there is a lot more damage that has been done, and a lot many efforts need to go into correcting the wrong. 

The appalling austerities, however, which the Indian wildlife has been subjected to by humans, has reached a tipping point, where after it could very easily become a record of things that we stand to lose. We are losing forests and animal habitats - Like soil in a garden, which is home to the critically endangered species such as Tigers and Elephants. 

One of the prime reasons for choosing a coffee table book format with engaging pictures and stories was with the intention of capturing the reader's attention and informing them about the aforementioned issues. This book puts forth a message of art, beauty, and conservation through its characters and their stories. With every turning page, the reader unfolds the journey of an individual character, making them ask some questions about nature, learn a little about animal traits and have an understanding that, From the branches of a tree to the neurons in our brain, we are all connected – and that is the conservation aspect of this book.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

The only risks involved with the realization of this project if we manage to reach the funding goal will be related to the current Covid-19 emergency. Travel restrictions and eventual lock-down measures in India might have an impact on the production time of the book. In this case, we would reschedule printing and inform all backers that the delivery date has been postponed.

That being said, We are very proud of our supply chain and are confident that we can create the product with the highest quality and on time. We promise to put our energies and focus to ensure our customers satisfaction, product quality, and meeting deadlines.

Though the story narrated is timeless, the book will hopefully have even more resonance in the current dramatic times the world and human kind in particular are going through at the moment.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Even if you're unable to make a financial contribution at this time, we would greatly appreciate your participation in any of the following ways: 

• Sharing our campaign with friends and colleagues and over social media

 

• Writing down your own concerns about Wildlife Conservation and ecological sanity and sharing those alongside your post about our campaign 

 

• Reach out to educators who you think may want to integrate this book into their classrooms

story:
Hello my friends,

Kiara Laetitia here. If you're on this page you probably already know about me so I'm gonna save you time reading all the bs...I did this and that :-)))

I created a photographic calendar: Kiara Laetitia Never Give Up Calendar 2020. This calendar has more than 12 exclusive, new pictures that I can't wait for you to see.

The photographer is Alessandro Quadrelli - Shoot To Kill, who has photographed the likes of Ian Gillan and Ian Paice (Deep Purple), Kee Marcello (ex Europe), Ricky Warwick and Schott Gorham (Thin Lizzy), Hardline and many more.

IMPORTANT: This is the only pre-order page for my Calendar. This means that this is the only and best way to get the Calendar. I'm only one persona and Indiegogo will help a lot in fulfilling and delivering the calendar directly to you.

 

What You Get

You'll receive the Kiara Laetitia Never Give Up Calendar 2020 directly to your address of choice, no hassle. SHIPPING IS FREE WORLDWIDE!!!

If you have any questions I'll be happy to answer them.

Thanks for your support,

Kiara

story:
Who We Are

We are Dr. Josef Castaneda-Liles and Dr. Maria del Socorro Castaneda-Liles from Santa Clara University. Our book in process, Portraits of the Dream, features the stories of leaders from various industries (tech, academia, law, fashion, entertainment and others) - all of whom arrived as undocumented immigrants. Their portraits are captured by the renowned photographer Michael Collopy, who has photographed Nelson Mandela, Bishop Desmond Tutu, Jane Goodall, Madeline Albright, Cesar Chavez, and hundreds of other peacemakers and leaders. Our goal is to feature up to eighteen individuals in Portraits of the Dream. To date, we have collected the narratives of thirteen individuals and have conducted seven photo shoots with Michael Collopy. Check out our video that features Professor Julio Moreno and entrepreneurs Samuel Ulloa and Laura Gomez for more information on our project!

What inspires us to create this book? For us, the immigration debate is personal. One of us arrived to the United States undocumented, and (through much effort and perseverance) earned a Ph.D. and became a college professor. This achievement was made possible in part by comprehensive immigration reform legislation passed nearly three decades ago. Both of us have worked with students and community members that are undocumented or come from mixed-status families. We share with them the desire to see compassionate immigration reform that provides a path to citizenship for those working to achieve a better life.

Attorney and school board member Jose Alfredo Hernandez, J.D.

Why a book? Why now?

By focusing on formerly undocumented people, we want to show what has become of what might be considered the "DREAMers" of prior decades. How many potential educators, leaders and innovators are we holding back now due to stalled comprehensive immigration reform? Our book is intended to capture the hearts and minds of people that have not been inclined to support immigration reform, because stories can be an effective tool to inspire empathy and create change. We want our book to contribute to the movement to make comprehensive, compassionate immigration reform a reality because the time for justice is always now.

Both of us are experienced authors and editors with multiple publications each. Dr. Maria del Socorro Castaneda-Liles has a book in progress on the lived religious experience of Latinas to be published by Oxford University Press. Dr. Josef Castaneda-Liles worked for a number of years as a professional editor with extensive experience working with multiple authors. Our photographer Michael Collopy has published several books of his own. These include Architects of Peace: Visions of Hope in Words and Images (2002) and Works of Love are Works of Peace: Mother Teresa and the Missionaries of Charity (1996). The latter book offers the most comprehensive photographic documentation of the work of Mother Teresa and the Missionaries of Charity published. 

Entrepreneur (founder of start-up Atipica) Laura I. Gomez

Our Campaign

Most of the individuals that we feature in Portraits live in our home state of California. However, from the start, we wanted our book to feature formerly undocumented professionals and leaders from throughout the country. We are honored to have the involvement of professionals such as Dr. Harold Fernandez, a professor of surgery and director of the Heart Institute at the Stony Brook School of Medicine in New York. We have been inspired the leadership of Isabel Castillo, a young woman from Virginia who did not let her undocumented status stop her from advocating for her rights and the rights of others; she later received an honorary doctorate from the University of San Francisco. 

As editors of Portraits of the Dream, we pour our own "sweat equity" into putting the stories together. Our real cost is the photography, especially when it comes to conducting photo shoots with individuals who live out-of-state. All of the proceeds from our campaign would go toward the fees and travel costs needed to fly Michael Collopy outside of California, and cover a few in-state photo shoots. Neither of the editors will retain any of the proceeds from this campaign.

By supporting our campaign, particularly at the $125 level or more, you will get early access to the printed version of the book as it is released (signed by the editors and Michael Collopy). All supporters of our campaign become part of the Portraits family. You will receive regular updates of the progress of the book, and preview excerpts and photos (for personal use only). You will be notified of events that feature some of the professionals and leaders profiled in our book (particularly in the San Francisco Bay Area and Southern California). Our highest supporters will get access to awesome incentives like a photo shoot with Michael Collopy or a unique wine country tour at Latino-owned vineyards in Napa with the editors and Michael Collopy.

If we do not reach our goal, we would still use whatever proceeds earned from this campaign to fund the photography of Portraits of the Dream. We would likely have to focus more exclusively on people residing in California. Migrant communities, however, can be found throughout the United States, and we want the individuals featured in our book to reflect this geographic diversity. 

Entrepreneur (founder of start-up Listo!) Samuel Ulloa

Risks & Challenges

As we know, coordinating a project with working professionals is hard. We have had to reschedule interviews or photo shoots at times because appointments fall through and life happens (not to mention our own schedules). Our biggest obstacle, however, is obtaining the funding needed to complete our project. Having financial backing will allow us to assure our prospective publishers that the photographic component of our project will be completed as we finalize the draft of the manuscript.

Dr. Julio Moreno, Professor, University of San Francisco

Be a Part of Our "Dream Team"

Portraits of the Dream is a team effort, and we want every one of you to be part of our team! We are on a mission to create a legacy of stories and images that will serve as a catalyst for change in the immediate future, and remind future generations of the positive contributions that immigrants make to this country. If you share our passion, we know that we can count on you to support Portraits of the Dream with your gift and commitment to spreading the word. We look forward to thanking you for your support and welcoming you as part of the Portraits family.

We have been inspired the leadership of Isabel Castillo, a young woman from Virginia who did not let her undocumented status stop her from advocating for her rights and the rights of others; she later received an honorary doctorate from the University of San Francisco. 
As editors of Portraits of the Dream, we pour our own "sweat equity" into putting the stories together. Our real cost is the photography, especially when it comes to conducting photo shoots with individuals who live out-of-state. All of the proceeds from our campaign would go toward the fees and travel costs needed to fly Michael Collopy outside of California, and cover a few in-state photo shoots. Neither of the editors will retain any of the proceeds from this campaign.
By supporting our campaign, particularly at the $125 level or more, you will get early access to the printed version of the book as it is released (signed by the editors and Michael Collopy). All supporters of our campaign become part of the Portraits family. You will receive regular updates of the progress of the book, and preview excerpts and photos (for personal use only). You will be notified of events that feature some of the professionals and leaders profiled in our book (particularly in the San Francisco Bay Area and Southern California). Our highest supporters will get access to awesome incentives like a photo shoot with Michael Collopy or a unique wine country tour at Latino-owned vineyards in Napa with the editors and Michael Collopy.
If we do not reach our goal, we would still use whatever proceeds earned from this campaign to fund the photography of Portraits of the Dream. We would likely have to focus more exclusively on people residing in California. Migrant communities, however, can be found throughout the United States, and we want the individuals featured in our book to reflect this geographic diversity. 


Entrepreneur (founder of start-up Listo!) Samuel Ulloa
    

Risks & Challenges

 As we know, coordinating a project with working professionals is hard. We have had to reschedule interviews or photo shoots at times because appointments fall through and life happens (not to mention our own schedules). Our biggest obstacle, however, is obtaining the funding needed to complete our project. Having financial backing will allow us to assure our prospective publishers that the photographic component of our project will be completed as we finalize the draft of the manuscript.


Dr. Julio Moreno, Professor, University of San Francisco
Be a Part of Our "Dream Team" Portraits of the Dream is a team effort, and we want every one of you to be part of our team! We are on a mission to create a legacy of stories and images that will serve as a catalyst for change in the immediate future, and remind future generations of the positive contributions that immigrants make to this country. If you share our passion, we know that we can count on you to support Portraits of the Dream with your gift and commitment to spreading the word. We look forward to thanking you for your support and welcoming you as part of the Portraits family.

story:
Who? What? Why?

My name is Misha Vallejo, I am an Ecuadorian photographer, member of the Runa Photos collective. Last year I shot a documentary project about the everyday life of a small Ecuadorean village located on the border with Colombia. Colombians fleeing violence from fights between the FARC guerrilla and the government crossed the border to Ecuador and founded this village in 2001.

This region has been affected by tabloid reporters that only come here when they run out of news to fill their papers. I thought that Puerto Nuevo deserves a more dignified place than a hidden page in a sensationalist media, and a book, usually considered a valuable object, is more appropriate to tell their story.

This year I presented the book project to the City Museums Foundation of Quito and won the National Arts Prize Nuevo Mariano Aguilera, which will give me the funds to print it. Other important partners include the Brazilian publishing house Editora Madalena and the Iberoamerican States Organization for Education, Science and Culture. I appreciate their support, however, there is a small deficit to cover design and distribution costs which are the reasons for this crowdfunding campaign. I am sure that with your support, this project will generate awareness about a very important issue but which is rarely discussed.

What we need and what you get

All the funds gathered with your support will go towards financing the design and distribution costs of the book. The funds to print the book are secured, that means that even if the goal is not achieved, the book will still be printed. (It may take a bit longer to distribute though).

The book launch in Ecuador will take place at the Contemporary Arts Centre in Quito and it is estimated to be in February 2016. What I am offering you is the chance to get it way before that, together with other valuable rewards, such as the original signed and numbered book dummies, of which I printed 30 copies and there are only 8 left or the WAKA photography journal together with the book at a really low price. This campaign is more or less a presale of the book.

The impact

I believe this is an under reported subject and it is important for Latin America and the world to know it. Your contribution will allow the book to be distributed faster and to a broader audience.

Risks and challenges

There are virtually no risks. The production costs are 80% covered. If I don't reach the goal I will invest my own money (which I don't really have) to pay for the design, and then, will distribute the book little by little. This may take longer, but the book will still be out.

Other ways you can help

I know these are complicated times for photography and the arts in general. I know it because I have seen loads of crowdfunding campaigns, which I would have loved to contribute to, but didn't have the funds to do it. This is why if you were short of money, I would appreciate it if you could spread the word to your friends and family and share it with your social network (Facebook, Twitter, etc).


PS

The cost of the book is equivalent to a pint and a burger in any pub of London or to the cost of a dinner for one person in Quito. But take into account that this book will stay with you much longer than that food. :)

story:
The strongest of us suffer in silence…this is most true when it comes to our courageous veterans.  Trained and expected to always be perfectly strong – an utter impossibility - it is no surprise that many of our service men and women end up perfectly broken.  They who have risked all for our peace of mind need our help to heal.

 

PERFECTLY BROKEN – a photojournalistic narrative - aims to do just that by shining a visual light upon that which has been hidden for far too long – veterans who suffer in silence.  Together we can let them know that they are NOT alone. Now we can help them break their silence – and garner wider awareness of the suffering – by bringing their stories to the world.  PERFECTLY BROKEN is a photojournalistic series that tells the stories of US veterans silently suffering PTSD, MST, and those driven to suicide.

 

We all know that serving in the military is tough…that going into combat is terrifying…that living with the terror of having to kill or be killed is beyond comprehension for most.  But what many do not realize is the range and depth of the horrors and the ongoing impact of such service to mankind.  That the percentage of veterans suffering PTSD is, on average, 10%+ higher than the national average rate…that less than 50% seek/receive treatment…that those who seek treatment only have a 50/50 chance of receiving “adequate” help…that MST (Military Sexual Trauma) even exists…and that the traumas continue to be evident and life affecting even 25 years after service.  So now it’s time to help our society see the truth of how tough it really is…that’s what PERFECTLY BROKEN was created to do.

PTSD, or Post traumatic Stress Disorder, is a psychiatric disorder that can occur following the experience or witnessing of a life-threatening events such as military combat, natural disasters, terrorist incidents, serious accidents, or physical or sexual assault in adult or childhood. The VA estimates that PTSD afflicts, on average, 17% of military personnel.  Military sexual trauma, or MST, is the term used by VA to refer to experiences of sexual assault or repeated/threatening sexual harassment experienced during military service.  In 2014 alone over 20,000 members of the military were sexually assaulted. And, according to the 2012 VA's Suicide Data Report we lose 8,000 per year to suicide…that is 22 per day.

 

PERFECTLY BROKEN is all about authentic truth and the courage of these astoundingly strong men and women who have agreed to shared their stories, their sacred truths, and their pain with the world. These are things not easily shared, as they carry a lot of shame and stigma… painful experiences that have effected every aspect their lives and their loved ones.  But they are brave and will allow PERFECTLY BROKEN to capture their purest pain…visit them where they live…see them at their most vulnerable…and share their secrets with the world.  

Across the country veterans have recognized the value and import of PERFECTLY BROKEN, have volunteered to share in the hopes of bringing healing to themselves, their loved ones and those whom their service has protected – YOU. We hope for the opportunity to meet and immortalize each and every one of them.  

It is huge undertaking that we are prepared to commit to for as long as it takes.  PERFECTLY BROKEN will connect the world with ten veterans at a time for as long as the funding lasts.  Each series of ten will highlight a wide and intersectional range of veterans.

The 10 stories told in the first PERFECTLY BROKEN series: include members from each branch of the military; encompass veterans ranging in age from 25 to 60; cross ethnic and cultural lines multiple; and is evenly divided between women and men from a range of positions and postings.  

To journey to each of the veterans that have volunteered, visually document their narratives, and artistically produce their part of the series costs $1000 per veteran.  All donations will be utilized solely for travel, production, promotion, additional equipment and supplies for the first series. Wherever possible costs will be minimized through sensible logistic management and any additional funds will be utilized for the next series.

Ian Frank, creator of and photojournalistic artist for PERFECTLY BROKEN, has over  two decade of commercial photographic and filmmaking experience.  Nearly a decade ago he left the commercial photography world to utilize his art and abilities in service to others.  But service is nothing new for Ian, he too is a Disabled United States Marine Corps Veteran with PTSD, and knows what it's like to suffer in silence until attempting suicide. So, as you can imagine, this project is not only artistically important to him but deeply personal as well. He’s knows there are others out there like them, suffering from similar or worse situations. Ian was inspired to create PERFECTLY BROKEN to help ease their pain and shed light on their need for healing.

While we cannot all offer the courage, commitment, and care of country that Ian and his sisters and brothers in arms have; we CAN help bring this project to full fruition.  So give what you can, share this campaign wherever you wish, and let’s show the world and our veterans that they need suffer alone no more. We, and our perfectly human veterans, thank you.

story:
about YASHICA

YASHICA, Japanese Camera Brand since 1949. For the 70th anniversary of YASHICA, our team has embarked upon another comeback of the timeless classic, film cameras with our novel project, YASHICA Absolute.

Project "YASHICA Absolute"

Our project “YASHICA Absolute” of 2019 will be launched in 3 episodes - [Premiere] [Novella] and [Prestige].

[Premiere]  The forgotten journey of a timeless art

Photography is more than just a hobby, an activity but a capture of a moment, a tool for storytelling.

Today, the art of film photography is being forgotten as technology progresses and digital cameras popularised. The convenience of modern photography is in a sense promoting an indulgence of instant gratification.

MF-1 is our reminder to people of the fun and the lessons taught to us by film photography. It is an art of precision, patience, and mystery that requires meticulousness, experimentation, and bravery.

MF-1 is a simple Snapshot Art Camera, suitable for novice photographers transitioning from the world of digital to that of film photography. For a great film photo, it requires a quality film and camera (a decent photographer as well).

Films and cameras are the yin and yang of film photography. Therefore, we are also bringing forward, "YASHICA 400" and "YASHICA Black & White", the new YASHICA 35mm camera negative film as a complement to the MF-1. 

You will not want to miss the limited edition of "YASHICA Golden 80s" in part of this debut and exclusively made for the 70th anniversary.

 

[Novella]  Another step for Film Camera (Around August 2019)

In this episode, the Compact Automatic Camera - MF-2 will be reissued.

 

[Prestige] - Milestone of TLR-35mm (Around December 2019)

Finally, our masterpiece of YASHICA-44 TLR will be rebuilt and the brand-new YASHICA 44 will be compatible with 35mm.

[Premiere]  The forgotten journey of a timeless art

Photography is more than just a hobby, an activity but a capture of a moment, a tool for storytelling.

The art of film photography is being forgotten as technology progresses and digital cameras popularised. The convenience of modern photography is in a sense promoting an indulgence of instant gratification.

The New YASHICA Snapshot Art Camera - MF1

Color choices

Photo sample

Photographer: Akina Mikami • Camera: MF-1 • Film: YASHICA 400 • Location Bangkok

 

The New YASHICA Film

Photo samples of YASHICA 400 Film

Photo samples of YASHICA Black & White Film

Photo samples of YASHICA Golden 80s Film

 

Special Thanks

Akina Mikami, Alex Barber, Andrea Domenic Giuliano, Caleb Allen, Chardchakaj Waikawee, Christopher Katz, Dan Eady, Eric Peralta, Kerry Jeffrey, Renko Recke, Sergio Del Amo.

For testing the film and provide suggestions for our project.

Risks and challenges

We are proud to create and launch the YASHICA film and snapshot camera. Today, we are working very hard to bring the project to life and we are aware of the risks involved in such projects. We are dedicated to delivering a flawless camera that fulfils your expectations. Our commitment to excellence means that the first shipment is set to go in July 2019. Although we work closely with our manufacturers to ensure everything runs smoothly, there are possibilities of unexpected delays in production or delivery. We promise to keep you informed every step of the way. We are fully ready to expand our camera collection from digital to analog and we are excited to share this experience with you on Kickstarter.

We promise to keep you informed every step of the way. We are fully ready to expand our camera collection from digital to analog and we are excited to share this experience with you on Kickstarter.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Hannah Mentz and I’m an award-winning photographer who grew up in Zimbabwe. I’m running this campaign to help fund the printing costs of a self-published book about the personal project I’ve been working on for the past two years called Great Zimbabweans. Every supporter who chooses the buy a book option will receive a copy of the limited-edition coffee-table book of the  Great Zimbabweans project.

The Great Zimbabweans project is a positive and inspiring portrayal (portraits and interviews) of 40 Great Zimbabweans - one for every year of Zimbabwe's 40 years of Independence in 2020. I wanted to create this project to be an antidote to the largely negative depressing narrative about Zimbabwe that one sees in the media. Zimbabweans need something to uplift them and hoping that this project may be able to throw a positive light on all Zimbabwean people, their achievements and many talents.

This campaign will help me achieve my dream of publishing the Great Zimbabweans project as a book which means a lot to me on many levels- it would be my first-ever published book but on top of that, because the project is about Zimbabwean people, I would love to be able to share this body of work with as many people as possible. I believe the collective voices of my participants are very powerful and may offer different ways of looking at the country, looking at a different future and celebrating Zimbabwean identity. 

My goal is to achieve between 200-500 pre-orders of the book (EUR5,000-7,500) by the end of December 2020 which will allow me to take the book to print mid January 2021, estimated to ship in April 2021. As a thank to my supporters, there will be a 7x5 gift print from the project with every copy of the book ordered. There won't be any risks to the campaign. If my minimum is not met, I will still be able to go ahead and fulfill the pledges, but on a smaller scale and with digital printing of the book rather than litho printing. 

I understand if you just can't contribute, but you can still help me by getting the word out about the Great Zimbabweans project and following it on Instagram on @greatzimbabweans2020 

Please contact me on mail@hannahmentz.com if you are having any difficulty with the ordering or if there's an option you would like that I haven't included.

story:
A Healing Journey and Creative Endeavor: Europe 2015

Support the creation of my photography book "Baby Backpacker: Europe through the eyes of a boy" and my ebook with tips, itineraries, and hacks for parents that want to backpack through Europe but are hesitant because they are not the traditional solo/child-free traveler. 

My Project: 

Hi! I'm Teresa Getten single mom, photographer, and soon to be world traveler. This project is close to my heart. I'm combining three of my passions: my child, my photography, and my new passion for travel, to make a unique travel photography book. Given the chance, I'll be visiting world famous sights, taking the traditional inspirational photos but with a baby backpacker instead of the typical young adult backpacker. I will also be capturing images from his point of view. We will get to explore the world through his eyes- what does a 3-year-old find fascinating half-way around the world? These images will have a playful documentary feel, inspired by child wonder and innocence (and perhaps even a bit of mischief;) 

My Start in Photography:

My interest in photography began about 16 years ago when my daughter was born. I documented every moment of her first year, spending more money on disposable cameras than diapers. Eventually it made more sense to fork out the big bucks, purchase an slr and take a class to learn how to use it. Seduced  by the darkroom, I changed my major, worked for the school paper and earned a journalism degree on a documentary photography scholarship. After graduation I became a professional portrait/wedding photographer and toned photos for the newspaper.

My World Collapses:

May 2014: The ground, sky, logic, and my brother was taken from me. In its place I received a tidal wave of grief, regret, confusion, heartbreak, panic, and despair followed by another... and another (that's how grief works, just when you think you've reached a space of peace, another wave crashes into you.)

In a support group I learned the equation to his dire solution: his pain surpassed > his coping mechanisms= suicide. What could I have done differently and how do I cope with such loss?  I spent many manic nights reading self help books and religious texts. Frantically coming to terms... realizing that the meaning of life didn't mean as much when you had nothing to live for.

"We all have two lives. The second one begins when you realize you only have one." -Confucius

What I learned:

That thing that tugs at your heart... pleading for you to act, go, do, be or create... that is your guide to feeling alive, for being alive. Don't label it as selfish, that is your bliss worth living for.

Medical attention and counseling are important, but not the holistic cure. We have to play a part in our own forward motion. We can't just stall ourselves from going down the dark path towards that ugly painful end. We need to actively seek another path.

I want to help people affected by grief and depression, but I know before I can help anyone, I need to focus on myself.  I need to live my life, follow my own heart, fulfill my own dreams.

My Dream: World Travel

This trip is a healing journey as well as a creative endeavor.

I'm excited to share with you a unique perspective, travel exploration through the eyes of a child.

Meet Lucas: 3-year old boy, loves cats and puppies. His favorite mode of transportation is piggy-back. 

I will also be documenting our trip on my blog so if you love travel, join us- we could use some cheerleaders! www.bohotravelmama.com

Donation Perks:

$25 ~ E-Book ~ You will receive Baby Backpacker E-Book, a compilation of photos and writings from my trip.

$100 ~E-book, and you will receive ONE medium to large size print.

$200 ~ Photography Book ~ You will receive Baby Backpacker Book, a compilation of photos and writings from my trip and an E-book.

$350 ~ Photography Book and You will receive an E-book and TWO medium to large size prints. 

$450 ~ Photography Book and FOUR medium to large size prints.

$500 ~ Lifestyle Photo Session ~ Individuals, families, children, couples, friends, pets ~ up to 2 hours in Los Angeles, Salt Lake City, or Las Vegas area. (I am available to travel to your area – travel expenses additional.)

$800 ~ Event Photo Session ~ Parties, gatherings, celebrations, reunions, fundraisers, special events ~ up to 5 hours in Los Angeles, Salt Lake City, or Las Vegas area. (I may be available to travel to your area – travel expenses additional.)

$1,500 ~ Destination Photo Session ~ The opportunity to meet us in Europe for a photo session-(must pay for your own travel expenses.) Featured on my blog and part of our story.


Projections:

Total Transportation: 2600

Accom. Hostels/airbnb 50x60: 2500
Food: Grocery/Eating Out: 1200
Entertainment: 200
Emergency misc: 1500
Book/Print est. costs: 1500

If I don't reach my minimum goal I can still fulfill my perks (photo sessions/ebook/photobook... but I may have to change my destination and/or shorten my trip.) Any additional funding over goal amount will go towards my time and work editing photos/writing/blogging/planning/additional camera equipment and or additional destinations/trip length, and a more epic adventure for us all. Thank you so much!
Peace, Love and Light,
Teresa
Good Karma:
If you believe in my project but cannot donate right now, you can still contribute! Share this campaign with family, friends, your rich step-uncle, your neighbors, et. and post on your Facebook page and/or other social media.
story_txt: A Healing Journey and Creative Endeavor: Europe 2015Support the creation of my photography book "Baby Backpacker: Europe through the eyes of a boy" and my ebook with tips, itineraries, and hacks for parents that want to backpack through Europe but are hesitant because they are not the traditional solo/child-free traveler. My Project: Hi! I'm Teresa Getten single mom, photographer, and soon to be world traveler. This project is close to my heart. I'm combining three of my passions: my child, my photography, and my new passion for travel, to make a unique travel photography book. Given the chance, I'll be visiting world famous sights, taking the traditional inspirational photos but with a baby backpacker instead of the typical young adult backpacker. I will also be capturing images from his point of view. We will get to explore the world through his eyes- what does a 3-year-old find fascinating half-way around the world? These images will have a playful documentary feel, inspired by child wonder and innocence (and perhaps even a bit of mischief;) My Start in Photography:My interest in photography began about 16 years ago when my daughter was born. I documented every moment of her first year, spending more money on disposable cameras than diapers. Eventually it made more sense to fork out the big bucks, purchase an slr and take a class to learn how to use it. Seduced  by the darkroom, I changed my major, worked for the school paper and earned a journalism degree on a documentary photography scholarship. After graduation I became a professional portrait/wedding photographer and toned photos for the newspaper.My World Collapses:May 2014: The ground, sky, logic, and my brother was taken from me. In its place I received a tidal wave of grief, regret, confusion, heartbreak, panic, and despair followed by another... and another (that's how grief works, just when you think you've reached a space of peace, another wave crashes into you.)In a support group I learned the equation to his dire solution: his pain surpassed > his coping mechanisms= suicide. What could I have done differently and how do I cope with such loss?  I spent many manic nights reading self help books and religious texts. Frantically coming to terms... realizing that the meaning of life didn't mean as much when you had nothing to live for."We all have two lives. The second one begins when you realize you only have one." -ConfuciusWhat I learned:That thing that tugs at your heart... pleading for you to act, go, do, be or create... that is your guide to feeling alive, for being alive. Don't label it as selfish, that is your bliss worth living for.Medical attention and counseling are important, but not the holistic cure. We have to play a part in our own forward motion. We can't just stall ourselves from going down the dark path towards that ugly painful end. We need to actively seek another path.I want to help people affected by grief and depression, but I know before I can help anyone, I need to focus on myself.  I need to live my life, follow my own heart, fulfill my own dreams.My Dream: World TravelThis trip is a healing journey as well as a creative endeavor.I'm excited to share with you a unique perspective, travel exploration through the eyes of a child.Meet Lucas: 3-year old boy, loves cats and puppies. His favorite mode of transportation is piggy-back. I will also be documenting our trip on my blog so if you love travel, join us- we could use some cheerleaders! www.bohotravelmama.comDonation Perks:$25 ~ E-Book ~ You will receive Baby Backpacker E-Book, a compilation of photos and writings from my trip.$100 ~E-book, and you will receive ONE medium to large size print.$200 ~ Photography Book ~ You will receive Baby Backpacker Book, a compilation of photos and writings from my trip and an E-book.$350 ~ Photography Book and You will receive an E-book and TWO medium to large size prints. $450 ~ Photography Book and FOUR medium to large size prints.$500 ~ Lifestyle Photo Session ~ Individuals, families, children, couples, friends, pets ~ up to 2 hours in Los Angeles, Salt Lake City, or Las Vegas area. (I am available to travel to your area – travel expenses additional.)$800 ~ Event Photo Session ~ Parties, gatherings, celebrations, reunions, fundraisers, special events ~ up to 5 hours in Los Angeles, Salt Lake City, or Las Vegas area. (I may be available to travel to your area – travel expenses additional.)$1,500 ~ Destination Photo Session ~ The opportunity to meet us in Europe for a photo session-(must pay for your own travel expenses.) Featured on my blog and part of our story.Projections:Total Transportation: 2600Accom. Hostels/airbnb 50x60: 2500Food: Grocery/Eating Out: 1200Entertainment: 200Emergency misc: 1500Book/Print est. costs: 1500If I don't reach my minimum goal I can still fulfill my perks (photo sessions/ebook/photobook... but I may have to change my destination and/or shorten my trip.) Any additional funding over goal amount will go towards my time and work editing photos/writing/blogging/planning/additional camera equipment and or additional destinations/trip length, and a more epic adventure for us all. story:
We would like to do a photographic documentation of the affected world heritage sites of Kathmandu valley, which includes Kathmandu, Bhaktapur and Patan. We would develop a mobile exhibition of prints (Archival paper) with description of the sites and handover a copy of it to an authentic institution for future reference and awareness. The funding is needed for travel and printing process and as a token support for the photographers.You can contribute as little as USD 10. 

All proceeds from the exhibition will go towards supporting five disaster affected photographers.
