story:
The Ovahimba Years
Les années Ovahimba

Rina Sherman

A book of photographs - Un livre de photographies


Help me safeguarding of Ovahimba Cultural Heritage

Aidez-moi à la sauvegarde du patrimoine culturel Ovahimba


    

Rina Sherman
I am a filmmaker ethnographer. For seven years, I lived with an Omuhimba community in Namibia and Angola, filming and photographing their every day and ritual lives.


Rina Sherman
Je suis cinéaste ethnographe. Pendant sept ans, j'ai vécu avec une communauté Omuhimba à la frontière de la Namibie et de l'Angola. J'ai, durant cette période, filmé et photographié leurs rituels et leur vie quotidienne.


-> Images of Rina Sherman with the Ovahimba in the Gallery

-> Images de Rina Sherman avec les Ovahimba dans la Gallery



A Multimedia Exhibition 

at the French National Library in Paris


In 2014, I donated my multimedia Ovahimba archive to the French National Library - François Mitterrand, who will hold a multimedia exhibition in Paris in the fall 2015 to mark the occasion.

Les années Ovahimba / Rina Sherman

Exposition

Du 29 septembre 2015 au 15 novembre 2015 
Bibliothèque nationale Française - François-Mitterrand
Galerie des donateurs



Une exposition multimédia
à la Bibliothèque nationale Française


La Bibliothèque nationale Française salue le don de mes fonds audiovisuels par une exposition multimédia sur le site François Mitterrand à Paris à l'automne 2015.



On this occasion,

I want to publish a book of photographs:


The Ovahimba Years

Les années Ovahimba

Rina Sherman

A photographic witness of my seven years

of life and work with the Ovahimba




A cette occasion,
je tiens à publier un livre de photographies :

Les années Ovahimba

The Ovahimba Years

Rina Sherman

Un témoignage photographique de mes sept années
de vie et de travail avec les Ovahimba





This book will mark a milestone event:


In fact, it will mark the safeguarding of this totally unique multimedia collection by the French National Library and an exhibition that will showcase the highlights of the collection; the result of many years of work that I started as early as 1996.





Ce livre marquera une étape décisive :


En effet, il marquera la sauvegarde de cette collection multimédia totalement unique par la Bibliothèque nationale Française et une exposition qui mettra en valeur les temps forts de la collection; le résultat de nombreuses années de travail que j'ai commencé dès 1996.





Participate in the publication of this book

It has always been a dream for me to share my images of Ovahimba culture with the public at large. During my seven years of life and work with the Ovahimba, I nurtured the idea of publishing a book featuring the most salient moments of our life together.



Participez à la publication de ce beau livre

J'ai toujours rêvé de partager mes images de la culture Ovahimba avec le grand public. Au cours de mes sept années avec les Ovahimba, je pensais déjà à l'idée de publier un livre qui mettrait en avant les temps forts de notre vie commune.



K Press

Publishing a quality photographic book is an expensive and risky step in the process of making my work available to the public. Our research shows it will cost, promotion included, 15000€ / 16,800US$ to produce a print run of 2000 quality photographic books, a minimum to make the time and effort invested worthwhile in the mid to long term.

K éditeur
La publication d'un beau livre de photographie est une étape coûteuse et risquée dans le processus de partage de mon travail avec le public. Ma recherche indique que le coût de production, promotion incluse, s'élèvera à 15000 € / 16,800 US$ pour produire un tirage de 2000 livres, ce qui représente un minimum pour que le temps et les efforts investis soient fructueux dans le moyen et long terme.


The Book

96 pages, hard cover
Finished Format: 270x230 mm Italian
Printing quadri R/V
On Munken Print White ou Gardapat Klassica Paper
75 Photographs in Color and Black and White
Preface
Introductory Text
Author's resume

Le livre

96 pages, reluire cartonné
Format fini : 270x230 à l'italienne
Impression quadri R/V
Papier Munken Print White ou Gardapat Klassika
75 photographies en couleurs et noir et blanc
Préface
Texte d'introduction
Résumé de l'auteure





Your participation in this book can make it possible

The funding will go toward:

  • Design and Layout - 1,656 US$ / 1500 €
  • Prepress - 1,656 US$ / 1500 €
  • Printing and Binding - 12,289 US$ / 11 000 €
  • Promotion - 1,104 US$ / 1000 €

The promotion of the book (Web, print, bookstores, librairies, signatures, networking...) is extremely important to make it accessible to a large public.


Votre participation dans ce livre qui me tient à cœur peut le faire exister

Le financement sera utilisé pour :

  •  conception et mise en page - 1000€ / 1,104 US$
  •  prépresse - 1500€ - / 1,656 US$
  •  impression et reliure - 11500€ / 12,695 US$
  •  promotion - 1000€ / 1,104 US$

La promotion du livre (Web, impression, librairies, bibliothèques, signatures, réseaux...) est extrêmement important pour le rendre accessible à un large public.





What We Offer : The Perks

A Large Choice of Signed and Numbered Prints to Thank You for Your Participation

As a token of appreciation for your participation, we offer a choice of signed and numbered archival inkjet prints of various sizes, ranging from large A2 to smaller A4 paper formats and a word of thanks on this page, in the book and on our Web and Social Network pages.


Ce que nous offrons : Les contreparties

Un large choix de tirages signés et numérotés pour vous remercier de votre participation

En signe de gratitude pour votre participation, nous offrons un choix de tirages d'archives en jet d'encre en différentes tailles, allant du grand format A2 au plus petit format A4 de papier et un mot de remerciement sur cette page, dans le livre et sur les pages Web de notre site et de nos réseaux sociaux.

The prints can be chosen from three online galleries of the project The Ovahimba Years

Les tirages peuvent être choisis parmi trois galeries en ligne du projet Les années Ovahimba


Ovahimba Gaze: A Given Time / Regard Ovahimba : Un temps donné

Ovahimba Portraits / Portraits Ovahimba

Ma vie avec les Ovahimba / My Life with the Ovahimba




You cannot contribute to the project?

Please spread the word about this campaign to your friends and colleagues through  email, your social networks, telephones... Please use the IndieGoGo share tools!

Vous n'avez pas la possibilité de participer au projet ?

S'il vous plaît faîtes passer le message de cette campagne à vos amis et collègues par e-mail et dans votre réseau social. S'il vous plaît, utilisez les outils de partage de IndieGoGo !




What happens if...
Should the project not draw sufficient funds to publish the quality photo book, you still get your prints, and what funds are raised will be used to cover some of the publication costs of a text only print on demand book and an eBook.

Ce qui se passerait si...

Si le projet n'attire pas suffisamment de fonds pour la publication du livre photo, vous continuez de recevoir vos tirages, et les fonds recueillis seront utilisés pour couvrir en partie les frais de publication d'un livre imprimé sur demande et ceux d'un livre électronique.




The Contribution of The Ovahimba Years project to World Culture

The Ovahimba Years project, since its inception in 1996, has made a significant and unique contribution toward the preservation and conservation of the intangible cultural heritage of the Ovahimba and other Otjiherero speaking communities. The lifestyle and culture of the Ovahimba are fast changing and it is hence very important for the preservation of world culture to create a living trace of their intangible cultural heritage.

The publication of the book of photographs, The Ovahimba Years – Les Années Ovahimba / Rina Sherman, will help to accomplish this long and vast task, as it will make this heritage available to a large public.


La contribution du projet Les années Ovahimba à la culture mondiale

Depuis sa création en 1996, le projet Les années Ovahimba a contribué de manière  unique à la préservation du patrimoine culturel des Ovahimba et des communautés de langue Otjiherero. Cette culture tend à disparaître, et c'est pourquoi il est très important de créer une trace vivante de leur patrimoine culturel immatériel.

La publication du livre de photographies, Les années Ovahimba - The Ovahimba Years / Rina Sherman, peut aider à l'accomplissment de cette longue et vaste tâche, car il ouvre ce patrimoine au plus grand nombre.





Track Record
Rina Sherman has developed and managed all aspects of the project The Ovahimba Years since 1996: fund raising, administration & management, extensive multimedia fieldwork, training of assistants, building of a community centre now used as a school, and numerous other development projects, publishing films, books, articles, Web sites, etc. She has received sustained support from among others, the French Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the French Ministry of Culture, the French National Centre for Cinema and the Moving Image, The Ford Foundation, and The British High Commission in Namibia, Caltex - Namibia, Gamsberg Macmillan Publishers, Standard Bank and many others. Today her work features in the collections of numerous major university and research libraries, museums and various institutions worldwide. The introduction of her archive in the collections of the French National Library is one further step toward ensuring the perennial conservation of the intangible cultural heritage of the Ovahimba.


Parcours
Rina Sherman porte le projet Les années Ovahimba depuis 1996 : recherche de financement, administration et gestion, étude de terrain, formation des assistants, construction d'un centre communautaire actuellement utilisé comme une école, et de nombreux autres projets de développement, édition de films, livres, publication d’articles, sites Web, etc. Son projet a été soutenu par le Ministère des Affaires étrangères, le Ministère de la Culture, le Centre national du cinéma et de l'image animée, la Fondation Ford, la Haute Commission britannique en Namibie, Caltex - Namibie, Editions Gamsberg Macmillan, Standard Bank et bien d'autres. Aujourd'hui, ses travaux figurent dans les collections de nombreuses grandes bibliothèques universitaires et de recherche, les musées et diverses institutions de par le monde. Le don de ses archives à la Bibliothèque nationale française est une étape importante pour assurer la pérenité du patrimoine culturel immatériel des Ovahimba.

Photographs & Text © Rina Sherman
www.rinasherman.com

story:
My Story


My name is Beth Louise Ross. I attended the Nova Scotia College of Art and Design (NSCAD) in Halifax, Nova Scotia, Canada. I received my Bachelor of Fine Art (BFA) in mixed media in 2006. It was not a wise financial decision by any means. It was a decision based on where my passions and talents lie. As a mother of 3 boys, my ability to focus my attention and energy on my art-making became strongly interrupted by the lives of my children. I surrendered to the maternal experience completely and my husband became the single income earner in our home. Now, as my children are in school full-time, I am able to more fully turn to my art practice, particularly photography, although I have a slowly growing painting practice as well as a satisfying yoga practice.

My Work

I approach the subject matter in my photographs from a point of awe and profound emotional, even spiritual, experience. I am moved by the natural beauty of the world. I am also a very playful person who enjoys colour and visual manipulation, so the process of being outside, capturing the landscape through digital photography, and then returning home to edit is a natural practice for me. My intention is to sell high-resolution prints in various sizes to individuals and businesses, while at the same time, in my own way, expand on the Earth's need to have us humans singing her glorious praises.

My Challenge

I am currently using a digital SLR camera that is borrowed from a generous friend. The editing I have done has been accomplished on an iPad, which (as you may know) is great for some things, but ultimately insufficient in terms of being able to display the detail I need to see, the processing power to alter high-resolution images, as well as having the ability to prepare photos for print. I don't have the funds to buy myself what I need, and our household income does not allow for it. So it is to you that I turn to help continue my efforts toward building a successful career in photography.

My Need

I need a 27-inch iMac with sufficient processing and RAM speed to work on my photos. This costs $3200 after taxes. I also need Adobe Photoshop to manipulate photos and prepare them for print. Photoshop costs $800 after taxes. My rewards for contributors will cost between $500 and $750. Adding Indiegogo's 5% fee and payment processing fees brings my total to $5350.

Rewards

There are two tiers of rewards for contributors. For a $500 contribution, you get a 18" x 24", high-resolution, archival print of your choice. For a $250 contribution, you get an 9" x 12", high-resolution, archival print also of your choice. Please remember that part of these prices include the costs of printing by archival printers. For any other contributions, I will acknowledge your contribution on my developing website (with your permission) either as an anonymous person or company, or fully disclosed identity. It's your choice.
*Note about rewards: As I need to acquire the iMac to prepare photos for print, I need to reach my funding goal to fulfill that commitment. However, I've chosen "flexible funding" so that contributors have the option of paying by credit card, and not only through Paypal (which may be complicated for some people). This means I get the funds raised even if my goal isn't reached by the end of 60 days. Since I need to reach the goal to provide rewards, I have opted in to Indiegogo's InDemand option, which means that the campaign will stay live until we reach the goal. The only effect on contributors will be a delay in reward shipment.

Other Help

If you can't contribute monetarily, you can help by passing along the word and using social networking to expand the population base that can become aware of my campaign.

story:
Building a Photography Studio that is affordable and cost effective for the community.

Imagine your perfect photo shoot. Where is it shot? In an affordable studio that allows students, amateurs, and pro photographers a place to rent, full time, for those dream shoots?

Imagine white walls and hardwood floors… and not only is it fully furnished with the perfect amount of natural light while still allowing the option to use studio light. It gets better; it also has a full-sized changing room with not only mirrors, but a shower as well… the comfort aspect!

Imagine being equipped with multiple backdrops, a fire place, multiple A/C outlets and a separate room all together for portraits… what more could you want? What is possibly more perfect? Not a lot. This is why we need to make this happen.

Photography has been an excellent way for myself and many others to help spread the beauty we see daily in our community.  I want to assist others to achieve excellence in this field, which we can accomplish by simply having this perfect available studio to benefit our surrounding communities. It’s easy to reserve and use, with no obligations or contracts.

Although it is expensive leasing your own studio with all of the furnishings, Pittsburgh Photo Studio will allow you to have your ideal studio shoots without breaking the bank. I want you to be able to make the photoshoot that is in your head a reality. I want to do this without you feeling as though you can’t make it happen due to financial issues. I want to help your dream shoot happen, so all I need is you to help my dream business happen. Plus FREE PARKING! There is a parking lot on the premises.

I have worked with companies in Pittsburgh and worldwide such as Cirque Du Soleil, The National Opera de Paris, The Pittsburgh Penguins, Pittsburgh Steelers, The Pittsburgh Riverhounds, and the Pittsburgh Pirates. I worked with Pittsburgh Magazine, Hockey Night in Canada, Versus, City Theatre, The Pittsburgh Playhouse, The Hazlett Theater and more. 20 plus years I have been in the entertainment industry and I have found that home is where the heart is and that is Pittsburgh. This is why I want my dream business to be in the city that I love.

What We Need

  • $11,000 goes to the rental of the space and utilities for one year. As well as a fresh coat of white paint, and installation of a shower.
  • $2,000 will go towards chemicals and supplies for the darkroom, and an enlarger.
  • $2,000 will go towards marketing, PR, website, business cards. 

The Impact

  • Unlike most photography studios in the Pittsburgh area, Pittsburgh Photo Studio will be dedicated to full-time rental use by photographers & videographers in the area.  It’s easy to reserve and use, with no obligations or contracts.
  • We will offer a full range of corporate video production services for companies in the greater Pittsburgh region.  Video is a great way to highlight your company and a professionally produced product is a marketing tool unlike any other.
  • Social Media has made thousands of opportunities for advertising videos.  We can produce videos that your customers and employees will be proud to share with their family and friends on Facebook, Pinterest, and Twitter.

Challenges

One of the challenges is to offer workshops to the community from children to adults who want to learn photography. Workshops will be taught by local Professional Photographers, and big name famous Professional Photographers.

Big name Professional Photographers will also come into town and teach workshops and courses bi-monthly.

  • One of the Professional Photographers teaching workshops is Scott Church. 

    Scott Church is a world renowned, internationally published, award winning fine art portrait photographer. His work has been featured in dozens of media outlets and publications, including Men's Health, Playboy Magazine and Playboy.com, VH1, XXL Magazine, Latin Trends Magazine, The Science Channel's "Odd Folks Home", Maxim.com, and Fine Art PHOTO Magazine, along with many others.

    He has published eight books of his photography which have been sold all around the world.

    His photography workshops in places like London, Dublin, Dallas, Philadelphia, Washington DC, Seattle, the Dominican Republic and others have been sell-out events attracting dozens of professional and amateur photographers at every location.

Hey you, thanks for sitting around with me listening (or reading, I hope you read it...) to me talk about myself and this project.  Spreading the word via Facebook or the Indiegogo share tools would be amazing.  Spread the word, and let's remember Pittsburgh being the beautiful, and artistic place it is!

story:
As melanin women with locs we’ve chosen to go against the grain and create our own mark within the natural hair community. Locs have been around for many many years yet they are still not accepted within the eyes of many individuals. In a world where society's standards of beauty are used to judge our women of color, I want to showcase the many women who choose to wear their hair in its most natural form.

I am honored to invite you to join me in bringing a project to the masses that will crush the stigma associated with locs and showcase the beauty of Melanin Loc Queens.

50 Shades Of Locs is a photobook/documentary created to empower, encourage, educate and entertain those within the loc community and those who are curious about the queens who choose to loc their hair. This project will answer many of the Who, What, Where, When and Why’s of locs. Your help is needed to bring this project to the masses and create an avenue for women of color to be able to display their confidence with pride.

The natural hair community is being embraced by many individuals daily but yet we have very few artistic outlets that showcase the many beautiful Queens who chose to loc their crowns.

I feel this project Is needed to create a solid movement not just amongst Black women with locs but black women period.

In the world of visual art and documentary I'm using photos to capture the beauty of locs that adorn the many Queens that wear them proudly and who are leaving foot prints in the loc community.

This photobook/documentary project will help showcase locs and melanin in an artistic form that will be a keepsake for many generations to follow. These photos of beautiful loc queens will come from all over the world and these photos will exudes positive energy, spiritual growth, and beauty. These photos will also display the tangles of ones soul through photographic art.

The documentary will peep into the world of queens answering questions in regards to the history of locs, the different types of locs, life with locs, what does locs mean in different cultures, the stages of locs, locing methods, loc regimens, loc styles, and so so so much more. The documentary will also feature behind the scenes of photoshoots, bloopers, and nothing but positive energy across the board. This project is Loc beauty represented in many shades of brown, and will help empower, encourage, and educate loc queens around the world.

While we are on the subject of help, I am in need of your help to bring this project to reality. I would like each and everyone to become a part of this project. With a project as powerful as this one, help is needed. Money raised for this project will go towards the independent publishing, Typesetting, proof reading, Graphics, Photography, travel, Video editing, Printing, cover designs, packaging and everything that goes into creating a documentary and publishing a photobook. It will also help bring Black Girls Loc to your city to continue on the mission of this project, meet our beautiful loc queens and capture your beauty and essence.. There are many perks involved and gifts that will be given from our heart. Pure appreciation and gratitude to each loc queen around the globe.

story:
About me and the why of things

  • I have been covering nerdland and horror conventions and film festival for the last 17 years (with a bunch of sites like Cinema Crazed, Idle Hands, and Dread Central) and I finally am throwing myself headfirst into the world that is what I've studied for and worked for all this time: Photography, precisely portraits, but with a twist of course!
    I've been a horror fan for as long as I can remember, now's is the time to get serious about it.
  • This campaign is to help me fund the cost of costumes, props, and take care of my people who work with me on this.  I'm all for fun, but sometimes, fun costs money.
  • Here is where you come in, by participating in this campaign, you will help me pay for the cost of the photoshoots and printing the calendar.  

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the skinny:

  • $2000 is the starting goal, this will help pay for photoshoots I need to go from San Diego to LA for and for things like a Victorian dress for my nanny, a slasher costume for my victim, ...
  • The perks are simple: Calendars, photos, shoutouts, major love and thanks!
  • If I do not reach the entirety of the goal, the project will still get finished and you will still get your product.  I am also looking at sponsorships as with the first shoot (see that photo on here? Sponsored by Rotten Cotton for the tshirts, Primal Contact Lenses for the, well, contact lenses, and Horrible Imaginings Film Festival for the generator for those beautiful bright lights in the forest).

Here's how your participation helps: 

  • You will help me get my work out there, get a bit of a dream to come true.
  • For you, you get a great calendar that will fit perfectly with your horror collection!

Risks & Challenges

So, what do you risk by participating?  How do I make sure it works?

  • As opposed to many campaigns, this one is for a project that is already partially done, so there will not be any cancellation.  While I am asking for backing and for money upfront, I have good references, I will gladly provide them ;)

Other Ways You Can Help

So you've got no moolah?  Can't afford it just yet?  I get it, I've been there.  Here's how you can help in just a few seconds and without any actual spending:

  • Share the link to this campaign, invite people to follow @emybphoto on Instagram, Twitter and at www.facebook.com/emybphoto.
  • Share from Indie Go Go and help spread the word far and wide.

    Thank you!  Merci!  Gracias!  Danke!

story:
July 20, 2019 is the 50th anniversary of the historic Apollo 11 mission and humanity’s first steps on another world.  Apollospace proudly presents THE DEFINITIVE collection of FULLY RESTORED ULTRA-HIGH-RESOLUTION FLIGHT IMAGES, from the first Apollo flight of APOLLO 7 to the first steps on the Moon and safe return of APOLLO 11. This commemorative Apollo 50TH Anniversary Custom Saturn V USB features EVERY PHOTO taken by the astronauts from the FIRST FIVE APOLLO MISSIONS: Apollo 7, Apollo 8, Apollo 9, Apollo 10, and Apollo 11  - over 5000 images on a 64GB commemorative custom Saturn V USB.

From the first flight of Apollo 7, the first manned Apollo mission to fly.

The First Steps Saturn V USB contains 534 ultra-high resolution flight images from the historic Apollo 7 Mission – every photograph taken by the astronauts during this historic mission.  All images contained on this USB are jpeg files that measure 5000 x 5000 pixels at 300 dpi with the least compression and possible.

... to the bold venture to the moon of Apollo 8, the second manned Apollo mission and the first to venture to the moon.

The First Steps Saturn V USB contains 867 ultra-high resolution flight images from the historic Apollo 8 Mission – every photograph taken by the astronauts during this historic mission.  All images contained on this USB are jpeg files that measure 5000 x 5000 pixels at 300 dpi with the least compression and possible.

... to the first test of the lunar module during Apollo 9, the first full stack manned Saturn V Apollo mission and first to fly the Lunar Module.

The First Steps Saturn V USB contains 792 ultra-high resolution flight images from the historic Apollo 9 Mission – every photograph taken by the astronauts during this historic mission.  All images contained on this USB are are jpeg files that measure 5000 x 5000 pixels at 300 dpi with the least compression and possible.

... to the final dress rehearsal of Apollo 10, the second manned Apollo mission to orbit the Moon and the final “dress rehearsal” before the manned landing of Apollo 11.

The First Steps Saturn V USB contains 1437 ultra-high resolution flight images from the historic Apollo 10 Mission - every photograph taken by the astronauts during this historic mission.  All images contained on this USB are  jpeg files with the least compression possible.  Color photo magazines (27N, 34M, and 35U) measure 5000 x 5000 pixels at 300 dpi. Black & white photo magazines (28O, 29P, 30Q, 31R, 32S, and 33T) measure 4000 x 4000 pixels at 300 dpi.

... and finally the fulfillment of Kennedy’s challenge with Apollo 11, the first manned landing on the Moon.

The First Steps Saturn V USB contains 1409 ultra-high resolution flight images from the historic Apollo 11 Mission - every photograph taken by the astronauts during this historic mission.  All images contained on this USB are jpeg files with the least compression possible.  Color photo magazines (36N, 37R, 40S, and 44V) measure 5000 x 5000 pixels at 300 dpi. Black & white photo magazines (38O, 39Q, 41P, 42V, and 43T) measure 4000 x 4000 pixels at 300 dpi.

But this collection is more than the iconic images, it includes every photograph taken by the astronauts during these historic missions.

The over 5000 photographs in this definitive collection have each painstakingly been restored to the highest quality and resolution, painstakingly cleaned of dust, scanlines, scratches, hair and every other blemish (usually hundreds, and often thousands, of corrections per image!) down to the pixel level to create the highest quality highest resolution Apollo imagery ever made available.

Become a contributor today and get this amazing collection on a special commemorative custom Saturn five USB at 64 GB (60GB of actual data – that’s more than 12 DVDs) with over 5000 ultrahigh resolution photographs measuring up to 5000 pixels each. This collection is out of this world.

About the Saturn V USBs:

The commemorative 50th anniversary Saturn V custom shaped USBs measure approximately 4.75 inches high and .75 inches in diameter.

The blank version contains 16GB of memory space.

The First Steps version is a 64GB drive with over 59GB of data – more than contained on 12DVDs – filled with over 5000 ultra-high resolution uncompressed JPEG images measuring up to 5000 pixels at 300dpi.  Each image has been completely and fully restored from the most recent and highest resolution NASA/JSC scans.

The Apollospace Imaging Process

Most of the raw public domain Apollo images (including all color images) used in creating the images found in this collection were acquired from Arizona State University (ASU), pursuant to an Agreement with NASA’s Johnson Space Center (JSC) for scanning NASA’s collection of Mercury, Gemini, and Apollo imagery in the highest resolutions ever made available.  Raw black and white images not yet available through ASU were acquired from the National Archives and/or NASA/JSC images sources.

Each image was lovingly and painstakingly corrected and enhanced as follows:

The borders of each image were cropped off and the images were then corrected for tone, color, and contrast.

One of the chief challenges in the raw scanned images is the lack of contrast, which results in the images having a ghostly fog.  Among the observations of space by the astronauts themselves is how inky black space is.  Thus, during processing, one of the main aims is to achieve as black a sky as possible without losing image details.

Because the images were shot at various exposures and lighting conditions, there is a wide contrast variation in original scanned images.  For aesthetic and other reasons, the images have been processed to reveal as much detail as possible.  For example, images of the lunar surface from orbit with the sun directly overhead are overexposed and, lacking shadows, the surface lacks detail and appears flat.  Such images have been processed to bring out the most detail possible, which generally results in them appearing much darker in comparison to other images but allows for better detail in crater rays.

The images are then blown up to their maximum resolution and cleaned of scratches, blemishes, dust, hair, scanning lines and other defects. It is not uncommon for a single image to require hundreds of corrective actions to clean the image of blemishes, faults, and defects. The end result are the cleanest images available anywhere, even at maximum resolution, without the distracting blemishes found in raw images and most corrected images available elsewhere.  As seen in some of the samples below, it is common for images to require as many as several hundred corrective actions to achieve the enhanced images available at Apollospace!

The images are further corrected and enhanced to provide clarity and consistency.   Levels and colors are balanced to make viewing the images, individually and as part of a slide show, as seamless and pleasing as possible.

Here you can see numerous flaws in a tiny section from image AS09-20-3156:

and after correction:

Below is the raw scanned image .  

Here is a detail from image AS09-22-3473, after color correction but prior to removal of blemishes:

Here is the same area after the blemishes have been removed:

Literally hundreds, even thousands, of corrections were made on some images, such as seen in this section of AS10-35-5205:

Prior to restoration, zooming in on the top rocket thruster revealed dozens of white spots:

Below is the detailed final product after these blemishes have been removed.

And images that look like AS08-13-2299:

In short, literally hundreds of thousands of blemishes were removed from the over 5000 photos in this collection.

The Apollospace image process page details the technical work of bringing these photographs to life.  But more than an historical record of one of the greatest accomplishments in human history, these images are art.   Each Apollo era photograph appearing on this site was taken by a human hand and with a human eye.  50 years later, each one has been restored, corrected, and enhanced with a human eye as well, to be as visually pleasing as they are historically and naturally accurate.

Apollo Reflections

If a picture is indeed worth a thousand words, then the story of Apollo, told through the nearly 20,000 photographs taken during the eleven manned Apollo missions between 1968 and 1972, would literally take tens of millions of words to tell.

The Apollo Program was, undoubtedly, one of the greatest accomplishments in human history.  Human beings, for the first time, left the Earth and gazed back at our beautiful planet, the source of all we have ever known, learning more not only about the wider universe, but also about ourselves and our own world. 

Astronaut Fred Haise has called the image collection “incredible” and "amazing."

Others have commented: “they are without a doubt the highest quality image archive I have seen, and you need to be congratulated on the work and effort you have gone to!”

“Amazing quality images … I hope more people see the work you are doing it is truly amazing! It's a gold mine for those who know it!

This is THE DEFINITIVE collection of completely restored, ultra-high resolution photographs from the Apollo 7 through Apollo 11 missions – every photograph taken by the astronauts on these historic missions to land men on the moon and return them safely to Earth.  You cannot find these incredible photographs at this quality and resolution on-line or anywhere else.  In short, this is the best collection of these images available anywhere.

Campaign Goals

The mold and prototype of the “First Steps” Saturn V USB have been produced. This campaign has a goal of $10,000 to manufacture, package, and promote this incredible Apollo Photography archive, while gauging interest into how many we will look to produce for release in July, 2019 on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of Apollo 11.

Contributor Perks

We are offering some great, and incredibly unique, discounted perks for contributors to this campaign, including: “First Steps” The Definitive Apollo Flight Photographic Archive newly restored from the highest resolution NASA scans – This commemorative Apollo 50TH Anniversary Saturn V USB features ALL of the mission flight images taken by the astronauts from the FIRST FIVE APOLLO MISSIONS: Apollo 7, Apollo 8, Apollo 9, Apollo 10, and Apollo 11.  From the first flight, to the return of Apollo 11 to Earth – this collection records all the images taken by the astronauts on these historic missions to land men on the Moon and return them safely to Earth.  Additional Perks include a 16GB blank version of the Saturn V USB and even authentic hand-signed photographs of an Apollo astronaut! And get these perks at prices 20-30% off.

My Background

My company, Apollospace, LLC holds tens of thousands of raw public domain Apollo era digital mission images, representing the highest resolutions that have been scanned by NASA from the original film.  These raw images have been, and continue to be, restored, corrected, and enhanced for public distribution and enjoyment, as well as featuring them in our “Apollo Reflections” film series.

Please help us bring these photos to life as described by Apollo Astronaut Fred Haise, and others, by contributing to this campaign.  Please contribute to this project if you can and be part of, as well as help us preserve, the incredible history of Apollo and share this campaign with your friends.

Thank you,

Jeremy Theoret
story_txt:
July 20, 2019 is the 50th anniversary of the historic Apollo 11 mission and humanity’s first steps on another world.  Apollospace proudly presents THE DEFINITIVE collection of FULLY RESTORED ULTRA-HIGH-RESOLUTION FLIGHT IMAGES, from the first Apollo flight of APOLLO 7 to the first steps on the Moon and safe return of APOLLO 11. This commemorative Apollo 50TH Anniversary Custom Saturn V USB features EVERY PHOTO taken by the astronauts from the FIRST FIVE APOLLO MISSIONS: Apollo 7, Apollo 8, Apollo 9, Apollo 10, and Apollo 11  - over 5000 images on a 64GB commemorative custom Saturn V USB.
From the first flight of Apollo 7, the first manned Apollo mission to fly.
The First Steps Saturn V USB contains 534 ultra-high resolution flight images from the historic Apollo 7 Mission – every photograph taken by the astronauts during this historic mission.  All images contained on this USB are jpeg files that measure 5000 x 5000 pixels at 300 dpi with the least compression and possible.

... to the bold venture to the moon of Apollo 8, the second manned Apollo mission and the first to venture to the moon.
The First Steps Saturn V USB contains 867 ultra-high resolution flight images from the historic Apollo 8 Mission – every photograph taken by the astronauts during this historic mission.  All images contained on this USB are jpeg files that measure 5000 x 5000 pixels at 300 dpi with the least compression and possible.

... to the first test of the lunar module during Apollo 9, the first full stack manned Saturn V Apollo mission and first to fly the Lunar Module.
The First Steps Saturn V USB contains 792 ultra-high resolution flight images from the historic Apollo 9 Mission – every photograph taken by the astronauts during this historic mission.  All images contained on this USB are are jpeg files that measure 5000 x 5000 pixels at 300 dpi with the least compression and possible.

... to the final dress rehearsal of Apollo 10, the second manned Apollo mission to orbit the Moon and the final “dress rehearsal” before the manned landing of Apollo 11.
The First Steps Saturn V USB contains 1437 ultra-high resolution flight images from the historic Apollo 10 Mission - every photograph taken by the astronauts during this historic mission.  All images contained on this USB are  jpeg files with the least compression possible.  Color photo magazines (27N, 34M, and 35U) measure 5000 x 5000 pixels at 300 dpi. Black & white photo magazines (28O, 29P, 30Q, 31R, 32S, and 33T) measure 4000 x 4000 pixels at 300 dpi.

... and finally the fulfillment of Kennedy’s challenge with Apollo 11, the first manned landing on the Moon.
The First Steps Saturn V USB contains 1409 ultra-high resolution flight images from the historic Apollo 11 Mission - every photograph taken by the astronauts during this historic mission.  All images contained on this USB are jpeg files with the least compression possible.  Color photo magazines (36N, 37R, 40S, and 44V) measure 5000 x 5000 pixels at 300 dpi. Black & white photo magazines (38O, 39Q, 41P, 42V, and 43T) measure 4000 x 4000 pixels at 300 dpi.

But this collection is more than the iconic images, it includes every photograph taken by the astronauts during these historic missions.
The over 5000 photographs in this definitive collection have each painstakingly been restored to the highest quality and resolution, painstakingly cleaned of dust, scanlines, scratches, hair and every other blemish (usually hundreds, and often thousands, of corrections per image!) down to the pixel level to create the highest quality highest resolution Apollo imagery ever made available.
Become a contributor today and get this amazing collection on a special commemorative custom Saturn five USB at 64 GB (60GB of actual data – that’s more than 12 DVDs) with over 5000 ultrahigh resolution photographs measuring up to 5000 pixels each. This collection is out of this world.
About the Saturn V USBs:

The commemorative 50th anniversary Saturn V custom shaped USBs measure approximately 4.75 inches high and .75 inches in diameter.
The blank version contains 16GB of memory space.
The First Steps version is a 64GB drive with over 59GB of data – more than contained on 12DVDs – filled with over 5000 ultra-high resolution uncompressed JPEG images measuring up to 5000 pixels at 300dpi.  Each image has been completely and fully restored from the most recent and highest resolution NASA/JSC scans.
The Apollospace Imaging Process
Most of the raw public domain Apollo images (including all color images) used in creating the images found in this collection were acquired from Arizona State University (ASU), pursuant to an Agreement with NASA’s Johnson Space Center (JSC) for scanning NASA’s collection of Mercury, Gemini, and Apollo imagery in the highest resolutions ever made available.  Raw black and white images not yet available through ASU were acquired from the National Archives and/or NASA/JSC images sources.
Each image was lovingly and painstakingly corrected and enhanced as follows:
The borders of each image were cropped off and the images were then corrected for tone, color, and contrast.
One of the chief challenges in the raw scanned images is the lack of contrast, which results in the images having a ghostly fog.  Among the observations of space by the astronauts themselves is how inky black space is.  Thus, during processing, one of the main aims is to achieve as black a sky as possible without losing image details.
Because the images were shot at various exposures and lighting conditions, there is a wide contrast variation in original scanned images.  For aesthetic and other reasons, the images have been processed to reveal as much detail as possible.  For example, images of the lunar surface from orbit with the sun directly overhead are overexposed and, lacking shadows, the surface lacks detail and appears flat.  Such images have been processed to bring out the most detail possible, which generally results in them appearing much darker in comparison to other images but allows for better detail in crater rays.
The images are then blown up to their maximum resolution and cleaned of scratches, blemishes, dust, hair, scanning lines and other defects. It is not uncommon for a single image to require hundreds of corrective actions to clean the image of blemishes, faults, and defects. The end result are the cleanest images available anywhere, even at maximum resolution, without the distracting blemishes found in raw images and most corrected images available elsewhere.  As seen in some of the samples below, it is common for images to require as many as several hundred corrective actions to achieve the enhanced images available at Apollospace!
The images are further corrected and enhanced to provide clarity and consistency.   Levels and colors are balanced to make viewing the images, individually and as part of a slide show, as seamless and pleasing as possible.
Here you can see numerous flaws in a tiny section from image AS09-20-3156:

and after correction:

Below is the raw scanned image .  
Here is a detail from image AS09-22-3473, after color correction but prior to removal of blemishes:

Here is the same area after the blemishes have been removed:

Literally hundreds, even thousands, of corrections were made on some images, such as seen in this section of AS10-35-5205:

Prior to restoration, zooming in on the top rocket thruster revealed dozens of white spots:

Below is the detailed final product after these blemishes have been removed.

And images that look like AS08-13-2299:

In short, literally hundreds of thousands of blemishes were removed from the over 5000 photos in this collection.






The Apollospace image process page details the technical work of bringing these photographs to life.  But more than an historical record of one of the greatest accomplishments in human history, these images are art.   Each Apollo era photograph appearing on this site was taken by a human hand and with a human eye.  50 years later, each one has been restored, corrected, and enhanced with a human eye as well, to be as visually pleasing as they are historically and naturally accurate.
Apollo Reflections

The Apollo Program was, undoubtedly, one of the greatest accomplishments in human history.  Human beings, for the first time, left the Earth and gazed back at our beautiful planet, the source of all we have ever known, learning more not only about the wider universe, but also about ourselves and our own world. 
Astronaut Fred Haise has called the image collection “incredible” and "amazing."
Others have commented: “they are without a doubt the highest quality image archive I have seen, and you need to be congratulated on the work and effort you have gone to!”
“Amazing quality images … I hope more people see the work you are doing it is truly amazing! It's a gold mine for those who know it!
This is THE DEFINITIVE collection of completely restored, ultra-high resolution photographs from the Apollo 7 through Apollo 11 missions – every photograph taken by the astronauts on these historic missions to land men on the moon and return them safely to Earth.  You cannot find these incredible photographs at this quality and resolution on-line or anywhere else.  In short, this is the best collection of these images available anywhere.

story:
[для заказа открыток, фотографий или фотосплетений нажмите красную кнопку "BACK IT", подробнее - https://lukinskiy.livejournal.com/253873.html]

---

I offer unique author postcards (13 species), photographed and printed in the holy city of Varanasi (India). On a dense quality cardboard 18x12 cm, 2000 copies. A real Indian artifact for only $ 4 !!! A full set of 13 cards - $ 40 (3 pieces as a gift) !!!
Funds are collecting on the 7th project - about Kumbh Mela, the greatest Indian religious festival. Gratitude will be: postcards from Varanasi, photos from six projects, photoplexuses.

[english description of the campaign, see below]

---

Друзья!

Много лет я снимаю на черно-белую пленку, стремясь передать красоту и божественность естества, как сам их вижу. Съемка всегда была для меня мистическим процессом, частью необходимой мне духовной практики общения с пространством. Пленка этому весьма соответствует, не позволяя сразу видеть результат, но донося его до нас почти напрямую - через двойное прикосновение света. У пленки есть интересные творческие возможности - крупное зерно и различные эффекты, получаемые при съемке с помощью комбинаций мультиэкспозиции, зуммирования и шевеленки.

 

В моей фотографии никогда не было коммерческой составляющей, я не занимался продвижением и организовал только одну персональную выставку (в 2011). Тем не менее, материал постепенно накапливался, складывался в законченные проекты и требовал выхода к людям. Для наглядного представления проектов я выбрал расположение всех фотографий единым блоком, чтобы можно было составить общее представление. Но, расположенные рядом, фотографии иначе воспринимаются нашим мозгом, начиная "влиять" друг на друга. И надо прилагать множество усилий, чтобы они не превращались в бессмысленный визуальный хаос. Еще сложнее добиться, чтобы взаимодействие изображений в нашем сознании приводило к рождению новых ощущений и смыслов. Я изучал эти вопросы около двух лет и пришел к концепции фотосплетений - художественной формы, в которой отдельные изображения объединяются в единое высказывание за счет визуальных и смысловых связей.
Идеальное фотосплетение - это сгусток энергии, посылаемый вам мирозданием руками автора. Чтобы принять эту передачу, надо дать своему взгляду время прогуляться в сплетении изображений. Лучше всего на мониторе компьютера - на маленьком экране связи значительно ослабнут. Тогда фотографии, перекликаясь между собой, сами подскажут путь вашему вниманию. И, возможно, проявится общая драматургия работы.
На нынешний момент я завершил шесть сплетений, фотографии для которых снимались по несколько лет, а сами они заплетались по много месяцев.

Первое фотосплетение называется "Вглядываясь в иное". Фотографии были сняты с 2005 по 2011 годы в Санкт-Петербурге и ближайших окрестностях. Я полностью перестроил это сплетение совсем недавно, поэтому структурно оно самое сложное из шести. Посмотреть в высоком разрешении его можно на моем сайте - http://www.lukinskiy.com/ru/peering_into_the_ot...

 

Фотографии следующего проекта - "Притяжение границы" - сняты с 2004 по 2011 годы, преимущественно, на кладбищах Санкт-Петербурга. Специальные эффекты, которые есть на части фотографий, получены в момент съемки на пленку. В высоком разрешении на сайте -  http://www.lukinskiy.com/ru/attraction_of_the_b...

 

Фотографии сплетения "Равновесие пространства" сняты с 2005 по 2016 годы в Санкт-Петербурге и ближайших окрестностях. В высоком разрешении на сайте -  http://www.lukinskiy.com/ru/balance_of_space/

 

Фотографии, составившие сплетение "Медитация на Стиксе", снимались в брошенных и умирающих деревнях на востоке Новгородской области (400 км. от Петербурга) с 2009 по 2012 годы. В высоком разрешении на сайте -  http://www.lukinskiy.com/ru/meditation_on_the_s...

 

Там же снимался портретный проект "Чистые люди" (с 2005 по 2012 годы). В высоком разрешении на сайте -  http://www.lukinskiy.com/ru/pure_people/

 

Проект "Свет Kashi" снимался в Индии в священном городе Варанаси в 2014 году. В высоком разрешении на сайте -  http://www.lukinskiy.com/ru/light_of_Kashi/

 

По материалам этого проекта я сделал серию открыток "Свет Kashi" из 13 штук общим тиражом в 2000 экземпляров (на данный момент у меня осталась примерно половина). Чтобы придать открыткам ценность артефакта, я напечатал их там же, где снимал - в древнем Варанаси. И разместил на оборотной строне надпись "Printed in Varanasi 2017". Все открытки можно посмотреть на сайте - http://www.lukinskiy.com/ru/postcards/

 

Цели кампании и вознаграждения.

Новое, седьмое по счету, фотосплетение я собираюсь посвятить величайшему индийскому религиозному празднику - Кумбха Меле, который пройдет в городе Аллахабаде с середины января по начало марта 2019 года. Это грандиозное собрание миллионов паломников со всей Индии, на котором в полной мере проявляется торжество и сияние индийского йогического духа. В месте слияния священных рек Ганги и Ямуны строится гигантский палаточный город, и проводится одно из крупнейших собраний людей на Земле. В 2013 году за два месяца Кумбха Мелу посетило около 120 миллионов человек, как бы невероятно это ни звучало. Но, несмотря на непостижимую концентрацию людей, фестиваль наполнен удивительной, доброжелательной и мистической атмосферой, ведь сюда приезжают с самыми чистыми стремлениями.
В своем проекте я попытаюсь передать какую-то часть энергии этого живого чуда. И для этого я обращаюсь к вам за поддержкой. Примерная сумма, которая мне потребуется, составляет 1500$, но и в случае меньших сборов я буду прилагать все усилия, чтобы попасть на Кумбха Мелу и реализовать проект.
Благодарностью за вашу помощь станут мои фотографии с подписью (любая из 147 представленных на сайте, выбранного вами размера), фотосплетения на бумаге и открытки из Варанаси. Примеры вознаграждений представлены на фотографии ниже. Как поддержать проект, я подробно описал здесь - https://lukinskiy.livejournal.com/253873.html.

 

Кроме сбора средств у этой кампании есть еще две цели. В ее ходе я впервые представляю фотосплетения на суд зрителей, чтобы проверить эту концепцию на практике, и с благодарностью жду ваших отзывов и соображений. И, разумеется, для моей дальнейшей работы крайне важен поиск заинтересованных галерей и других культурных институций. Поэтому, кроме денежных вкладов, будет особенно полезна любая ваша информационная помощь. Вы можете посетить мой сайт (www.lukinskiy.com), подписаться на аккаунт в facebook (www.facebook.com/evlukinskiy) или instagram (www.instagram.com/lukinskiy_). И, если что-то из моего творчества окажется вам близко, пожалуйста, поделитесь информацией о кампании.
Большое вам спасибо за интерес и внимание, всего хорошего и удачи!

---

Friends!

For many years I have been shooting on black and white film, trying to convey the beauty and the divinity of being, as I see them. Photography has always been a mystical process for me, being a part of the spiritual practice of my communication with space. The film is very consistent with this, not allowing you to immediately see the result, but almost directly bringing it to us through a double touch of light. The film has interesting creative possibilities - large grain and various effects obtained when multiple exposure, zooming and shaking.

 

There was never a commercial component in my photo, I was not engaged in promotion and I organized only one individual exhibition of my photography (in the year of 2011). Nevertheless, the material gradually accumulated, evolved into finished projects and demanded access to people. For a visual representation of the projects, I decided to locate all the photos in a single block so that you can get a general idea. But when located nearby, the photographs are perceived differently by our brain, starting to "influence" each other. And we must make a lot of effort so that they do not turn into meaningless visual chaos. It is even more difficult to ensure that the interaction of images in our consciousness leads to the birth of new sensations and meanings. I studied these questions for about two years and came to the concept of photoplexuses - an art form in which individual images are combined into a single statement due to visual and semantic links.
The ideal photoplexus is a clot of energy sent to you by the universe through the author. To accept this transmission, you need to give your look some time to stroll through the plexus of images. The best way to do it is by using a computer monitor - viewed on a small screen the connections will be significantly weakened. Then the photos, matching each other, will give you their own hints on how to perceive them. And, perhaps, the overall drama of the work will become apparent.
Thus far, I have completed six plexuses, photographs for which have been taken for several years, and they themselves have been getting intertwined for many months.

The first photoplexus is called "Peering into the other." The photos were taken in the years of 2005 to 2011 in St. Petersburg and the surrounding areas. I have completely rebuilt this plexus quite recently, so structurally it is the most difficult one of the six plexuses. In high resolution you can view it on my website - http://www.lukinskiy.com/en/peering_into_the_ot...

 

Photos of the next project - "Attraction of the border" - were taken in the years of 2004 to 2011, mainly in the cemeteries of St. Petersburg. Special effects that can be seen on some of these photos were obtained at the moment of shooting on film. In high resolution - http://www.lukinskiy.com/en/attraction_of_the_b...

 

Photos of the plexus "Balance of space" were taken in the years of 2005 to 2016 in St. Petersburg and its immediate vicinity. In high resolution - http://www.lukinskiy.com/en/balance_of_space/


The photos that made up the plexus "Meditation on the Styx" were taken in some abandoned and dying villages in the east of the Novgorod region (400 km from St. Petersburg) in the years of 2009 to 2012. In high resolution - http://www.lukinskiy.com/en/meditation_on_the_s...

 

The portrait project "Pure people" was also filmed there (2005 to 2012). In high resolution - http://www.lukinskiy.com/en/pure_people/

The project "Light of Kashi" was filmed in India in the holy city of Varanasi in 2014. In high resolution - http://www.lukinskiy.com/en/light_of_Kashi/

 

Based on the materials of this project, I made a series of postcards called "Light of Kashi " consisting of of 13 pieces with a total circulation of 2000 copies (at the moment I have about a half left). To give postcards the value of the artifact, I printed them in the same place where they were taken - in the ancient city of Varanasi. And on the back side I put an inscription "Printed in Varanasi 2017". In high resolution you can view it on my website  - http://www.lukinskiy.com/ru/postcards/

 

Campaign targets and perks.

My new photoplexus, which is the seventh in a row, I am going to devote to the greatest Indian religious holiday - Kumbh Mele, which will be held in the city of Allahabad from mid-January to early March 2019. This is a grand gathering of millions of pilgrims from all over India, where the triumph and the radiance of the Indian yogic spirit is fully manifested. At the place where the two sacred rivers Ganges and Yamuna join, a giant tent city is being built, and one of the largest gatherings of people on Earth is held. In 2013, in two months, Kumbh Mela was visited by about 120 million people, no matter how incredible that may sound. But, despite the incomprehensible concentration of people, the festival is filled with an amazing, benevolent and mystical atmosphere, because people who come here are with the purest aspirations.
In my project, I will try to convey some of the energy of this living miracle. And for this I appeal to you for support. The approximate amount that I need is $ 1,500, but in the case of lower fees, I will make every effort to get to Kumbh Mela and implement the project.
As a thank you for your help I will send you my signed photos (any one of the 147 photos presented on the site, the size you chose), a photoplexuses on paper and postcards from Varanasi. Contact me to let you know which photo, postcard or photoplexus you choose. Send me the name of the project and the sequence number of the photo or postcard. They can be copied from the address bar of the browser by opening the full-size version of the photo. For example: "attraction_of_the_border/06.htm". Examples of rewards are presented in the photo below. How to support the project, I described in detail here - https://lukinskiy.livejournal.com/253873.html.

 

In addition to fundraising, this campaign has two goals. In its course, I present the photoplexuses to the audience for the first time, in order to test this concept in practice, and I gratefully welcome your feedback and thoughts. And, of course, the search for interested galleries and other cultural institutions is extremely important for my future work. Therefore, in addition to cash deposits, any of your information assistance will be especially useful. You can visit my website (www.lukinskiy.com), subscribe to my Facebook (www.facebook.com/evlukinskiy) account or my Instagram (www.instagram.com/lukinskiy_). And, if something from my work will be close to you, please share the information about the campaign. Thank you so much for your interest and attention, my best wishes and good luck!
story_txt: [для заказа открыток, фотографий или фотосплетений нажмите красную кнопку "BACK IT", подробнее - https://lukinskiy.livejournal.com/253873.html]---I offer unique author postcards (13 species), photographed and printed in the holy city of Varanasi (India). On a dense quality cardboard 18x12 cm, 2000 copies. A real Indian artifact for only $ 4 !!! A full set of 13 cards - $ 40 (3 pieces as a gift) !!!Funds are collecting on the 7th project - about Kumbh Mela, the greatest Indian religious festival. Gratitude will be: postcards from Varanasi, photos from six projects, photoplexuses.[english description of the campaign, see below]---Друзья!Много лет я снимаю на черно-белую пленку, стремясь передать красоту и божественность естества, как сам их вижу. Съемка всегда была для меня мистическим процессом, частью необходимой мне духовной практики общения с пространством. Пленка этому весьма соответствует, не позволяя сразу видеть результат, но донося его до нас почти напрямую - через двойное прикосновение света. У пленки есть интересные творческие возможности - крупное зерно и различные эффекты, получаемые при съемке с помощью комбинаций мультиэкспозиции, зуммирования и шевеленки. В моей фотографии никогда не было коммерческой составляющей, я не занимался продвижением и организовал только одну персональную выставку (в 2011). Тем не менее, материал постепенно накапливался, складывался в законченные проекты и требовал выхода к людям. Для наглядного представления проектов я выбрал расположение всех фотографий единым блоком, чтобы можно было составить общее представление. Но, расположенные рядом, фотографии иначе воспринимаются нашим мозгом, начиная "влиять" друг на друга. И надо прилагать множество усилий, чтобы они не превращались в бессмысленный визуальный хаос. Еще сложнее добиться, чтобы взаимодействие изображений в нашем сознании приводило к рождению новых ощущений и смыслов. Я изучал эти вопросы около двух лет и пришел к концепции фотосплетений - художественной формы, в которой отдельные изображения объединяются в единое высказывание за счет визуальных и смысловых связей.Идеальное фотосплетение - это сгусток энергии, посылаемый вам мирозданием руками автора. Чтобы принять эту передачу, надо дать своему взгляду время прогуляться в сплетении изображений. Лучше всего на мониторе компьютера - на маленьком экране связи значительно ослабнут. Тогда фотографии, перекликаясь между собой, сами подскажут путь вашему вниманию. И, возможно, проявится общая драматургия работы.На нынешний момент я завершил шесть сплетений, фотографии для которых снимались по несколько лет, а сами они заплетались по много месяцев.Первое фотосплетение называется "Вглядываясь в иное". Фотографии были сняты с 2005 по 2011 годы в Санкт-Петербурге и ближайших окрестностях. Я полностью перестроил это сплетение совсем недавно, поэтому структурно оно самое сложное из шести. Посмотреть в высоком разрешении его можно на моем сайте - http://www.lukinskiy.com/ru/peering_into_the_ot... Фотографии следующего проекта - "Притяжение границы" - сняты с 2004 по 2011 годы, преимущественно, на кладбищах Санкт-Петербурга. Специальные эффекты, которые есть на части фотографий, получены в момент съемки на пленку. В высоком разрешении на сайте -  http://www.lukinskiy.com/ru/attraction_of_the_b... Фотографии сплетения "Равновесие пространства" сняты с 2005 по 2016 годы в Санкт-Петербурге и ближайших окрестностях. В высоком разрешении на сайте -  http://www.lukinskiy.com/ru/balance_of_space/ Фотографии, составившие сплетение "Медитация на Стиксе", снимались в брошенных и умирающих деревнях на востоке Новгородской области (400 км. от Петербурга) с 2009 по 2012 годы. В высоком разрешении на сайте -  http://www.lukinskiy.com/ru/meditation_on_the_s... Там же снимался портретный проект "Чистые люди" (с 2005 по 2012 годы). В высоком разрешении на сайте -  http://www.lukinskiy.com/ru/pure_people/ Проект "Свет Kashi" снимался в Индии в священном городе Варанаси в 2014 году. В высоком разрешении на сайте -  http://www.lukinskiy.com/ru/light_of_Kashi/ По материалам этого проекта я сделал серию открыток "Свет Kashi" из 13 штук общим тиражом в 2000 экземпляров (на данный момент у меня осталась примерно половина). Чтобы придать открыткам ценность артефакта, я напечатал их там же, где снимал - в древнем Варанаси. И разместил на оборотной строне надпись "Printed in Varanasi 2017". Все открытки можно посмотреть на сайте - http://www.lukinskiy.com/ru/postcards/ Цели кампании и вознаграждения.Новое, седьмое по счету, фотосплетение я собираюсь посвятить величайшему индийскому религиозному празднику - Кумбха Меле, который пройдет в городе Аллахабаде с середины января по начало марта 2019 года. Это грандиозное собрание миллионов паломников со всей Индии, на котором в полной мере проявляется торжество и сияние индийского йогического духа. В месте слияния священных рек Ганги и Ямуны строится гигантский палаточный город, и проводится одно из крупнейших собраний людей на Земле. В 2013 году за два месяца Кумбха Мелу посетило около 120 миллионов человек, как бы невероятно это ни звучало. Но, несмотря на непостижимую концентрацию людей, фестиваль наполнен удивительной, доброжелательной и мистической атмосферой, ведь сюда приезжают с самыми чистыми стремлениями.В своем проекте я попытаюсь передать какую-то часть энергии этого живого чуда. И для этого я обращаюсь к вам за поддержкой. Примерная сумма, которая мне потребуется, составляет 1500$, но и в случае меньших сборов я буду прилагать все усилия, чтобы попасть на Кумбха Мелу и реализовать проект.Благодарностью за вашу помощь станут мои фотографии с подписью (любая из 147 представленных на сайте, выбранного вами размера), фотосплетения на бумаге и открытки из Варанаси. Примеры вознаграждений представлены на фотографии ниже. Как поддержать проект, я подробно описал здесь - https://lukinskiy.livejournal.com/253873.html. Кроме сбора средств у этой кампании есть еще две цели. В ее ходе я впервые представляю фотосплетения на суд зрителей, чтобы проверить эту концепцию на практике, и с благодарностью жду ваших отзывов и соображений. И, разумеется, для моей дальнейшей работы крайне важен поиск заинтересованных галерей и других культурных институций. Поэтому, кроме денежных вкладов, будет особенно полезна любая ваша информационная помощь. Вы можете посетить мой сайт (www.lukinskiy.com), подписаться на аккаунт в facebook (www.facebook.com/evlukinskiy) или instagram (www.instagram.com/lukinskiy_). И, если что-то из моего творчества окажется вам близко, пожалуйста, поделитесь информацией о кампании.Большое вам спасибо за интерес и внимание, всего хорошего и удачи!---Friends!For many years I have been shooting on black and white film, trying to convey the beauty and the divinity of being, as I see them. Photography has always been a mystical process for me, being a part of the spiritual practice of my communication with space. The film is very consistent with this, not allowing you to immediately see the result, but almost directly bringing it to us through a double touch of light. The film has interesting creative possibilities - large grain and various effects obtained when multiple exposure, zooming and shaking. There was never a commercial component in my photo, I was not engaged in promotion and I organized only one individual exhibition of my photography (in the year of 2011). Nevertheless, the material gradually accumulated, evolved into finished projects and demanded access to people. For a visual representation of the projects, I decided to locate all the photos in a single block so that you can get a general idea. But when located nearby, the photographs are perceived differently by our brain, starting to "influence" each other. And we must make a lot of effort so that they do not turn into meaningless visual chaos. It is even more difficult to ensure that the interaction of images in our consciousness leads to the birth of new sensations and meanings. I studied these questions for about two years and came to the concept of photoplexuses - an art form in which individual images are combined into a single statement due to visual and semantic links.The ideal photoplexus is a clot of energy sent to you by the universe through the author. To accept this transmission, you need to give your look some time to stroll through the plexus of images. The best way to do it is by using a computer monitor - viewed on a small screen the connections will be significantly weakened. Then the photos, matching each other, will give you their own hints on how to perceive them. And, perhaps, the overall drama of the work will become apparent.Thus far, I have completed six plexuses, photographs for which have been taken for several years, and they themselves have been getting intertwined for many months.The first photoplexus is called "Peering into the other." The photos were taken in the years of 2005 to 2011 in St. Petersburg and the surrounding areas. I have completely rebuilt this plexus quite recently, so structurally it is the most difficult one of the six plexuses. In high resolution you can view it on my website - http://www.lukinskiy.com/en/peering_into_the_ot... Photos of the next project - "Attraction of the border" - were taken in the years of 2004 to 2011, mainly in the cemeteries of St. Petersburg. Special effects that can be seen on some of these photos were obtained at the moment of shooting on film. In high resolution - http://www.lukinskiy.com/en/attraction_of_the_b... Photos of the plexus "Balance of space" were taken in the years of 2005 to 2016 in St. Petersburg and its immediate vicinity. In high resolution - http://www.lukinskiy.com/en/balance_of_space/The photos that made up the plexus "Meditation on the Styx" were taken in some abandoned and dying villages in the east of the Novgorod region (400 km from St. Petersburg) in the years of 2009 to 2012. In high resolution - http://www.lukinskiy.com/en/meditation_on_the_s... The portrait project "Pure people" was also filmed there (2005 to 2012). In high resolution - http://www.lukinskiy.com/en/pure_people/The project "Light of Kashi" was filmed in India in the holy city of Varanasi in 2014. In high resolution - http://www.lukinskiy.com/en/light_of_Kashi/ Based on the materials of this project, I made a series of postcards called "Light of Kashi " consisting of of 13 pieces with a total circulation of 2000 copies (at the moment I have about a half left). To give postcards the value of the artifact, I printed them in the same place where they were taken - in the ancient city of Varanasi. And on the back side I put an inscription "Printed in Varanasi 2017". In high resolution you can view it on my website  - http://www.lukinskiy.com/ru/postcards/ Campaign targets and perks.My new photoplexus, which is the seventh in a row, I am going to devote to the greatest Indian religious holiday - Kumbh Mele, which will be held in the city of Allahabad from mid-January to early March 2019. This is a grand gathering of millions of pilgrims from all over India, where the triumph and the radiance of the Indian yogic spirit is fully manifested. At the place where the two sacred rivers Ganges and Yamuna join, a giant tent city is being built, and one of the largest gatherings of people on Earth is held. In 2013, in two months, Kumbh Mela was visited by about 120 million people, no matter how incredible that may sound. But, despite the incomprehensible concentration of people, the festival is filled with an amazing, benevolent and mystical atmosphere, because people who come here are with the purest aspirations.In my project, I will try to convey some of the energy of this living miracle. And for this I appeal to you for support. The approximate amount that I need is $ 1,500, but in the case of lower fees, I will make every effort to get to Kumbh Mela and implement the project.As a thank you for your help I will send you my signed photos (any one of the 147 photos presented on the site, the size you chose), a photoplexuses on paper and postcards from Varanasi. Contact me to let you know which photo, postcard or photoplexus you choose. Send me the name of the project and the sequence number of the photo or postcard. They can be copied from the address bar of the browser by opening the full-size version of the photo. For example: "attraction_of_the_border/06.htm". Examples of rewards are presented in the photo below. How to support the project, I described in detail here - https://lukinskiy.livejournal.com/253873.html. In addition to fundraising, this campaign has two goals. In its course, I present the photoplexuses to the audience for the first time, in order to test this concept in practice, and I gratefully welcome your feedback and thoughts. And, of course, the search for interested galleries and other cultural institutions is extremely important for my future work. Therefore, in addition to cash deposits, any of your information assistance will be especially useful. You can visit my website (www.lukinskiy.com), subscribe to my Facebook (www.facebook.com/evlukinskiy) account or my Instagram (www.instagram.com/lukinskiy_). And, if something from my work will be close to you, please share the information about the campaign. Thank you so much for your interest and attention, my best wishes and good luck!

story:
Intro

With Brexit on the front page of every news outlet, I am revisiting another point in time on the European continent where political upheaval changed the course of history. 

During the fall of the Berlin wall and the breakup of the USSR I lived in Berlin and covered some of the aftermath of this momentous event from there. In former Czechoslovakia, Bulgaria, Romania, (1989-90) the Bosnian civil war (1992), Georgia and Azerbaijan (1993), I documented the upheavals, conflicts, people and power brokers. Fast forward two decades and I again photographed two major events within the EU: the Catalonian referendum and the UK referendum resulting in Brexit.

This book, EU - USSR, plots how the breakup of the Soviet Union in the 1980's and 90's  prompted a resurgence of nationalism, ethnic tensions and territorial ambitions across multiple countries. If the EU were to disintegrate, these same ideological forces could reignite conflicts in Europe that have been held in check by its creation. 

EU - USSR considers the consequences of the break up of the USSR and, through reflection, the perspectives that can be gleaned and applied to the EU lest we should we forget.

What am I doing?

I am a Franco/Nigerian photographer now based in London. I have been publishing  my photographs since 1988. The work in this book maps my travels in Europe both as an insider and outsider observing and documenting as political events unfold. 

This campaign will fund the printing of EU-USSR. I already have a publisher on the African continent, Footprints Press Kenya, that will be overseeing the production and distribution there. We are now looking for distribution in Europe, and on the American continent. 

Funding.

Your funding will go a very long way in helping me achieve this project. This book will be ready to go to print by 1st March 2019. The funding will be used for:

  • Printing, shipping, warehousing costs £9000.00
  • Travel to view proofs and prototype during printing process £1000.00

In return for your backing, you will be invited to the launch, and I will offer you a choice of limited edition photographic prints, and/or signed copies of the books.

Running a crowdfunding campaign requires a 100% transparent approach to my backers. I’ll do everything I can to keep you fully informed about the campaign, production, and shipping. If you ever have any questions or comments at all, just post them in the “Comments” section of my page and I’ll be sure to get back to you.

Finally,

EU-USSR will prompt a launch and exhibition beginning in Nairobi and London. Funding the printing of EU-USSR will enable the project to go into the current stress points in Europe right now through a tour for which further funding will be sought.

story:
The project:

I am viable.

2020 has been a year of great reflection – it also marks my tenth year as a professional photographer in the industry. To mark the anniversary, I’ve created a one-of-a-kind coffee table book featuring some of the greatest images from throughout my theatre journey so far. The book, split across 120+ pages, includes production imagery, personal portraits, and images that capture a moment in our joint theatrical history. I’m so excited to share my work in print with you, and celebrate an industry like no other.

What it will cost and what you'll get:

To make this project a reality and look as stunning as the images deserve to be, it will cost approximately £15,000. This figure includes the printing of the first 400 books, any design work, marketing, press, retouching, my cups of coffee, and going though nearly one million images from quite literally thousands of shoots.

It’s going to take a while to get everything ready for you as we move towards our hopeful launch of July 2021. And if we can get this finished earlier, we sure will. 

But why?

I’ve spent ten years doing what I love. I do it for others to invite audiences into their theatre; photos also often help celebrate an individual. It’s also sometimes just for fun! 

I want to document this journey together in print so other people can enjoy the photos as they should be seen – in print and there in the flesh.

And one more thing

25% of all the profits (so after taxes and costs) will go to MAD TRUST, a charity I have supported for over five years through West End Bares and West End Eurovision.

Just one more thing, honest

Thank you for supporting me over the last ten years, it was a leap of faith starting a career in the arts in 2010, and even though 2020 has been unkind to so many of us, we will be back and creating work for you all again very soon!

--------

Just a little note, the photos in the main image on this site may not make it into the book.
