Thank you!

story:
The Project:  Click on and take a look at my update.

       My idea to publish a pictorial book  of Fogo Island, Nfld.,  with the goal of selling it to raise  funds for mental health projects and heritage  projects on the island started in 2015 when I was selected  for the international  artist-in-residence program. My placement  was located in Tilting.

I soon realized the island was a feast for a photographer: the seascapes, landscapes, flora, fauna, the communities. In 2016 I  returned on my own accord  for 4 months  to become more familiar with the communities and to continue photographing for the book.

Now in the final stages I'm very excited to complete the self-publishing process and have the book available to the public in July.  If it is being shipped you will receive it in August.

Your contribution is making a huge difference. As someone volunteering my work and time I need your support to take the project to the finish line.

                 When you buy a book in the store you only get the book.  By supporting  my project now you ensure:                       

  • a dream is realized 
  • In addition you receive  a beautiful pictorial book, gifts and 
  • are indirectly a generous contributor to  two important areas that need assistance:   
    • promoting mental wellness
    • heritage trails/buildings

                                                    

To show gratitude for your contribution I'm offering 7 different amazing perks:

  •       Check them out,  donate what you can, choose one, click and the perk will be yours!

Your support and contribution will provide for:

  • layout and design  (now to mid-May)
  • printer's preparation costs after receiving  PDF files  (June)
  • twelve  sample contact color proofs (June)
  • printing, binding   of 1000 books in July  (minimum order for an affordable price)
  • indigogo  fees

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN BE SUPPORTIVE:

SOCIAL MEDIA SUPPORT

                                                                      Spreading the word is crucial. I need all the help I can get  over the next 60 days.  I am over the moon excited about this book and what the profits will accomplish and I’m hoping you will be also!

Your “shares” will go a long way if you:

  • post a message on your Facebook page or
  • even better a link to my project  page using  the indiegogo buttons to share this project with your friends, relatives, co-workers, and contacts.
  • Tweet, blog, instagram  and share, let the world know it’s a project worth supporting.

 

FAQs

Why are you   donating profits  of the sale of this book to  mental wellness and/or  heritage projects?

Mental Wellness: Statistics state that every individual is affected indirectly or directly by mental illness. Lives can be saved  if the right support is provided in time.

Heritage Projects on Fogo Island :  I think heritage is so important. It links us with our past and helps us understand our roots.  My childhood  town of Swan River, MB contains a heritage village which first inspired me to be interested. However here on  Fogo Island much of it's  originality has been maintained: unspoiled nature,  root cellars, heritage buildings and the generous hospitality and welcoming nature of it’s residents.  The locals tell me the island was  founded by the French in the 17th century as a base for their transatlantic fishery and later a station for the English and Irish migratory fishery sometime after 1713.  In Tilting, settlement followed in the 1720s and by the 1770s it had become  predominantly Irish  and soon evolved into an exclusively Irish  community.

Tilting, where my residency was located, is situated on the north-eastern tip of the island is known as the oldest Irish Settlement in Canada and in 2003  was designated a Registered Heritage District.  It is also known as one of the country’s best-preserved collections of structures associated with the fishery and early farming in Newfoundland and Labrador. 

Turpins Trail is one of  the most used non-motorized  trails on the island.   Dozens  of visitors  hike at least a section of it  on a daily basis during spring, summer and fall to view the beautiful vistas.  Yearly storms and daily weather  affect and deteriorate it  making the wood rot and dislodging rocks and soil. Constant labour intensive up-keep is required to keep it safe.

Historic trails and buildings are links to our past. When the buildings disappear and trails erode it's like losing part of  story.

Why are there no shipping charges for Fogo Island, St. John's Nfld.  or Victoria, B.C.?

Because I live in Victoria, B.C. in the winter and Newfoundland in the summer/fall and the three    locations are  where contributors can pick up their perks as I will have books, cards, and prints  with  me. 

Do I have to claim my perk?

No, If you prefer  not to receive perks you can inform me by email of your choice. To ensure you aren't charged for shipping choose a "Perking Spot" for Fogo Island,  St. John's Nfld.  or Victoria, B.C. where there are no shipping charges. 

ARE THERE RISKS INVOLVED?

Sure there are! Living day to day is a risk. There's always the possibility of an unforeseen emergency, a natural disaster,  problems at the printing press or a mail or delivery strike. Folks comment, "How do you know enough people will fund you?"  I tell them,  I just trust!  

The worst case scenario is that the project would be delayed. No matter what,  it will happen. I'm determined and optimistic. All projects I've started at different levels in various walks of life have always been successfully accomplished whether it was working in a war-torn country or balancing halfway up a tree on a limb to get the perfect photograph of a bird.

Can I contact you by email if I have a question about this project?

Yes, I can be contacted at leelascreative@outlook.com if your questions aren't answered here.

Why are your thumbnails of other projects?

Because I want the contents of the book to be a total surprise! In addition, samples of other projects will show you the quality of my photos.

Do you ever donate your work?

Yes, in addition to selling I regularly donate numerous pieces of my work to charities   for their fundraising: Feile Tilting, Canadian Cancer Society, Big Brothers Big Sisters, SPCA, Women's Shelters, Mental Health Associations, Family Resource Centres, etc.

Why do you like photography?

It is very  rewarding when I see how my photos evoke emotions as the artistic nature of he content  touches the senses of the viewers. Then I know waiting hours and days for just the right light or situation was worth it.

Photography also allows me to be in the moment and  to see more beauty in my surroundings and have greater  appreciation  for nature.

Assisting others through photography is one of my  mottos. I love learning, exploring different cultures, nature and hiking. There's no better way to share my passion than through photography.  I've lived, worked and travelled in over 30 countries with a career in international community development  and now photography allows me to explore from a different perspective.  My most recent goal is to use all my photography as a fundraiser for various organizations.

When did you start photography?

A number of years ago. My ex-partner had purchased a lot of camera equipment and then never used it. At the same time I thought so many wedding albums were boring "all the same posed photos"  so I started taking creative wedding pictures for friends and putting them in albums for a gift. It soon became a business.   That was a risk! Weddings are only for a few hours, the photos have to turn out! I'm lucky they always did. After a couple of years I needed more stimulation for my hobby/extra work and  wanted to spend more time outdoors in my free time.

I was attracted to nature photography and capturing poses of people at work. My work has sold and sells  at juried shows,  artist collectives, exhibitions and stores  across Canada, U.S.A.  and internationally. 

Is there any info you wouldn't accept in the 6 x 2  inch sponsor space? 

I won't accept racist or discriminatory websites. The info is subject to my approval.

Why don't you have a Facebook account?

Because I think there are enough folks out there who really care about others, have Facebook pages  and  will assist me in reaching my goal by spreading the word.

Thank you for your interest in my project and for contributing to it. I appreciate  the fact that you care and the time you are taking to do this!
story_txt:
The Project:  Click on and take a look at my update.       My idea to publish a pictorial book  of Fogo Island, Nfld.,  with the goal of selling it to raise  funds for mental health projects and heritage  projects on the island started in 2015 when I was selected  for the international  artist-in-residence program. My placement  was located in Tilting.I soon realized the island was a feast for a photographer: the seascapes, landscapes, flora, fauna, the communities. In 2016 I  returned on my own accord  for 4 months  to become more familiar with the communities and to continue photographing for the book.Now in the final stages I'm very excited to complete the self-publishing process and have the book available to the public in July.  If it is being shipped you will receive it in August.Your contribution is making a huge difference. As someone volunteering my work and time I need your support to take the project to the finish line.                 When you buy a book in the store you only get the book.  By supporting  my project now you ensure:                       
a dream is realized 

In addition you receive  a beautiful pictorial book, gifts and 
are indirectly a generous contributor to  two important areas that need assistance:   
promoting mental wellness
heritage trails/buildings


                                                     To show gratitude for your contribution I'm offering 7 different amazing perks:      Check them out,  donate what you can, choose one, click and the perk will be yours!Your support and contribution will provide for:
layout and design  (now to mid-May)

printer's preparation costs after receiving  PDF files  (June)

twelve  sample contact color proofs (June)

printing, binding   of 1000 books in July  (minimum order for an affordable price)

indigogo  fees
 OTHER WAYS YOU CAN BE SUPPORTIVE:SOCIAL MEDIA SUPPORT                                                                      Spreading the word is crucial. I need all the help I can get  over the next 60 days.  I am over the moon excited about this book and what the profits will accomplish and I’m hoping you will be also!Your “shares” will go a long way if you:
post a message on your Facebook page or
even better a link to my project  page using  the indiegogo buttons to share this project with your friends, relatives, co-workers, and contacts.
Tweet, blog, instagram  and share, let the world know it’s a project worth supporting.

 FAQsWhy are you   donating profits  of the sale of this book to  mental wellness and/or  heritage projects?Mental Wellness: Statistics state that every individual is affected indirectly or directly by mental illness. Lives can be saved  if the right support is provided in time.Heritage Projects on Fogo Island :  I think heritage is so important. It links us with our past and helps us understand our roots.  My childhood  town of Swan River, MB contains a heritage village which first inspired me to be interested. However here on  Fogo Island much of it's  originality has been maintained: unspoiled nature,  root cellars, heritage buildings and the generous hospitality and welcoming nature of it’s residents.  The locals tell me the island was  founded by the French in the 17th century as a base for their transatlantic fishery and later a station for the English and Irish migratory fishery sometime after 1713.  In Tilting, settlement followed in the 1720s and by the 1770s it had become  predominantly Irish  and soon evolved into an exclusively Irish  community.Tilting, where my residency was located, is situated on the north-eastern tip of the island is known as the oldest Irish Settlement in Canada and in 2003  was designated a Registered Heritage District.  It is also known as one of the country’s best-preserved collections of structures associated with the fishery and early farming in Newfoundland and Labrador. Turpins Trail is one of  the most used non-motorized  trails on the island.   Dozens  of visitors  hike at least a section of it  on a daily basis during spring, summer and fall to view the beautiful vistas.  Yearly storms and daily weather  affect and deteriorate it  making the wood rot and dislodging rocks and soil. Constant labour intensive up-keep is required to keep it safe.Historic trails and buildings are links to our past. When the buildings disappear and trails erode it's like losing part of  story.Why are there no shipping charges for Fogo Island, St. John's Nfld.  or Victoria, B.C.?Because I live in Victoria, B.C. in the winter and Newfoundland in the summer/fall and the three    locations are  where contributors can pick up their perks as I will have books, cards, and prints  with  me. Do I have to claim my perk?No, If you prefer  not to receive perks you can inform me by email of your choice. To ensure you aren't charged for shipping choose a "Perking Spot" for Fogo Island,  St. John's Nfld.  or Victoria, B.C. where there are no shipping charges. ARE THERE RISKS INVOLVED?Sure there are! Living day to day is a risk. There's always the possibility of an unforeseen emergency, a natural disaster,  problems at the printing press or a mail or delivery strike. Folks comment, "How do you know enough people will fund you?"  I tell them,  I just trust!  The worst case scenario is that the project would be delayed. No matter what,  it will happen. I'm determined and optimistic. All projects I've started at different levels in various walks of life have always been successfully accomplished whether it was working in a war-torn country or balancing halfway up a tree on a limb to get the perfect photograph of a bird.Can I contact you by email if I have a question about this project?Yes, I can be contacted at leelascreative@outlook.com if your questions aren't answered here.Why are your thumbnails of other projects?Because I want the contents of the book to be a total surprise! In addition, samples of other projects will show you the quality of my photos.Do you ever donate your work?Yes, in addition to selling I regularly donate numerous pieces of my work to charities   for their fundraising: Feile Tilting, Canadian Cancer Society, Big Brothers Big Sisters, SPCA, Women's Shelters, Mental Health Associations, Family Resource Centres, etc.Why do you like photography?It is very  rewarding when I see how my photos evoke emotions as the artistic nature of he content  touches the senses of the viewers. Then I know waiting hours and days for just the right light or situation was worth it.Photography also allows me to be in the moment and  to see more beauty in my surroundings and have greater  appreciation  for nature.Assisting others through photography is one of my  mottos. I love learning, exploring different cultures, nature and hiking. There's no better way to share my passion than through photography.  I've lived, worked and travelled in over 30 countries with a career in international community development  and now photography allows me to explore from a different perspective.  My most recent goal is to use all my photography as a fundraiser for various organizations.When did you start photography?A number of years ago. My ex-partner had purchased a lot of camera equipment and then never used it. At the same time I thought so many wedding albums were boring "all the same posed photos"  so I started taking creative wedding pictures for friends and putting them in albums for a gift. It soon became a business.   That was a risk! Weddings are only for a few hours, the photos have to turn out! I'm lucky they always did. After a couple of years I needed more stimulation for my hobby/extra work and  wanted to spend more time outdoors in my free time.I was attracted to nature photography and capturing poses of people at work. My work has sold and sells  at juried shows,  artist collectives, exhibitions and stores  across Canada, U.S.A.  and internationally. Is there any info you wouldn't accept in the 6 x 2  inch sponsor space? I won't accept racist or discriminatory websites. The info is subject to my approval.Why don't you have a Facebook account?Because I think there are enough folks out there who really care about others, have Facebook pages  and  will assist me in reaching my goal by spreading the word.Thank you for your interest in my project and for contributing to it. I appreciate  the fact that you care and the time you are taking to do this!

story:
My name is John Beaudine.  I am a  photographer who resides in Fargo, North Dakota.  My prime interest in photography is landscapes.  The biggest factor in my love of photographing landscapes is due to my upbringing.  Having grown up on a lake in front of my home and over a hundred acres of woodland behind, I've had a love for the outdoors for most of my life.  For the past few years, a majority of my photography has been a travelogue focusing on the landscape of the American West/Southwest.  I've always had a fascination with the region thanks in part to artists/filmmakers such as Ansel Adams, Dorothea Lange, John Ford and Wim Wenders.  

On April 26th of this year, President Donald Trump issued an executive order for the Secretary of Interior to review 27 national monuments that were designated between 1996 and 2006 under the Antiquities Act of 1906.  Interior Secretary Ryan Zinke submitted his report to the White House on August 24th.  Months before his report was submitted to the White House in late August,  it was already announced that Bears Ears in Utah would be downsized.  As I write this (September 18), it has now been reported that Zinke recommended that there should be changes to more monuments.  Grand Staircase-Escalante in Utah, Cascade-Siskiyou in Oregon, Gold Butte in Nevada, Katahdin in Maine, Organ Mountains-Desert Peaks and Rio Grande Del Norte (both in New Mexico) are the other monuments that have been proposed to be downsized.  The majority of the 27 national monuments that were part of the executive order are located in the American West/Southwest. Five are located in the oceans.  Three of these monuments of protected oceans (Northeast Canyons and Seamounts, Rose Atoll and Pacific Remote Islands) were also recommended by Zinke to be changed.  

The project for which I plan to embark on is a travelogue of the national monuments that were under review in Trump's executive order. My plan would be to not just photograph the monuments themselves but also include visits to the towns and the people who live near these impressive monuments. I've already started this project by spending some time at one of the monuments this past July.  The photographs on this page were taken at Upper Missouri River Breaks National Monument in Montana.  Naturally, I would love to return there and work on more photography of the monument.  

Due to my current job situation, I am only able to take a certain amount of time off from work.  Currently, my plan is to travel to a few monuments for two to three weeks every few months within the next year and complete these visits before the end of 2018.  

 

What I Need & What You Get

My goal is to begin an exhibition featuring my travels to the monuments at some of the local/regional art galleries with hopes of expanding it beyond North Dakota and Minnesota.  I also plan to publish a book featuring the photography of this journey.  The money for the project would go towards the following:
 - Travel expenses (gas/car rental, etc.)
 - Admission/camping fees of the monuments 
 - Art supplies (matte board, frames, etc.) for the exhibition
 - Printing fees for the book 

The perks from this project will include a pack of 20 postcards featuring  the monuments, copies of the book and prints (unframed and framed) presented in different sizes that feature a photograph of one of the monuments.   

The Impact

I hope to begin a discussion with others about these National Monuments and about the importance of preserving what’s left of our nation’s untamed wilderness.  I feel that many people may not be familiar with the significance of these monuments.  Even when talking to a few of friends about this, they were unfamiliar with the monuments and wanted to learn more (ex. Are these monuments statues or buildings?  Or are these areas of land that could be like a national park?) Talking with others about the National Parks may be easy but what about the National Monuments?  Why are these preserved lands only monuments and not National Parks?  What are the stories behind them?  Is there a reason why these 27 monuments were targeted by Trump?  And what do the people who live near the monuments have to say about the whole executive order?  

Risks & Challenges

In my view, the biggest risk of this project is not knowing what the future holds for these monuments that face enormous changes.  As stated before, it was announced at the time of writing this proposal how many of the monuments would be downsized.   I've always viewed photography as a way of capturing a moment in time.  I need to visit these monuments before the possible changes to them begin and to capture with my cameras  the way they appeared at this precise moment in time.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot afford to contribute to this campaign, you can always spread the word.  You can easily post a link on any social media platform (Facebook, Twitter, etc).  If you know friends or relatives that have an interest in our preserved lands, this might be a project that they may find interesting and would love to contribute to.  Word of mouth is a key factor in helping meet this campaign's goal.

story:
My name is Farrah Aviva. In May, 2018 I created BITE THE BULLET stories with the intention of doing a side project to give back.  I never expected it to resonate with as many people as it has or as quickly as it did. The support and enthusiasm people have shown is beyond what I could have ever imagined. I am a person who is driven by passion and this project engulfed me from day one. From the outset, BITE THE BULLET stories took on a life of it's own and I wholeheartedly devoted myself to it.  Through this experience I've seen first-hand the transformational impact the project has had on not only those who have shared their stories, but also on the overwhelming number of people who have been inspired by them.  Of the 15 stories I've published since May, on Instagram alone there are close to 1 million likes and over 7,000 comments, not to mention the thousands of engagements on Twitter and Facebook, as well. Entertainment Tonight  has also recently featured one of the stories.

 

While I've been blown away by the momentum the project has garnered it has rapidly become clear to me that BITE THE BULLET stories is potentially tapping into something far bigger. I've now come to a place where I need your help in order to take this to the next level.

 

 
 

Until this point, I've been a one-woman show, seeing to every aspect of the campaign - interviewing, photoshoots, prop building, styling, editing, video creation, social media management, merchandise development and creation, publicity, research development, etc. It's been exhilarating and the most fulfilling work I've ever done.  But I can't do this on my own anymore.
 
I'm 'Biting the Bullet' to open up and share the most vulnerable thing that I could possibly admit: I'm tapped out and I need help. By not working and dedicating all my time to this I've in turn used all my resources over the past few months. But I am fully dedicated to seeing this through. I refuse to let this project die.
 
   
 

I believe BITE THE BULLET stories can play a humble part in changing the world for the better.  We live in a time where humanity is more interconnected than it's ever been. Yet that has also somehow paradoxically made us more isolated.  We're all perfectly imperfect and we each have stories, and causes we want to fight for. This campaign endeavors to turn the tables by sharing our imperfections along with our passions in order to create change and inspire those around us.
 
Everyday I'm contacted by people who have been touched by this campaign and wish to share their stories. I want to keep going.
 
I have so many fantastic, empowering and life changing stories to share but I need your help to get through the next few months while I develop a way to make this project support itself.
 

With your help, I believe I can build BITE THE BULLET Stories into a platform that stretches beyond social media. It has the potential to grow into a global community people turn to when they need support, inspiration, motivation and a voice. I also believe we can create awareness around causes that need it.  Below are just a few of the avenues I've already begun to develop:

   
 

I'm hoping to raise these funds to cover the cost of operating until the end of the year as well as pay for things such a trademark, incorporating fees, a legal retainer and a part time assistant so I can not only continue BITE THE BULLET Stories, but also take it to the next level. 

This is a list of costs I anticipate needing to cover before 2019.

  

 

By donating to BITE THE BULLET stories and spreading the word, you're not only helping to keep a worthy cause going, you're also joining a groundswell movement of people who have chosen to show their courage in the face of adversity. I salute you.

Thank you for your time! xo Farrah Aviva

 

OPTIONS & REWARDS

 

• Instagram Story Thank You or Personal Email Thank You


• Personalized Handwritten Thank You Card With Your Own 'Bite the Bullet' Bullet Shell

 

 

• 'BITE THE BULLET' Make A Wish Necklace (2 options available)

 

•'BITE THE BULLET' Courage & Strength 38 Necklace

 

• 14k Gold Filled  'BITE THE BULLET' Courage & Strength 22 Necklace

 

• Signed prints of ARROW star, Emily Bett


• The official, Signed, Limited Edition Bite the Bullet Print (3 options available)

• A Signed, Limited Edition, Bite the Bullet Print framed in a handmade frame surrounded by over one thousand 38 Special Bullet Shells.

story:
There is a mobile device photography trend in full swing. Never before have so many people concurrently had the means to capture and share a moment, a vision  …and with creating fantastic pixel resolution, enough to make a quality photograph of a certain size.

mobile device photography: Darkness

A book that will put into physical existence the photographs from people around the world captured on their mobile devices. Rarely does a moment from the picture files of our phones or tablets become an object as we no longer tend towards photo albums. This book is a collection of objets d’art made from photographic capture of iPhone, Blackberry and other mobile devices. A technology that has replaced pocket-sized 35mm film cameras and enabled many more to collect snap shots and create photographic artworks only because we happen to carry the camera close to our person at all times in our mobile devices.

The first book published by Print Oculus mobile device photography: Enlightenment has been available since Spring 2013. A much-loved publication partially funded by the indiegogo community whom we humbly thank. Because of high demand and with balance to Enlightenment Oculus Arts called for submissions to Darkness, once again inviting mobile device photographers to comment on a theme. These are now edited into a great looking copy of the second book that perfectly compliments the first. The design of Darkness is reminiscent of its counter part and with about the same number of submissions will also be about the same size.

A call for submissions went as wide as we could and people from all kinds of places responded with their photographs and thoughts. Previously published mobile device photographers are among the artists alongside those also inspired to see their capture in print. Everyone who submitted will be published in the book and a sweet quirk of the layout is that the photographs are shown in the order of when they were received. Accompanying the mobile device photographs, a brief sentence or two gives a little insight into who we are of all ages and genetics. Under the Gallery tab are pages from Enlightenment as an example of this and some other photos of interest. For Darkness Daniel Berman, Mobile Photo Awards founder and artist, writes for us an essay.

The book mobile device photography: Enlightenment has been found in Street Level Gallery, Glasgow, UK and in QSQ Giclee Boutique, Toronto, Canada. It was available for loan at Glasgow School of Art Library until the devastating fire last year.

Your contribution will enable us to make another Objet d’Art, a book, the first edition print-run of one hundred copies only - mobile device photography: Darkness. Your contribution will also provide encouragement to make photographic art and then if for no other reason to contribute to this book there's always because it makes people feel really good celebrating their creativity in the slightest of ways.

cameras and enabled many more to collect snap shots and create photographic
artworks only because we happen to carry the camera close to our person at all times in
our mobile devices.
The first book published by Print Oculus mobile device photography: Enlightenment has been available since Spring 2013. A much-loved
publication partially funded by the indiegogo community whom we humbly thank.
Because of high demand and with balance to Enlightenment Oculus
Arts called for submissions to Darkness, once again inviting mobile device
photographers to comment on a theme. These are now edited into a great looking
copy of the second book that perfectly compliments the first. The design of
Darkness is reminiscent of its counter part and with about the same number of
submissions will also be about the same size. 
A call for submissions went as wide as we could and people
from all kinds of places responded with their photographs and thoughts.
Previously published mobile device photographers are among the artists alongside those also inspired to see their capture in
print. Everyone who submitted will be published in the book and a sweet quirk of the layout is
 that the photographs are shown in the order of when they were received. Accompanying the mobile device photographs, a brief
sentence or two gives a little insight into who we are of all ages and
genetics. Under the Gallery tab are pages from Enlightenment as an example of this and some other photos of interest. For Darkness Daniel Berman, Mobile Photo Awards founder and artist, writes for us an essay.
The book mobile device photography: Enlightenment has been found in Street Level Gallery,
Glasgow, UK and in QSQ Giclee Boutique, Toronto, Canada. It was available for
loan at Glasgow School of Art Library until the devastating fire last year.
Your contribution will enable us
to make another Objet d’Art, a book, the first edition print-run of one hundred copies only - mobile device photography: Darkness. Your contribution will also provide encouragement to make photographic art and then if for no other reason to contribute to this book
there's always because it makes people feel really good celebrating their
creativity in the slightest of ways.

story:
February is fast approaching and with it comes the Exposure 2015 Photography Festival and the launch of Canmore Juxtaposed: an exhibition of blended photographs.

Many thanks to everyone who has supported this project so far. These contributions have been used to pay for part of the printing costs, but more costs are coming and we could still use your help!

The photographs produced for this exhibition are intended to serve as a perpetual fundraiser for the museum, which works to preserve Canmore’s history and tell the community’s stories. The goal of the project fundraiser is to cover some of the upfront costs so that sales of the exhibition images will go to support the museum. Prints and postcards of the blended images will also be available in the gift shop.

So if you love Canmore and its history, please consider donating to support this exhibition and the Canmore Museum and Geoscience Centre. Your financial support will not go unrewarded—there’s prints and postcards to be had as a thank you.

For more information, contact the Canmore Museum through its website at www.cmags.org or at 403-678-2462.

story:
Short Summary

Hello Friends and Supporters,

My name is Vikram Dogra.  I am a photographer based in Astoria, a neighborhood in Queens, New York City. Upon moving to the neighborhood 14 years ago, I instantly fell in love with Astoria and began photographing it. I've composed a photo book titled, East of East River: A Decade of Street Photography in Astoria & Long Island City, Queens, NY 2005-2014. With about 140 black & white and color images, the book is born out of a decade of labor of love for a unique part of New York City, separated from Manhattan by East River and connected to it by two beautiful bridges; so close and worlds apart...

A Special Book 

East of East River (EOER) is the first of its kind as a photo book focusing on the special New York City neighborhoods Astoria and Long Island City. East side of East River has been an immigrants' crossroad for almost 400 years. Reflecting that heritage, its landscape is a mix of industrial, suburban, commercial buildings and projects, warehouses, mom & pop stores, laundromats, barbers, bakeries, cafes, repair shops, car dealers, bodegas, beer gardens, parks, bridges and museums.  EOER captures a vibrant portrait of Astoria/LIC as a cultural melting pot, defined by a unique authenticity offering amazing food, music, literature and arts.

East of East River (EOER) offers a portrait of the everyday life in Astoria/LIC from the perspective of those who do live and work here. It is also an archival history of a dynamic, fast-changing neighborhood at the first decade of the new century. The photographs capture the renewal but also the loss of the unique landscape. For those rooted here, or whose paths have crossed through, the images will bring back memories of a diverse community and of places that used to be. Others living far and away might find something familiar in those same images that is reminiscent of their own corners of world, and maybe feel an urge to come and explore ours. 

There is a growing interest in Queens and a recognition of its richness not only in this country but around the world, as evidenced by its designation as the top U.S. destination for 2015 by Lonely Planet. As New York is a world city and Queens is a world borough, Astoria/LIC is a world neighborhood, a neighborhood that encapsulates the whole world. EOER is a record and celebration of the many worlds that converge on the East of East River.

Final Stage of Funding and Publishing with Your Support

The essential steps in completion of this book such as photography, editing and design are completed. The last integral stage of publishing is printing a quality limited set and getting the book to your hands and with your help to many more people. The goal needed to get EOER printed and pay for shipping/delivery and other fund raising related costs is $10,000.00.  The money will fund the following necessary logistic costs (as percent of budget):

  1. Print cost of limited edition set of 2000 books (55%).
  2. Shipping costs from printer to NYC and shipping cost for books and prints for campaign supporters (20%).
  3. Production cost for E-Book/App version (10%).
  4. Sales taxes and Indiegogo fundraising cost (15%).
Additional Funds exceeding the goal will afford a print order of a larger quantity of books based on Indiegogo sales, and toward production cost of E-book/app guide.

The Impact

I put together this East of East River as a personal memento of the wonderful journey and discovery of a great part of New York City and Queens.  I hope you will share my sentiment in enjoying this book.  Your support in making EOER a reality is absolutely integral.   I am humbly grateful and thank you for all your support.   

Your Support

Your help to spread the word will be equally kind and appreciated.  Indiegogo's platform is superb to spread the good word through various social media.  Your purchase of a perk is also supported by many forms of payment medium including credit cards, pay pal and major foreign currencies.
Thank you.

story:
From Kings and Queens, to God Please Save Me

My name is Travis Patenaude, and I’m a voice for the Galgo Español (Spanish Greyhound).  Four years ago my wife and I adopted our first Galgo from Spain, Leena. Leena’s galgueros (Galgo handler/hunter) no longer had a use for her, so she was to be hung from a tree as is the tradition of the galgueros.  She was rescued in time and brought to the USA and adopted by my wife and I.  When Leena came into our lives, we knew we had to do something to help all the other dogs still in Spain.  Since adopting Leena we have started a not for proft Galgo adoption organization called Love Hope Believe Galgo Adoption and have transported 32 Galgos to the US.  We have traveled to Spain 4 times in two  years to
volunteer at the shelters that rescue and rehabilitate these dogs.  In the US very few people know about the Galgo Espanol and their plight. The Galgo is used by hunters in Spain as a tool for hunting and competitions.  At the end of the hunting season, this so called tool, the Galgo, is disposed of in cruel and inhumane ways including
hanging, suffocation, tied to trees in the desert, burned alive and abandoned
to the streets. We believe awareness is the key to stopping the abuse of these dogs in Spain. The more people know about what is going on in Spain, the louder our collective voices will be to make Spain change their laws and protect the Galgos.

 

A picture is worth a thousand words. 

The goal of this book is to show the resilience of the Galgos and how forgiving they can be.  From the time they are rescued, afraid, in desperate need of medical attention, learning to trust people again, and finally finding their forever homes.

 

Beauty is in the eye of the beholder

The beauty of a Galgo Espanols form, and their long muscles, give them a very athletic look. The scars all over their body  

 

How pictures can save life’s

Pictures have no language barrier and there is no need to translate a written story between different languages. The pictures themselves tell the story. They show all the pain, sorrow, hope, love, joy and happiness.  They allow us to show everyone what is happening to the hunting dogs of Spain.

When we volunteer at a shelter, we take a lot of photos and post them on social media for all the adoption groups to see.  This allows the adoption groups to get a better look at the dogs and see their personalities in the pictures.  We constantly get requests from groups to find out the identity of a Galgo that we have posted or to take pictures of a dog they are interested in.  One of the shelters we volunteer at currently is housing 800 dogs.  Their small staff is not able to keep up with the pictures of all the dogs.  It is important to get photos to adoption groups to generate interest in adoption.  When dogs are chosen by an adoption group this allows the shelters to save another Galgo.

 

Our adoption group was fortunate enough to have a member of Hearts Speak take pictures of our adoptable Galgos and saw the impact of these professionally done pictures.  She took the time to teach me how to take better pictures and to help our foster Galgos get adopted.  My photography skills have improved I want to create photo journal the Galgos life in Spain to help raise awareness, educate the public on the situation in Spain and increase adoptions.  I also want to help local Spanish shelters by offering to taking pictures of their available animals to help them find their forever homes.

On our last trip to Spain in February 2015, we spent a week volunteering at ASOCIACIÓN BAASGALGO, a shelter.  These are several of the pictures taken of the Galgos at this shelter.

 


Pictures of Galgos waiting for there forever home in Chicago IL USA


Thank you for donating to help purchase the new lens and to hopefully inspire more people to become a voice for the Galgos.

Travis Patenaude

story:
(The project is in English version, French & Italian)

Hello everybody, 

my name is Giorgia and I’m an Italian photographer.

I come from Sardinia, an amazing island that is so hard to leave even if it’s so necessary to do,  and every departure is always too much homesick.

For a long time I have been living in Bologna where I really improved my skills and capabilities.

I had the chance of working  in an e-commerce field: our team had to take fashion pictures for the most important brands and realize catalogues for Italian and International designers.

In such a creative and motivating experience, I developed more and more the idea, to be honest, also the big dream of moving to Paris.

Why working and living here? Just because Paris is an incredible metropolis where anyone-a photographer or any other artist-can find that real massive mash-up of different cultures, languages, backgrounds that offers all the inspiration needed.

I had just realized in the past a project about a metropolis, New York: in that case I had discovered how a simple human could comparing himself to the enormous dimension of a city like that.

I can’t deny that trips are important and I think the same also of professional experiences but, for me, the most deeply touching moment ever was the birth of my daughter, Bianca.

It was three years ago and about our family I can say that it’s not as  conventional as the others:  in fact it’s a monoparental one because it was only me to acknowledge the child.

Everybody around told me that with my baby I would have stopped working, travelling, having fun and probably that I would have given up living my life and who knows what else I would I have stopped.

But the reality was totally different: step by step, even in our easy way, I still keep on enjoying my every-day life: my daughter grows up and that’s what I really care.

And thanks to these three years I developed the idea of this project and for this reason I need you.

I’m planning my tour in 14 laps all over the Europe: from Lampedusa to Norway, from Portugal to Greece and edit the PhotoBook.

*Lampedusa, France, Suisse, Allemagne, Pays Bas, Norvège, Estonie, Scozia, Irlande, Portugal, Malte, Grèce, Roumanie, Italie*

I’d like to do it with my child because I indeed want to demonstrate that any woman can make a trip alone, do a lot of experiences and have the opportunity to know other stories: 14 different backgrounds from any type of family, non-conventional ones that can give us also new educational methods.

I’d also show you all the different politics among the EU countries about work and family fields.

Even if I don’t get 16,000 Euros, my wish will be anyway to manage to edit my book and in that case I could also reduce the laps of my tour.

The  16.000 euro :

20% for the production 

40% for two person travel and living

30% for edition PhotoBook and Perks

10% for the traduction PhotoBook

I’m sure they will be so so much interesting and I can’t realize it without you and your effort.

I do need your help for everything: not only for the whole tour, not only for the post-editing, but also for printing the book I’d like to give you before Christmas 2015.

My trip without you is impossible to do: you are one of the most powerful rings of the chain in my project.

If you can’t help me by money, I just ask you to give me your support by a click on social networks, sharing and spreading my research and my story.

During the development of  the whole 14 laps you will be always informed or you can reach all my news by yourselves using Twitter, Facebook, Periscope.

I wanna thank you in advance for all you will be able to do for me and for us.

And thanks so much also for watching my video.

Kind greetings by me and my baby Bianca.

_____________________________French Version__________________________________

Bonjour,

Giorgia est mon nom. A la base j'ai rien de particulier. Italienne de la Sardaigne

romantique dans l'âme j'ai toujours adore la photographie. Capturer en un clic tout une histoire, des émotions, des personnages... L'image selon moi peut contenir tout une vie un véritable chamboulement de sentiment.


A l'âge de 24 ans toujours célibataire, déjà installée depuis un bon moment a Bologne, je me lançais dans la vie active en tant que photographe professionnelle.  Avide de nouvelles expériences d'amour et de vie j'ai appris que j'attendais un enfant dans quelques mois. Le destin me réservait apparement beaucoup de surprises! 


Aujourd'hui je me retrouve a Paris avec une petite fille de trois ans. Un parcours bouleversant. L'accouchement, la mise au monde d'une âme innocente, la voir grandir, faire ses premiers pats, dire ses premiers mots, m'appeler ''mamma''. Parfois il est difficile de croire que moi qui menais auparavant une vie tranquille est devenue déjà maman.

Selon mon expérience la maternité est l'une des expérience les plus émouvante que j'ai vécu. La photographie et ma petite fille étant ce qui m'est de plus cher au monde  , je me suis décidé de me lancer dans une aventure qui me tient fort a coeur.

 Photographier les parcours passionnants , de mères a travers l'Europe avec un livre photographique sur combien viens a changer la maternité.

  • Je veux faire un voyage avec ma petit fille de 3 ans pour rencontrer des mères en 14 nation européen et vous vous donner pour Noël notre PHOTOBOOK de portait plain des histoire dure, intense, marron, émotionnant.

Le Project:

Le Voyage en 14 nation européen et la publication du Photo Book pour la fin du 2015

On a besoin de vous pour:

Le voyage nous porterais en Lampedusa, Suisse, Allemagne, Pays Bas, Norvège, Estonie, Scozia, Irlande, Portugal, Malte, Grèce, Roumanie, Italie.

On a déjà le contact, mais on lasse ouvert la possibilité d'ajouter o changer quelque itinéraire.

Le  16.000 euro :

20% cout de production 

40% cout du voyage et logement 

30% cout di edition photo book

10% cout pour le traduction  


C'est un occasion unique pour réfléchir sur sujet important et si on arriverais pas  a l'objectif le livre viendrais réalisé  ! 

Des autre façon de contribuer 

Reste en contact sur le réseaux sociaux 

Partager mon project avec un simple click 

N'importe qui tu est si tu as lire jusque ici, Merci Bien! 

_____________________________Versione Italiana________________________________

Buongiorno! 

Aiutami a raccontare storie forti, di madri comuni.

Sono una donna, una mamma sola, una fotografa, una narratrice..                              Mi chiamo Giorgia e voglio raccontarvi la mia storia e quella di molte altre donne in un Viaggio Fotografico, che attraversando l'Europa metterà in evidenza com'è cambiata la maternità ai giorni nostri. 

Col vostro contributo realizzerò un Libro Fotografica che racchiuderà il viaggio, migliaia di chilometri e centinaia di storie per raccontare com'è cambiato il modo di vivere ed interpretare l'essere madre.

  • Voglio intraprendere IL VIAGGIO CON LA MIA BAMBINA, andare ad incontrare le madri in diverse nazioni europee e regalarvi per natale in nostro libro con le nostre storie forti, dissacranti, divertenti, intense. 

    Per secoli ci è stato detto che una donna si sarebbe realizzata solo nella maternità per poi convincerci che l'indipendenza passasse dal non avere vincoli neanche di sangue. Oggi tante donne han trovato da sole una piacevolissima mediazione, l'equilibrio tra donna e madre. Aiutatemi a mostrarla con il vostro contributo in tutte le sue sfaccettature, siate parte di questo progetto.

Ecco perché ho bisogno di voi:

Il Viaggio ci porterà in Francia, Svizzera, Germania, Olanda, Norvegia, Estonia, Scozia, Irlanda, Portogallo, Malta, Grecia, Romania, Italia e terminerà a Lampedusa!

i 16.000 euro verranno così suddivisi:

20% costi di produzione

40% costi di viaggio ed alloggio 

30% costi di edizione libro

10% costi di traduzione 

E' un occasione unica per riflettere su temi importanti e anche se non dovessimo raggiungere l'intero obbiettivo il libro verrà comunque realizzato ! 

Altri modi per contribuire

Tenerci in contatto sulle risorse sociali 

Segnalarmi storie che a vostro avviso dovrebbero esser raccontate

Condividere la mia campagna con un semplice click

Chiunque tu sia e qualunque sia la tua storia, GRAZIE per aver letto la mia!

A la base j'ai rien de particulier. Italienne de la Sardaigneromantique dans l'âme j'ai toujours adore la photographie. Capturer en un clic tout une histoire, des émotions, des personnages... L'image selon moi peut contenir tout une vie un véritable chamboulement de sentiment.
A l'âge de 24 ans toujours célibataire, déjà installée depuis un bon moment a Bologne, je me lançais dans la vie active en tant que photographe professionnelle.  Avide de nouvelles expériences d'amour et de vie j'ai appris que j'attendais un enfant dans quelques mois. Le destin me réservait apparement beaucoup de surprises! 
Aujourd'hui je me retrouve a Paris avec une petite fille de trois ans. Un parcours bouleversant. L'accouchement, la mise au monde d'une âme innocente, la voir grandir, faire ses premiers pats, dire ses premiers mots, m'appeler ''mamma''. Parfois il est difficile de croire que moi qui menais auparavant une vie tranquille est devenue déjà maman.Selon mon expérience la maternité est l'une des expérience les plus émouvante que j'ai vécu. La photographie et ma petite fille étant ce qui m'est de plus cher au monde  , je me suis décidé de me lancer dans une aventure qui me tient fort a coeur. Photographier les parcours passionnants , de mères a travers l'Europe avec un livre photographique sur combien viens a changer la maternité.Je veux faire un voyage avec ma petit fille de 3 ans pour rencontrer des mères en 14 nation européen et vous vous donner pour Noël notre PHOTOBOOK de portait plain des histoire dure, intense, marron, émotionnant.Le Project:Le Voyage en 14 nation européen et la publication du Photo Book pour la fin du 2015On a besoin de vous pour:Le voyage nous porterais en Lampedusa, Suisse, Allemagne, Pays Bas, Norvège, Estonie, Scozia, Irlande, Portugal, Malte, Grèce, Roumanie, Italie.On a déjà le contact, mais on lasse ouvert la possibilité d'ajouter o changer quelque itinéraire.
Le  16.000 euro :
20% cout de production 
40% cout du voyage et logement 

30% cout di edition photo book
10% cout pour le traduction  

C'est un occasion unique pour réfléchir sur sujet important et si on arriverais pas  a l'objectif le livre viendrais réalisé  !

_____________________________Versione Italiana________________________________
Buongiorno! 
Aiutami a raccontare storie forti, di madri comuni.
Sono una donna, una mamma sola, una fotografa, una narratrice..                              Mi chiamo Giorgia e voglio raccontarvi la mia storia e quella di molte altre donne in un Viaggio Fotografico, che attraversando l'Europa metterà in evidenza com'è cambiata la maternità ai giorni nostri. 
Col vostro contributo realizzerò un Libro Fotografica che racchiuderà il viaggio, migliaia di chilometri e centinaia di storie per raccontare com'è cambiato il modo di vivere ed interpretare l'essere madre.
Voglio intraprendere IL VIAGGIO CON LA MIA BAMBINA, andare ad incontrare le madri in diverse nazioni europee e regalarvi per natale in nostro libro con le nostre storie forti, dissacranti, divertenti, intense. 
Per secoli ci è stato detto che una donna si sarebbe realizzata solo nella maternità per poi convincerci che l'indipendenza passasse dal non avere vincoli neanche di sangue. Oggi tante donne han trovato da sole una piacevolissima mediazione, l'equilibrio tra donna e madre. Aiutatemi a mostrarla con il vostro contributo in tutte le sue sfaccettature, siate parte di questo progetto.

Ecco perché ho bisogno di voi:Il Viaggio ci porterà in Francia, Svizzera, Germania, Olanda, Norvegia, Estonia, Scozia, Irlanda, Portogallo, Malta, Grecia, Romania, Italia e terminerà a Lampedusa!i 16.000 euro verranno così suddivisi:
20% costi di produzione
40% costi di viaggio ed alloggio 
30% costi di edizione libro
10% costi di traduzione 
E' un occasione unica per riflettere su temi importanti e anche se non dovessimo raggiungere l'intero obbiettivo il libro verrà comunque realizzato !
